Title: Software Engineer, Vocabulary.com
Description: Millions of people a month use Vocabulary.com to look up definitions and improve their vocabulary through adaptive quizzes, Vocabulary Jam contests, and the annual Vocabulary Bowl, a worldwide competition for students in grades 5 through 12.  We are seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us attain our ambitious plans for Vocabulary.com.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Work with a team of talented engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  2+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language Strong communication skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Modern best practices in Javascript, HTML, and CSS Knowledge of MongoDB and Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Software Engineer, IXL Product
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers with a passion for technology and education to help us build new, innovative products and create more features for our extremely successful educational products.  The IXL Product Engineering team develops the user-facing features of the website and the back-end code that connects these features to our databases and other services. We created and maintain the practice engine, where students answer the questions created by the Content team; Analytics, which turns practice data into actionable information for teachers; the Recommendations area, which suggests skills for students to try next; and much more. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  As a Software Engineer on the IXL Product Engineering team, you will build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI that drive the site. You will find and use the best technologies to add features to our products as well as to create new products. You’ll be involved in all aspects of the development process – including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning. In addition to working with your fellow engineers, you’ll collaborate with other teams to design amazing products that meet the needs of our users, who are students and teachers all over the world.   TECHNOLOGY  Our server-side stack includes Linux, Apache, Java, and Oracle. The front-end code is written in JavaScript, often using React. Title: Software Engineer, Core Technology
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us build and maintain the core infrastructure for our extremely successful educational products.  The Core Technology team is responsible for researching, implementing, and maintaining back-end frameworks and server-side technologies used by our engineers and applications. The team also monitors and ensures all production and development environments are stable and provides support to other team members with the whole development cycle. Source control, the build and runtime system, as well as deployments, are all responsibilities of the Core Technology team.  As a Software Engineer on our Core Technology team, you’ll work closely with our product teams and have visibility to all parts of our code and products, focusing on performance, uptime, scalability, and reliability. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Design, build, and maintain scalable and robust infrastructure and services for all of our products Participate in live performance monitoring, which includes building the tools that allow us to detect and address trouble spots Troubleshoot and fix production performance and security issues Develop tools, procedures, and documentation to improve team efficiency   TECHNOLOGY  The Core Technology team contributes to our Java-based code base, especially for back-end code, as well as configuring our web stack (Apache, Tomcat, Struts, Hibernate). Our servers run RedHat Linux and some amount of administration is done on the systems. We use a variety of storage technologies, which we configure and run, including Cassandra, Oracle, Redis, S3, and Zookeeper. Python and Perl scripting are used extensively for our build and deployment systems. An ever-increasing portion of our infrastructure is moving to EC2. So, AWS technologies are also utilized. We use Jenkins and crontab for CI. We investigate and implement new technologies all the time, and this list is always growing.  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline 2+ years of experience in software engineering Knowledge of Release Management Excellent programming skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. Title: Software engineer to join startup matching unemployed with careers
Compensation: 110-150K/year DOE.  This is a contract-to-hire position.  (We we are currently in the process of fundraising)
Description: We are seeking a backend engineer (or full stack engineer) for our next big project. Our current site is built on a LAMP stack (Laravel/Linux, Apache, MySQL using PHP 8/OOP code). Everything is hosted by Amazon Web Services using Auth0 as a remote authentication service. We need to rebuild a new site using JS with node.js/express.js talking to mongo DB (using Mongoose ODM) exposing microservices to a React.js app. We will be using AWS Cognito for authentication.  Although most of our server infrastructure remains traditional linux based, it will utilize AWS Lambda (serverless architecture and deployment) for some backend jobs to run on exposed lambda APIs.  We will have our current and next site directly help the unemployed, veterans parolees, students and people in-between careers or COVID unemployed get matched by a proven psychometrically short color test. This is a remote position only during a three month contract period during COVID, once COVID is resolved and the country reaches heard immunity, it will be an in-house role in our offices somewhere on Santana Row. As mentioned, this will be a contract-to-hire position to start with for the first three months - we want to make sure you are a good fit as we want to build a great culture. We we are currently in the process of fundraising (series A or angel investment).   Benefits incl - (Medical, Dental, Vision etc.)  Education budget  Flexable time  Flexable day  6hr workday (after contract)  Every third Friday off  Paid Bail if arrested for peaceful protesting (Human rights, Gay Rights, Racial rights, Environmental rights)  Profit-sharing program

Title: Software Engineer (Full Stack) - Education Equity Startup (3rd hire!)
Description: We are building a platform for equity - join us! We're looking for a full stack engineer to join our core team. As our 2nd developer and 3rd FTE hire, you'll have a major role in shaping our vision, strategy, culture, product, and code.  APPLY  https://jobs.lever.co/avela/53a20cb0-ae0d-4821-a850-c31a40804312?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=Craigslist  COMPANY  Avela is a platform for organizations and governments to run markets to equitably allocate resources and opportunities. Learn more at https://avela.org/.  Our mission is to more equitably and efficiently distribute opportunity. We believe the right person in the right position will change the world. And similarly, the right opportunity or school for the right individual could change their live.  Our clients use our tool to match individuals to these opportunities. Examples include assigning students to schools, graduate students to fieldwork, medical residents to hospitals, patients to treatments or doctors, employees to teams, consultants to clients, volunteers to projects, etc. Before Avela, these opportunities were allocated through a combination of manual processes, spreadsheets, and trial-and-error - rife with implicit bias and questionable outcomes.   TEAM  We are a passionate team of entrepreneurs, engineers, economists, and data scientists - get to know us at https://avela.org/team.    PRODUCT  The Avela platform is a web dashboard that uses Nobel Prize winning algorithms to equitably allocate opportunity given a set of preferences and configuration. We’re expanding our capabilities to offer a set of algorithms for various use cases, and to leverage machine learning to infer preferences and recommend matches.    ROLE  We are an early-stage startup looking for our second engineering member, and can only consider candidates with 4+ years of experience at this time. We offer higher equity and a lower salary than a larger company.  As the second technical hire, you have an opportunity to influence the vision of the product and culture we are creating together. Come build something out of nothing with us!   RESPONSIBILITIES  -- Develop groundbreaking software: Establish the technical architecture and guidelines for a scalable application. -- Develop the back-end and front-end of the first MVP with your preferred stack. -- Explore product-market fit: Explore product-market opportunities and co-create products with our  customers. We’ll work directly with our customers in early pilots to build early prototypes and MVPs.  We’ll constantly iterate and expand our base until we’ve landed on a groundbreaking product that we can sell to thousands of school districts and impact millions of students. -- Partner to grow our customer base and delight our customers: Help promote and sell our products, including joining or leading sales conversations, developing and leading customer demos, helping to create product marketing collateral, and more. Offering technical support for our customers. Until we grow our customer success team, we’ll need help from the entire engineering team to support our customers with technical issues.   QUALIFICATIONS  -- 4+ years of experience building software -- 4+ years front-end development experience with modern JS development frameworks (React / Vue / Angular) -- 4+ years back-end development experience, relational database modeling -- Testing / CI / CD -- Machine learning experience a plus -- Startup experience a plus -- Enterprise software / B2B experience a plus -- Passion for education, equity, or social impact -- Entrepreneurial spirit and drive -- Growth mindset and desire to constantly improve -- Legal ability to work in the US, based in the USA.   TECH STACK  -- ReactJS frontend -- Ruby on Rails JSON API -- Postgres database -- AWS CDK (IaC) in Typescript -- AWS ECS, RDS, Lambda, Amplify   LOCATION  We are a flexible, remote-friendly culture. This role will work closely with customers, so we prefer candidates living in the Americas or willing to work continental US hours. #LI-Remote   BENEFITS   Significant equity, passionate team, flexible work policies, and full health benefits. Learn more at avela.org/careers.   APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS  Do not email. Please apply online at: https://jobs.lever.co/avela/53a20cb0-ae0d-4821-a850-c31a40804312?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=Craigslist

Title: Part-time REMOTE Coding Tutors (Highschool AP Comp. Sci min req.)
Description: Are you an energetic individual with decent coding and/or game dev experience?  No matter how beginner or advanced, we'll always pair you with students with a similar skill level with an interest in the technologies that you know!   Currently we are looking specifically for individuals with one(or more) of the following:    * Roblox/Minecraft gaming and development/modding experience. C#/Unity/Godot and other Game Dev or coding experience is a plus, not a requirement!  * Python / Javascript / Web dev. / Etc. other general programming experience * Scratch  * FUN with kids! You'll have opportunities to train and resources to become a better coder, but we cannot train fun!  Who We Are ---------------- theCoderSchool is an after-school drop-off program for kids learning to code. We provide a fun, energetic, and inspirational environment to bring out that inner hacker in all kids! The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.  http://pleasanton.thecoderschool.com  Job Summary ----------------- You will teach the incredible kids of our community how to code - and how to think like a coder - and be rewarded with an amazing experience. You'll build fun projects with them, teaching them   This is a part-time position for anywhere from 5-15 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule and availability.  These hours can generally be sometime between 2-8 pm weekdays and 9am - 4 pm on Saturday or Sunday.   Responsibilities ------------------- A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code.  We teach students One-on-one or one-on-two coding lessons for kids. Younger students will be taught in Scratch, while older students gravitate towards more advanced platforms. The kids will generally create projects that you decide with them and generally follow our curriculum.

Title: Product Management Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech. You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=sfproduct&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Senior Implementation Specialist (remote)
Compensation: Depends on experience; health and dental benefits, 401k matching, PTO
Description: Thrive with Agiloft  Are you an experienced Senior Implementer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?  Agiloft is looking for Implementers that thrive working in a fast-paced organization with interesting business challenges requiring smart solutions.  Why Join Agiloft?   Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant. Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years. The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row. Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization. Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies. Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.   As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards over achievement.  Position Overview  This individual has developed a level of understanding of the system’s capabilities that allows him or her to lead large-scale implementation projects. This role plays a leadership function within the project, serving as the leader of project design and assisting with project management duties where required.  A Senior Implementer has honed the necessary speed, accuracy, and design skills to independently design highly complex Agiloft systems. This is a challenging position, requiring the individual to have a strong analytical and logical mind, proven ability to communicate with customers and a team, and excellent attention to detail.  Job Responsibilities   Independently design highly complex Agiloft systems for customers Lead large scale, highly complex projects both in implementation and in customer communication Oversee and provide constructive feedback for junior implementers assisting with projects Participate as a lead or co-lead of Enterprise projects, in partnership with Architects Skillfully handle difficult customers with complex business requirements by: Anticipating and resolving complex escalations Holding complex discussions with clients Negotiating change orders and change requests of a medium size Handle initial escalation calls Provide quality control for senior implementer-led projects Write detailed specifications and test plans that can be built and performed by more junior implementers or partners Contribute to internal projects as needed   Required Qualifications   Technical background (with a preference for a 4-year college degree) 4-8 years working as an implementer or demonstrated experience equivalent Strong analytical skills, creativity, familiarity with web-based technologies, and the ability to continuously improve an individual’s implementation skills Ability to manage projects of high complexity, complex business requirements, and/or difficult customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Mentorship skills to provide guidance and feedback for junior implementers Ability to lead business calls to discuss project progress, handle escalation calls, and negotiate change orders Initiative in seeking ways to contribute to the success of the company that goes beyond a narrow definition of job responsibilities Experience with database concepts and web-based technologies is a plus Prior experience with LegalTech in general and with Contract Title: Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor (Night Shifts)  | $80k - $84k

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations, or a related field, or equivalent work experience2+ years of operations experience in a supervisory roleA proven record of effective project and people managementStrong analytical and decision-making abilitiesExcellent written and verbal communicationHighly organized with acute attention to detailComfortable with computers and various software/appsAbility to travel as neededAbility to work outdoors in various weather conditions as neededPassion for technology and autonomous vehiclesMust be 21+ years of age Working Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to,  bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 25 lbs. The ability to work outdoors in various weather conditions is required. Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent position through HireArt and based in San Francisco, CA. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   About Transdev We are the largest private provider of multiple modes of transport in North America.Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities contract with us to operate their transportation systems. Our goal is to help our clients provide transit systems that are appealing, convenient, integrated networks that people actively choose to ride. In cities all across the country, we’re helping our clients move toward making public transit equivalent to the city’s lifeblood, circulating and connecting riders to the people and places they care about.We are part of a global company, Transdev, operating in 17 countries on five continents. Title: Winery Inventory Data Specialist
Description: PLEASE USE THE FOLLOWING LINK TO APPLY: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=ob0nffwx&s=Craigslist  POSITION SUMMARY:  Under direct management of the Bulk Inventory Supervisor and dotted line to the Skylane Business Operations Manager, this position is primarily responsible for the Skylane Winery and Bottling Bulk Inventory Management System work order data entry and records maintenance.  Additionally, this position will also provide back-up for our Payroll Timekeeping (Kronos), as well as perform general administrative duties, including shipping, ordering, and some facility management.    This role is a full-time position requiring 40 hours per week.    BIMS DATA CLERK - ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES (60-70%):  •                Data entry and audit entry of cellar work orders and weigh tag information into the Bulk Inventory Management System (BIMS)  •                Maintain inventory records, daily yield reports, fermentation reports, harvest yield.  •                Track and keep records for all wine movements and transfers, ensuring compliance of BOL  •                Create special reports and spreadsheets  •                Assist in monthly BATF report (702)  •                Bottling and case goods record keeping data entry  •                Print barrel barcode stickers and track of barrel inventory  •                Assist production, winemaking and bottling staff in administrative functions and special projects as needed      PAYROLL BACK-UP - ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES (10%):  •Acts as back-up support to the Skylane payroll specialist to include the following duties adhering to CA state and employment wage and hours laws:  Enters employee time off requests, missed punch and meal penalty forms for bi-weekly payroll through the Kronos Timekeeping System Reviews and audits timesheets •Maintain employee attendance records with vacation, sick, and Leave of Absence requests              Receives, audits and distributes bi-weekly paychecks Understand and is able to communicate to winery employees company paid guidelines as well as basic wage and hour requirements    ADMINSTRATIVE ASSISTANT - ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES (20-30%):  Orders general office and breakroom supplies ensuring adequate inventory Establish and maintains well organized office systems and protocols Maintains common areas in the Kittyhawk administration building and keeps all 7 winery breakrooms well organized and fully supplied Retrieves and distributes incoming mail, receives and notifies employees of package deliveries Assists with Safety Program requirements and record keeping Assists Business Operations Manager with special projects and events including catering & rental orders, etc.   REPORTING TO THIS POSITION:   N/A    JOB REQUIREMENTS:  Essential Skills, Experience, and Education  Detail oriented with strong computer skills  Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently Strong math and Microsoft Excel skills Good communication skills, both oral & written Well organized, focused, professional demeanor with a high sense of urgency for timeliness and accuracy Previous database and/or winery related experience is preferred Must be willing to work flexible hours including overtime and varying shifts and must be willing to work the harvest season  PLEASE USE THE FOLLOWING LINK TO APPLY: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=ob0nffwx&s=Craigslist

Title: Software Programmer Analyst II/III
Compensation: Software Programmer Analyst II ($73,500 - $100,380); III ($81,203 - $110,905); CalPERS Retirement; Comprehensive Benefits Package
Description: County of Monterey, Information Technology Department Software Programmer II/III  (Applications  & Customer Support Division)  Salary, plus a comprehensive benefits package (including PERS Pension) : • Software Programmer Analyst II ($73,500 - $100,380 / Annually) • Software Programmer Analyst Ill ($81,203 - $110,905 / Annually)   Apply by: Priority screen date May 7, 2021. Open until filled.   The Information Technology Department (ITD) consists of four operational divisions: Administration; Applications & Customer Support; Infrastructure & Operations; and Information Security. ITD resources are operated and maintained in a manner that supports high availability for utilization and minimizes the risk of business interruption. ITD's focus is on developing a sustainable, customer focused environment to enhance and improve the quality of technology services used by County departments for the benefit of all Monterey County residents, businesses, and visitors.   The Applications & Customer Support Division of ITD is currently seeking an experienced Software Programmer Analyst II/III to provide development and production support for the County's enterprise and custom business applications. The incumbent will be responsible for supporting commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) applications, developing software integration and complex reports, researching, analyzing and troubleshooting issues, and supporting the nightly scheduled batch cycles. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in application development/ implementation, system integration, report development, production support, and have expertise in SQL Server (T-SQL), Power Bl, Business Objects, PowerShell, and other Microsoft development platforms. The successful candidate will be able to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment, learn and develop technical solutions to business problems, and effectively partner with vendors, appropriate business Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), leaders, other IT teams like Infrastructure, Operations and security teams to meet or exceed customer expectations.  To apply and view the online job flyer visit the Monterey County website: https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/montereycounty  In order to be considered, you must submit the required application materials. Resumes, cover letters, letters of interest, or other correspondence will not be accepted in lieu of the required application materials.  EOE

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations, or a related field, or equivalent work experience2+ years of operations experience in a supervisory roleA proven record of effective project and people managementStrong analytical and decision-making abilitiesExcellent written and verbal communicationHighly organized with acute attention to detailComfortable with computers and various software/appsAbility to travel as neededAbility to work outdoors in various weather conditions as neededPassion for technology and autonomous vehiclesMust be 21+ years of age Working Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to,  bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 25 lbs. The ability to work outdoors in various weather conditions is required. Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent position through HireArt and based in San Francisco, CA. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   About Transdev We are the largest private provider of multiple modes of transport in North America.Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities contract with us to operate their transportation systems. Our goal is to help our clients provide transit systems that are appealing, convenient, integrated networks that people actively choose to ride. In cities all across the country, we’re helping our clients move toward making public transit equivalent to the city’s lifeblood, circulating and connecting riders to the people and places they care about.We are part of a global company, Transdev, operating in 17 countries on five continents.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply

Title: Research Software Engineer | $90 - $110 per hour
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/88f4a947/apply   HireArt is helping Toyota Research Institute (TRI) hire a Research Software Engineer to support the ingestion of data from 3rd party platforms used by the team to collect human subject's data. The ideal candidate will be interested in and have previous experience with supporting the collection and analysis of human subject's data.This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 1-year contract position based in Los Altos, CA. This position will be fully remote until offices reopen.As Research Software Engineer, you will: Support ingestion of data from 3rd party platforms used by the team to collect human subjects data (eg Qualtrics). Help with scripts to clean or reformat data and move into appropriate AWS infrastructure. Support data subsampling, data partitioning, data versioning, and remote access.Support ML model training and experiments. Launch instances in parallel, initialize the environment, set configuration for the experiment, retrieve job results, terminate instances (and tooling to do the above)Assist with the development of prototypes to support human subject's data collection such as developing or instrumenting custom web apps (front and back end).  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/88f4a947/apply   Requirements Bachelors or Masters degree (or equivalent work experience) in computer science or related engineering disciplinesInterest supporting the collection and analysis of human subjects dataAWS experience - launching EC2 instances, hosting data in AWS, etc.Experience with machine learning libraries (PyTorch preferred, TensorFlow/Keras, OpenCV, etc)Experience with front/back end web development (Javascript, Python)Interest in the overlap between technology and the behavioral sciencesDetail-oriented and able to work independently as well as in groupsAble to collaborate with cross-disciplinary teamsProactive and seek out new opportunities for impact, as time permits.Strong verbal and written communication skills and comfortable giving and receiving feedbackStrong time management and prioritization abilitiesA prototyping mindset - building solutions that are “good enough” to answer a steady stream of scientific questionsPreferred QualificationsExperience developing and training new machine learning modelsExperience applying ML to human subjects dataExperience developing mobile appsInterest in contributing to scientific publications Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 1-year contract position staffed via HireArt and based in Los Altos, CA. This position will be fully remote until offices reopen.HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/88f4a947/apply   About Toyota Research Institute At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us.   If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/88f4a947/apply

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Multiple)
Description: Instacart seeks multiple Senior Machine Learning Engineer’s in San Francisco, California.  Responsibilities: Design and develop machine learning models and complex algorithms to extend and enhance software products for Instacart’s technology stack; optimize machine learning software using algorithmic data analysis, statistical modeling, and A/B testing; implement highly-scalable solutions to improve shopper logistics, fulfillment metrics, search optimization, and related functions of the Instacart platform; analyze large datasets and perform software testing to determine necessary changes or improvements to scale consumer and enterprise data products; establish and document engineering protocols for artificial intelligence and machine learning best practices to ensure efficiency, quality, and scalability throughout development; and perform other duties as assigned.  Education: Master’s* degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related (or foreign equivalent).  Requirements: 2 years of experience in the job offered or related position. Other special requirements include: 2 years of experience working with Python or Java; 2 years of experience working with scikit-learn, XGBoost, Keras/Tensorflow, or similar machine learning tools; 2 years of experience working with SQL, Spark, Pandas, or similar data manipulation tools; and 2 years of experience applying statistical and machine learning solutions on a scalable platform to real-world applications.  *In lieu of a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related (or foreign equivalent) and 2 years of experience in the job offered or related position, employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related (or foreign equivalent) and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or related position.  Qualified applicants must mail resumes Attn: HR — Global Mobility to 50 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA94105 quoting job #SML110.

Title: Senior Devops Engineer - 1+PB Storage (FT/Remote)
Description: Apply Now: https://exavault.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=7 We're a bunch of engineers building a next-generation managed file transfer service, and we need to find an experienced DevOps guy/gal to help us. We're not starting from scratch - we've already got customers in more than a hundred countries - including names like Adobe, Chevron, Lockheed Martin & Zillow. Check out www.exavault.com. This is DevOps in the true sense of the word. We believe in 'configuration as code' -- almost all of our physical systems are provisioned via chef, and we use docker to build and deploy our application and associated services. As with any DevOps job, there's going to be some ops -- doing things like tuning and tweaking the database servers -- but much of it will be the dev part: building out our configuration management system, improving our docker images, improving our deployment process, writing tests for all of that, and more. We're looking for a leader -- someone who is technically gifted, but also has the business side & soft skills to ultimately be the DevOps manager, interfacing with the rest of the team, including senior leadership, on planning our infrastructure roadmap. In a bit more detail:  You'll work with our senior technical staff to run all of the day-to-day operations of our systems. Unlike most companies, we use our own custom-built bare-metal hardware -- built using many of the concepts pioneered by Backblaze in the B2 storage pod. You'll think about the big picture -- what do we need next year, in three years, and in five years. What technologies are coming that we need to pay attention to? You'll deal with the hands-on -- maintaining and grow our chef configuration management system, our docker containerization system, and VMWare virtual machine environment. And you'll constantly keep one eye on the future, figuring out if we need to replace any of those with something else. You'll maintain and improve our Icinga monitoring system, which keeps a watchful eye on the performance of our systems. You'll handle the network layer too, managing our redundant juniper switching fabric and our pfsense firewalls. Yes, there will be pager duty with this job. We rotate pager duty -- you get one week on and one week off.  That's a lot, we know. This is the sort of job where the challenge will be different every day, and you'll rarely find yourself doing the same thing twice. Requirements Now, in terms of what we're looking for from you:  You should definitely have done this stuff before. 'DevOps is new(ish), and we don't much care if you've come from the dev side or the ops side, but today you should be fluent in both. You should be just as comfortable stringing a bunch of awk, grep, and cut commands together as you are discussing the finer points of class inheritance. There's no magic number of years that you should have under your belt, but this isn't a junior position, so if you haven't been doing this type of work full-time for at least 5-7 years, this might not be the right role for you. You should have a good business head on your shoulders. This position isn't all technical -- you'll need to understand the business case for what we're doing and make decisions and recommendations based on the larger business goals of the company. You should be very experienced with things like CentOS, chef, Docker, GlusterFS, Python, PHP, Node, HAProxy, pfSense, MySQL. We don't expect you to literally have in-depth experience with all of those, but you should be hitting at least several. Of course, there's all the standard stuff. You need to be a nice person. You need to communicate well. You need to be able to work remotely, with a team around the world. You need to be enough of a morning person that you can get on a call as early as 9 am PT ( noon ET ). We know DevOps folks often like to work late, and that's OK, but you should be roughly available during the business day.  ExaVault Offers... We offer an excellent set of benefits to our full-time employees:  A competitive salary. Fully paid Health, Dental & Vision coverage. We offer United Healthcare's 'Gold' level plans, which is a premium plan. 401K w/ 4% employer match. Paid company trips. In 2019 we went to Sydney Australia and Athens, Greece. The year before that we went to Barcelona, Spain. (OK, admittedly we're not doing these during COVID. But COVID's almost over, and soon we're gonna be back on a plane.) Two weeks of vacation per year, plus the ‘Christmas Shutdown’ (below). Christmas Shutdown – Except for ‘keeping the lights on’ operational duties, the company shuts down (with full pay) for the week between Christmas and New Years. 10 Paid Holidays. Flexible work arrangements. As long as you’re available throughout the business day, we’re flexible about how/when/where you work. A $2000/year ‘office outfitting credit’. This may be saved up to three years and can be used for new equipment for your workspace. Education reimbursement. We'll pay for the classes and conferences you want to take.  Workplace Flexibility ExaVault is headquartered in San Ramon, CA. We've been remote since before it was cool, and have employees throughout the US, Europe & Asia. Take a look at your potential future teammates on our about us page. Some of us work from home, some from co-working spaces, and some from coffee shops or other locations. You should have a quiet, professional, distraction-free workspace (either at home or elsewhere) from which to work; we'll pay for a membership to a co-working space if you'd like. A note on applying from David, the CEO Online job postings are a little bit like online dating sites. There are thousands of people out there, all with great skills. There are also thousands of jobs, all great opportunities. We need to find the one person who's the right fit for us... the right skills, the right mindset... somebody who will fit into our culture. You (hopefully) need to find the one job that's right for you: something where you're as excited to go to work on the 1000th day as you are on the 1st day. So how do we meet each other? The signal-to-noise ratio on the Internet is low. This is probably the 100th job post you've looked at, and we get hundreds of candidates every time we put up a listing like this. I have a proposal: I've tried to share a lot about our company and our culture in this post, and on our website, and elsewhere. Do a little homework on us. After that, if this job really, truly excites you, and you think you'd be great at it, tell me why in your cover letter. I don't need to know that you worked at 'ACME, Inc.' for ten years -- I can get that from your resume. And I don't need to know that you're 'professional, responsive and detail-oriented. Everybody says that. I'm reading every submission personally, and what I really need to know is who you are, what you can do, and why you think this would be awesome. You should apply using the button on this page, but if you have questions about the job or just want to make an extra pitch for yourself, my email is david.ordal -at- exavault.com I'm a real person, and you are too. Let's start there.

Title: UI / UX Designer + Developer - Yes: We're Looking For Both (FT/Remote)
Description: Apply Now: https://exavault.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=3 We're a bunch of engineers building a next-generation file transfer service, and we need another UI / UX expert. This is a combo position -- we want somebody that can put together a mad UI but also has the ability to actually build what they design. Old school, you know? We've got clients from Adobe to Zillow, and everyone in between — check out www.exavault.com. We look to companies like Apple, Square, and Twitter, with great technology, great design, and simple, well-thought out feature sets. (And yes, we all use Macs.) We care about doing things right, creating a quality product, and building the best user experience possible. If you care about the same things, we want to talk. You'll be working on our web app, our website, and a number of internal applications. Our app stack is a modern one -- we run react.js on the frontend and node.js on the backend. Your day-to-day will be working with our existing design and engineering team, which is about eight people. You'll collaborate with one other front-end developer, as well as with some very talented backend and DevOps engineers. Requirements  First and foremost, you should have an excellent eye for design. You should know great web UI when you see it, and be able to explain why it's great (even if you didn't create it!). You should have strong listening and ideation skills and be able to produce elegant mockups with multiple design directions to present to teams after discovering their needs. You should be able to at least touch on the product management side of things -- discussing needs with users and designing solutions to fit their needs. You should have a strong knowledge of HTML5/CSS, and ideally some of the modern frameworks like ReactMUI or TailwindsUI. You should be able to build out whatever you design. JavaScript/React experience is not required, but certainly welcome. Of course, we're looking for self-starters - candidates who can jump in quickly without a lot of direction, and learn by asking the right questions. Previous experience working in a startup is a plus too, although not required. Finally, you should have a solid portfolio of web application design. We want to see that you've built great web interfaces before, not just great websites.  ExaVault Offers... For our full-time employees, we offer:  A competitive salary. Fully paid Health, Dental & Vision coverage. We offer United Healthcare's 'Gold' level plans, which is a premium plan (US Candidates Only). 401K w/ 4% employer match (US Candidates Only). Paid company trips. Last year we went to Sydney, Australia, and Athens, Greece. The year before that we went to Barcelona, Spain. Two weeks of vacation per year, plus the ‘Christmas Shutdown’ (below). Christmas Shutdown – Except for ‘keeping the lights on’ operational duties, the company shuts down (with full pay) for the week between Christmas and New Years. Up to ten paid holidays. Flexible work arrangements. As long as you’re available throughout the business day, we’re flexible about how/when/where you work. A $2000/year ‘office outfitting credit’. This may be saved up to three years and can be used for new equipment for your workspace. Education reimbursement. We'll pay for the classes and conferences you want to take.  Workplace Flexibility ExaVault is headquartered in San Ramon, CA. We've been remote since before it was cool, and have employees throughout the US, Europe & Asia. Take a look at your potential future teammates on our about us page. Some of us work from home, some from co-working spaces, and some from coffee shops or other locations. You should have a quiet, professional, distraction-free workspace (either at home or elsewhere) from which to work; we'll pay for a membership to a co-working space if you'd like. A note on applying from David, the CEO Online job postings are a little bit like online dating sites. There are thousands of people out there, all with great skills. There are also thousands of jobs, all great opportunities. We need to find the one person who's the right fit for us... the right skills, the right mindset... somebody who will fit into our culture. You (hopefully) need to find the one job that's right for you: something where you're as excited to go to work on the 1000th day as you are on the 1st day. So how do we meet each other? The signal-to-noise ratio on the Internet is low. This is probably the 100th job post you've looked at, and we get hundreds of candidates every time we put up a listing like this. I have a proposal: I've tried to share a lot about our company and our culture in this post, and on our website, and elsewhere. Do a little homework on us. After that, if this job really, truly excites you, and you think you'd be great at it, tell me why in your cover letter. I don't need to know that you worked at 'ACME, Inc.' for ten years -- I can get that from your resume. And I don't need to know that you're 'professional, responsive and detail-oriented. Everybody says that. I'm reading every submission personally, and what I really need to know is who you are, what you can do, and why you think this would be awesome. You should apply using the link on this page, but if you have questions about the job or just want to make an extra pitch for yourself, my email is david.ordal -at- exavault.com I'm a real person, and you are too. Let's start there.

Title: Code Coach (remote) at theCoderSchool Fremont
Description: Who We Are ---------------- theCoderSchool is an after-school program for kids learning to code. We provide a fun, energetic, and inspirational environment to bring out that inner hacker in all kids! The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.  http://fremont.thecoderschool.com  Job Summary ----------------- theCoderSchool is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world!  You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code - and how to think like a coder - and be rewarded with an amazing experience.   This is a part-time position for anywhere from 6-20 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule and availability.  These hours can generally be sometime between 3-8 pm weekdays and 10 am - 5 pm on Saturday or Sunday.   Responsibilities ------------------- A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code. We teach students One-on-one or one-on-two coding lessons for kids. Younger students will be taught in Scratch, while older students gravitate towards more advanced platforms. The kids will generally create projects that you decide with them and generally follow our curriculum.    This position rocks because you will: • Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to be the next generation of coders! • Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the Bay Area. • Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology • Have the flexibility to teach what you're most comfortable with and learn new things along the way  Requirements ----------------- What do we want from you? Read on.  • PASSION. All caps! This is all about giving back to the kids. We need to see goosebumps when your student ROCKS a code challenge.  • Great Communicator. There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course, patience is a virtue when it comes to kids!  • Street Cred. Our college-level Code Coaches will have Comp Sci or Engineering or a similar major at a nearby accredited school. Our Veteran Code Coaches will have relevant industry experience.  • Coding Skills. Strong grasp of general technologies, proficient coder and uber-logical thinker. General knowledge of Python, Javascript and Web development are most helpful. Deep technical skills aren't required - we prefer you to communicate well and find answers along with students than knowing everything up front.   Sounds awesome? Send us a message with your cover letter and Resume.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Compensation: Commensurate with education and experience, W-2, 1099, or C2C, must be in US without sponsorship
Description: Sierra Cybernetics is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to support our state government client – the Judicial Council of California in downtown San Francisco.   You will migrate and build web pages for Judicial Branch web properties.    You must have a content design, content strategy and content production background because you will work directly with subject matter experts to prepare content for the web, in support of The Trial Courts Modernization Project, the statewide Self Represented Litigants (SRL) Digital Services Project, and the overall content strategy for public-facing Judicial Council websites.  Your background must include Drupal, user experience, usability, and design experience.  This is expected to be a three year full-time assignment, starting approximately May 17, 2021.  You will work remotely until the COVID19 restrictions are lifted; then downtown at the JCC offices thereafter.  Minimum Job-Specific Skills/Qualifications Required (in order of relative importance):  • Proven track record of day-to-day operational support using content management systems, RedDot/OpentText and Drupal 8 preferred.  • Proven track record of understanding content production, design, and the benefits of its user-needs approach.  • Proven track record writing and editing content for the web.  • Proven track record delivering web content on-time, on-budget with a high degree of user satisfaction and quality.  • Proven track record of analytical capabilities and the ability to breakdown complex ideas into manageable pieces.  • Proven track record of content creation and publication; Excellent web writing skills, based on user needs.  • Proven track record of written and verbal communication skills, with both technical and non-technical audiences.  • Proven track record organizing and coordinating multiple work activities.  • Proven track record at establishing and maintaining effective working relationships.  • Excellent understanding of UX, UI Design, and web analysis, with an emphasis on user research • Excellent understanding of information architecture, taxonomy, usability, and accessibility. • Experience with Web, HTML, Bootstrap, and other coding languages a plus • Experienced managing web content requests, preferably through an inbox or other sources. • Experienced with publishing workflows, archiving and content maintenance. • Experienced working on content analyses and design, developing content project plans, and providing liaison between business units and Web developers.  • Experienced with enterprise wide content strategy, production initiatives, and implementations.  • Experienced developing useful, usable content, detailed content analysis reports, and working within digital service content standards.   • Experienced working with project schedules, identifying deliverables, milestones, and timelines for assigned projects.  • Experienced identifying and exploring new or alternate technologies, as assigned. Ability to seek opportunities for innovation by following trends and developments in the areas of web content and user experience.  • Ability to develop mock-ups, wireframes, with content organization skills to meet business needs and objectives.  • Ability to assess and evaluate situations and identify creative problem-solving solutions  • Ability to communicate effectively in English, orally and in writing.  • Great understanding of web analytics, metadata and SEO.  • Great inter-personal skills, flexible can-do attitude, and drive for continuous improvement.  • Proficiency with MS Office applications including Word, Excel, Project, and Visio  • Familiar with agile project management methodologies.  • Familiar with research, quantitative and qualitative data skills, with expertise in usability studies, including the facilitation of user testing, interviews, surveys, and other research methodologies. • Knowledge of digital government and digital government strategies. • Knowledge of web technologies, front-end development, and back-end development • Knowledge of web analytics, metadata, and SEO. • Ability to identify and evaluate alternative solutions, costs and benefits. • Ability to communicate effectively in English, orally and in writing. • Ability to work with cross functional teams, in fast-paced, agile, collaborative environment • Confidence explaining decisions, analyses and recommendations to stakeholders of varying levels of seniority and digital content knowledge. • Great inter-personal skills, flexible can-do attitude, and drive for continuous improvement. • Proficiency with MS Office applications including Word, Excel, Project, and Visio. • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver. • Proficiency with prototyping tools, Figma preferred.  Additional Skills/Qualifications Desired:  • Recent experience within government agencies or public-sector bodies with projects of a similar type. • Experience in leading multiple work groups simultaneously • Experience with Web, HTML, Bootstrap, and other coding languages • Equivalent to possession of a bachelor’s degree, preferably with major course work in design, UX Design, web analysis, and content strategy.

Title: Senior devops engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a senior and experienced devops engineer to our core team of 10, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in modern/current devops technologies and practices on the AWS platform, including CDK, Lambda, SQS, VPCs, EC2, etc. • Proficient and experienced in CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, infrastructure management, deployment automation, and automated software release • Experienced in developing automated monitoring services and reports to track service, network, and application availability and performance, and to trigger notifications when intervention is needed • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.

Title: Busy lighting shop seeks business/tech-minded intern for short term
Description: If you have a business/tech/project management focus, we would love to meet you!  Our busy lighting workshop is looking for an intern to assist us in making the leap to a new project management system.  Airtable/Quickbooks/Text Expander  We are looking to streamline our processes and reduce wasted time, increase our ability to scale and add in a performance management component.    We have a clear idea of our direction, with most of our system built, and we are open to suggestions you may have once you are oriented. This position would mostly be helping us get everything we need into the new system while the shop is in motion.   If the work is completed before the allotted time, we will move into formatting our SOPs for new and existing team members.  Our ideal candidate will have: - High attention to detail - Good organization - High tolerance for data entry - Experience with spreadsheets - An interest in business and technology  We are a group of creatives and technicians that like to keep it light hearted while working hard to keep up with client deadlines and very detailed, high end projects.    You are free to choose your work session blocks any time during our open hours Tuesday through Friday 9am to 5pm (occasional Mondays okay) and the position is on site at our warehouse in Hunter’s Point, San Francisco.   Pay Rate: $20/hr and 20hrs/wk with a 6 week commitment, starting in May.  Apply via email with the subject line: INTERN Thank you in advance and we look forward to meeting you!

Title: QA Contractor
Description: Please respond with a short paragraph summarizing your recent work history as it relates to this role.  What you'll do:  Build test plans for new features, feature updates and product improvements Set standard for testing best practices on the engineering team Execute tests on our release candidates for web and desktop apps Analyze error trends to identify patterns and root cause systemic issues Analyze product feedback to help us create the best product for our customers Own features through QA testing, design feedback, implementation, and launch Collaborate with our Product, Engineering and Design teams We are looking for people to demonstrate the following experience and skills:  Experience building or testing complex client applications on web, desktop, or mobile a plus Minimum 4 years of experience in Quality Assurance / DevOps / Engineering You're comfortable with automated testing and web monitoring systems such Sentry  About Us  The Company: Tensil is a startup focused on building the product in 2021 Tensil, the company behind Scenery, is redefining how video content is created in today's distributed, connected world. We are building a professional, browser based video editing tool that is as powerful as native applications but with the additional inherent advantages of the web. This involves difficult technical and design challenges that, if you can help solve them, will become distinct advantages. This contract role will be pivotal to bring an innovative, quality product to market. You are joining a small, focused team at an early time, where your contributions will have a major impact on the code, the company and the product.  We strive to create a working environment where we:  Ship products so we can learn from our customers quickly and iterate to better serve them. Work as a team to help each other exceed our individual expectations. Value product and code quality so that our customers can depend on us. Constantly learn and grow collectively and individually inside and outside of work. This full time role can be joined from our SF location or anywhere in the US.    Tensil has raised a series seed round lead by Freestyle.vc with Precursor Ventures, Wireframe Ventures, Transmedia Capital, Rembrandt VC and UpHonest capital participating along with amazing individual investors. We are <10 employees but growing, focused on building and iterating the product through the end of 2020. The founding team are successful 3x entrepreneurs that have also worked at Twitter, Facebook, Yahoo!/Flickr.  How to Apply  Does this role sound like a good fit? Email us at jobs@tensil.io  Include the role's title "QA Contractor" in your subject line. Send along your linkedin or resume as well as links that best showcase the relevant things you've built and done.

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Teacher Analytics
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by over 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Senior Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our IXL Teacher Analytics reporting suite.  The IXL Teacher Analytics Engineering team is responsible for designing and creating the code that powers the analytics reports that thousands of teachers use to support the millions of students who use IXL. These reports are the ultimate tool that provide teachers with the critical data-driven insights that they need in order to help their students succeed. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Work closely with a team of talented full-stack engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products Engage in every aspect of the development process, including designing, coding, documenting, testing, debugging, and performance tuning Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products Design code with scalability in mind as we continue to support an ever-growing number of users  TECHNOLOGY  The technologies that we use include Java, JavaScript, React, Redux, Sass, Highcharts, Git, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Redis, and Kafka.  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  4+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language Strong communication skills Ability to collaborate well in a tight-knit small team Willingness to take ownership and drive initiatives that you are passionate about Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Knowledge of Java, SQL, JavaScript, and/or CSS is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction, and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.    We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.  Click here to apply

Title: Product Manager for Wine Production Software, Remote
Description: InnoVint is a rapidly growing software company, offering the wine industry’s leading wine production software solution. Our cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) solution helps commercial wineries’ wine production, winegrowing, governmental compliance, IT and finance teams efficiently manage the end-to-end operations of a modern, successful winery. From vineyard to bottle to filing mandatory compliance reports with the TTB, InnoVint is modern winemaking reimagined! Watch this 5-minute video for a quick overview of the InnoVint platform in action. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNBBZz08DWY   The Role We’re a passionate team focused on making it easier for winemakers to make great wine and now we’re excited to be hiring our first Product Manager. If you join us, you’ll contribute to our product strategy, orchestrate product execution and help shape our business, culture and internal processes.  An InnoVint Product Manager has a broad scope, but your initial goals will be to augment our small but mighty product design team by improving our design processes around mapping complex winemaking flows into software. You will be an active participant in ideation, goal setting, iteration, and approval of new features, while coordinating these cycles to ensure we’re on schedule and meeting business goals. You will be responsible for scheduling meetings, setting deadlines, collecting feedback, and getting buy in from multiple teams.  You will be stepping into a mature team that’s delivered complex and high-impact features over the last 8 years. Even with this expertise, we know there is a missing piece in our product design team and we’re ready to learn from you. Your job is to amplify the talents of our design team by creating an effective pipeline of product output.  You will establish goals for each feature and ensure those goals are met throughout the design process. You will work closely with the CEO, CTO, UX Lead, our users, and our internal winemakers to establish goals for each feature. You will ensure these goals are being met throughout the design process, while being careful and cognizant to keep the product team aligned and focused.  Beyond leading our product design process, your auxiliary responsibilities will be to work with customers and partners to inform our view of the market. You will work with marketers to go to market with valuable, differentiated offerings and to design and refine our core market positioning, work with sales on strategic accounts, and support our executive team and Board of Directors with pricing and strategic analysis.  An InnoVint Product Manager enables the entire company to execute a strategically differentiated and innovative product and business strategy. It’s a challenging but essential and highly visible, exciting role.   Does the Product Manager Role at InnoVint Excite You? If joining us as our first Product Manager is something that excites you, send us an email to careers@innovint.us. Please read the full job description here: https://www.innovint.us/contact/careers/productmanager/  At InnoVint we value diversity and believe diverse teams make better products and contribute to more successful companies.

Title: Software Engineer - New Grad (CA)
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking new graduates who have a passion for technology and education. You will dive into our code base and immediately contribute to our three extremely impactful educational products and build new, innovative products. You can fine-tune your existing skills and learn new ones as you work on one of our many teams. You’ll be able to work with our Core Technology team in back-end engineering, Front-end group using cutting-edge technologies like React, Mobile team in implementing iOS and Android apps, or our Full-stack teams who seek engineers interested in doing it all.  We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.  TECHNOLOGY  Our server-side stack currently includes Linux, Apache, Java, Scala, Python, and Oracle. For our iOS app development, we use Swift. Our front-end code is written in JavaScript (including the React and D3 libraries, and ES6). Of course, the specific technologies and languages you use will vary by project and according to your own interests or specialization areas.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  As a Software Engineer, you will build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI that engage our users. You will find and use the best technologies to add features and create new products. You’ll be involved in all aspects of the development process – including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning. You will own your projects from start to end as they travel through our fast-paced development cycle. In addition to working with your fellow engineers, you’ll collaborate with other teams to design amazing products that meet the needs of our users, who are students and teachers all over the world.  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams Knowledge of Unix, Python, Java, SQL, JavaScript, or Mobile app development is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

This is a role that fuses both creative and practical concerns, as these engineers are responsible for everything the website user encounters, including scrolling functions and graphics, as well as creating the logic, database interactions and server configuration on the application's backend.  Responsibilities Include:  The development and maintenance of client-side and server-side applications. Working with other web developers as well as marketing teams and engineers to ensure the right look and necessary features are included in your work. Designing tests that will be implemented to keep software functional. Stay on top of expanding technologies and engineering trends.    Companies on Hired apply to you, not the other way around.
