Title: Orange GO Developer
Compensation: Contract rate with a possible convert to salary + equity
Description: Orange is seeking a Go Software Engineer to develop software for our current mobile application backend.  Orange is building a better electric vehicle charging platform for multi-unit dwellings. As an early-stage startup, you will have many responsibilities with direct input on product development and design. All work will be on critical systems essential to support Orange’s EV charging platform’s growth and mission. The current system is built with Go, Flutter, React, and Postgres that is running on Google Cloud managed with Kubernetes.   Responsibilities • Design, implement and deliver end-to-end fully-functional solutions. • Contribute relevant, clean, concise documentation to Orange’s knowledge base to support increased organizational information sharing. • Automate repetitive development tasks. • Evangelize best practices in Software development and Software development lifecycle. • contribute to Go’s growing ecosystem and worn on open source solutions to help both Orange build better products while adding value to other software engineers.   Requirements • 1+ years of experience with GO • 2+ years in application development experience and deployment • RESTful API design & Implementation, • 1+ years experience with API development • B.S. degree in computer science or related fields  • Experience with automated testing, we use CircleCi • Web frontend development experience, using tools such as Flutter, React, etc. • Backend development experience with Go, strong fundamental understanding of the framework.   • 1+ experience with Kubernetes and Docker deployed to the cloud.  • G Cloud or AWS dev ops experience, software as infrastructure experience is a plus. We use Terraform .  • Relational Database knowledge such as MySQL, Postgresql, etc. Experience with real time data in influxdb is a plus.

Title: Orange Frontend Developer
Compensation: Contractor Rate or Salary Options + Equity Available
Description: Orange Frontend Developer   Orange is seeking a Frontend Software Engineer to develop software for our current mobile application and internal tools and portals.  Orange is building a better electric vehicle charging platform for multi-unit dwellings. As an early-stage startup, you will have many responsibilities with direct input on product development and design. All work will be on critical systems essential to support Orange’s EV charging platform’s growth and mission. The current system is built with Go, Flutter, React, and Postgres that is running on Google Cloud Kubernetes cluster.   Responsibilities Design and Build sophisticated and highly scalable apps using Flutter. Build custom packages in Flutter using the functionalities and APIs already available in native Android and IOS. Translate and Build the designs and Wireframes into high quality responsive UI code. Write efficient queries for core Data. Use of Model-View-Controller ( MVC) and Model-View-ViewModel-Controller (MVVM) as it relates to designing, developing architecture and developing maintainable, testable and functional software that meets product requirements. Explore possible architectures for implementing new features. Resolve any problems existing in the system and suggest and add new features in the complete system. Suggest space and time efficient Data Structures. Follow the best practices while developing the app and also keeping everything structured and well documented. Use CI/CD for smooth deployment. Document the project and code efficiently. Manage the code and project on Git in order to keep in sync with other team members and managers. Communicate with the Project Manager regarding status of projects and suggest appropriate deadlines for new functionalities. Ensure security guidelines are always followed while developing the app. Validate the cloud system to ensure any new changes do not compromise security of the backend server. Suggest new features and/or enhancements. Consulting with our customer facing representatives about software system design and maintenance. Interact with the Clinical Specialists and Product Manager to help understand end-user feedback. Maintaining software through product lifecycle including design, development, verification and bug fixes. Connect regularly with the Quality Assurance Specialist to deliver a stable app. Resolve all the bugs reported by the Quality Assurance Specialist in a timely manner. Perform time profiling and memory leaks assessment. Execute app verification protocol. Write tests for the App. Following company policies and quality procedures to ensure quality product deliverables.  Requirements 1+ years of experience with Flutter Flutter: To build cross platform mobile apps for Android, IOS and Web. This should include from making responsive UIs to efficiently query data and also manage states.. Native Android and IOS: To build custom Flutter Packages. Should have experience with Google Cloud, Push Notifications, Cloud Functions and Analytics. Adobe XD or Figma: Should know how to use Adobe XD to use the design file and use it to build the app. Git: To manage and collaborate in different projects with the rest of the team.  Good To Have: React Experience  Bootstrap & Grid Understanding  JavaScript Knowledge, read “Javascript the Good Parts”  Typescript Experience to avoid Javascript shortcomings  Postman API Knowledge

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech. You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=sfswe&utm_medium=job_board

Title: 2nd Shift QA Inspector
Description: Are you a hands-on person that is passionate about production quality? Take advantage of this career with a leading-edge manufacturer of high-quality precision specialty parts for the medical industry where your quality experience will have a larger impact. Imagine the satisfaction you will feel inspecting complex parts for use in life saving and critical medical devices that impact lives around the world. Due to growth, Berg Manufacturing, a precision machine shop, is searching for QA Inspectors to join their 2nd shift team at their state-of-the-art facility in the heart of Silicon Valley in Santa Clara, CA.As a member of the team, you will enjoy:  Competitive Compensation - $22-$42/hr. commensurate with experience Amazing Full Benefits Package – Extremely low-cost healthcare plan, employees pay only $15/paycheck for medical & dental! Vision, life Insurance, short & long-term disability, accidental insurance available to employees. Paid Holiday and Vacation time Growth & Stability Advancement Opportunities  If you are an experienced QA Parts Inspector, proficient with a caliber, and pay special attention to detail, then Berg Manufacturing wants to hear from you! A Bachelor’s degree in business or Quality Systems is a plus! Don't let this opportunity pass you by! Apply today! Duties & Responsibilities:  Perform receiving inspection, first article inspection, in-process inspection and final inspection Create NCR’s on discrepant material/parts Make sure all QA equipment is properly maintained and calibrated  About the Company: Berg Manufacturing, Inc. is a precision machine shop located in Santa Clara, CA, the heart of the Silicon Valley. We specialize in manufacturing for the medical industry but also do work for the Aerospace, and Military industries.Equal Opportunity Employer. For Job Seekers - Workrocket.com provides a fast and effective way to connect with great jobs. We work with a wide range of companies that offer excellent career opportunities. The industries we serve range from heavy construction equipment, HVAC, and manufacturing to medical and surgical equipment, accounting, finance and insurance just to name a few. Connecting Job seekers with great jobs is what we do. http://www.workrocket.com

Title: Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor | $80,000 - $84,000 per year
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   HireArt is helping Transdev, a leader in global transportation solutions, hire an Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor. In this role, you’ll work closely with both operations leadership and autonomous vehicle teams to execute strategic initiatives.You’ll ensure drivers have the tools, information, and mentorship to succeed. You’ll define operational priorities, troubleshoot issues, and contribute data-driven insights to improve overall program performance.The ideal candidate is experienced in operations and in leading teams, and is passionate about autonomous vehicle technology.This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent role with the following available shifts:AM: 5:30 AM - 2:30 PMPM: 2:30 PM - 9:30 PMMoonlight: 9:30 PM - 6:30 AMAs Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor, you will: Support operations leadership team in mission assignment, leading meetings, and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.Participate in lean/kaizen, black belt, and other operational excellence initiatives.Perform all vehicle driver safety evaluation ride checks, observation of drivers while on route/test track, and prescribe the necessary retraining.Respond to service problems including rerouting, accidents, and incidents with the goal of restoration of interrupted service, and support drivers in preparing accident reports such as post-accident drug and alcohol testing according to policy.Maintain telephone contact with transit vehicle drivers in conjunction with client’s dispatch. Debrief and manage drivers, and coordinate vehicle exchanges during each shift.Ensure compliance to global process standards throughout the site and work on continuous improvement initiatives.Inform other management personnel regarding operational or personnel problems as appropriate and offer ideas towards resolution.Investigate and respond to unsafe location/situation reports.Interpret metrics, find opportunities, and implement actions to drive results.Maintain routine records and perform a variety of clerical work activities related to the property operation.Maintain a high degree of confidentiality of all information.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations, or a related field, or equivalent work experience2+ years of operations experience in a supervisory roleA proven record of effective project and people managementStrong analytical and decision-making abilitiesExcellent written and verbal communicationHighly organized with acute attention to detailComfortable with computers and various software/appsAbility to travel as neededAbility to work outdoors in various weather conditions as neededPassion for technology and autonomous vehiclesMust be 21+ years of age Working Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to,  bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 25 lbs. The ability to work outdoors in various weather conditions is required. Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent position through HireArt and based in San Francisco, CA. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   About Transdev We are the largest private provider of multiple modes of transport in North America.Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities contract with us to operate their transportation systems. Our goal is to help our clients provide transit systems that are appealing, convenient, integrated networks that people actively choose to ride. In cities all across the country, we’re helping our clients move toward making public transit equivalent to the city’s lifeblood, circulating and connecting riders to the people and places they care about.We are part of a global company, Transdev, operating in 17 countries on five continents.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply

Title: Unity Software Engineer | $80 - $90 per hour
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/25583b1b/apply   HireArt is helping the world's largest social network find a Unity Software Engineer to conceptualize, build, and iterate on high-quality solutions to build demo games and experiences. Title: Manager, Engineering/Technical Program Management
Description: Plenty Unlimited Inc. in South San Francisco, CA seeks Manager, Engineering/Technical Program Management.  Responsibilities: Responsible for planning, directing, and coordinating the work activities and resources necessary for a controlled agriculture environment. Integrates subsystem plans into an overall system development program. Manages design and product realization, electrical engineering, sustainable energy utilization, renewable energy technology, and energy management. Coordinates with supply chain. Streamlines the production process and eliminates redundancies and inefficiencies in the process, repairing production issues and problems. Coordinates, plans, and directs Plenty’s engineering team towards successful programs and projects focused on the critical initiatives to improve the life of Plants, People, and the Planet. Build comprehensive product specifications by driving cross-organizational conversations between the Engineer Teams, Farm Operations, and Plant Science. Develops and reviews models of alternative designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, sustainability, operating condition effects, potential new applications, and necessity of modifications to current processes. Recommends the use of utility or energy services that minimize carbon footprint and environmental impact while evaluating mechanical designs for energy performance and environmental impact. Directs the installation and operation of equipment that is reducing carbon footprint. Manage and prioritization of product development, scheduling, and cost for our commercial farms. May supervise 3-10 employees with job titles such a Technical Program Managers. Performs other related duties as required.  Education: Bachelor’s Degree (or foreign equivalent) in Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Design Engineering, or related engineering field.  Requirements: 2 years of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements: 2 years of experience using team collaboration/knowledge management software (Confluence or Microsoft Project); 2 years of experience using predictive software forecasting real-world performance of products using simulations (Star-CCM+ and thermal simulation and modeling); 2 years of experience using solid modeling software or vector graphics applications (Solid Edge, Visio, or Catia V.5); 2 years of experience using bug tracking, issue tracking, and project management software using JIRA; and 2 years of experience plotting functions and data.   Please mail resumes to Plenty Unlimited Inc., Attn: HR 590 Eccles Ave., South San Francisco, CA 94080 quoting job # SEPM20

Title: Product Manager - Proptech
Compensation: Significant equity until we complete our seed round
Description: We are a company in stealth mode answering the question, "If I don't have to go back to my office and I can live anywhere in the world, where should I live?"  We are a team of technologists, data scientists, marketers, and operators who have a very big idea and are eager to share it with the world. You would be our first product team member and instrumental in helping us identify which features matter, testing them, and creating our PRD.   As we transition from our Proof of Concept to our MVP,  you will be owning core parts of the app experience, including browse, personalization, maps, search and filters, auto complete, updates and more. You’ll have a ton of visibility in the company, and you’ll be empowered to change our product trajectory.   We are currently bootstrapping. You wouldn't be expected to quit your day job (yet) but we would require 10+ hours per week. In return, you would get significant equity and then a market-rate salary when we do our raise. Experience working in either proptech, consumer-facing real estate apps, or geospatial companies is required.   We are an inclusionary company and encourage those with diverse and less-represented backgrounds to apply. But please no recruiters or agencies.

Title: Code Coach for theCoderSchool
Description: Who We Are theCoderSchool is an after-school drop-off program for kids learning to code located in San Mateo. The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.  sanmateo.thecoderschool.com  Job Summary theCoderSchool San Mateo is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world!  You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code (and how to think like a coder!), and be rewarded with an amazing experience.  This is a part-time position for 3-25 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule.  Our schools are open in-person so this job is to be in-person. Our open hours will be generally 3-8pm on select weekdays. We will provide Instructor Training, and will use more of a "teaching methodology" than a curriculum.  Much of our teaching will be reverse-engineering games or concepts, and will adapt to a particular student's interests and skills.  Responsibilities A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code.  At theCoderSchool, we have two basic teaching styles - your assignment will depend on schedule, ability, and desire. 1. Private and Semi-Private Tutoring.  One-to-one or one-to-few coding lessons for kids.  Typically in Scratch/Snap for the younger kids and Javascript/HTML, Python and beyond for older kids.  Specialty programming like Unity or Swift helpful as well! 2. Code Class.  Traditional curriculum based classes with a larger student to teacher ratio.  This position rocks because you will: * Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to learn, and potentially manage a team of kids to create an application. * Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the Bay Area. * Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology  Requirements What do we want from you?  Read on. * PASSION.  All caps!  This is all about giving back to the kids. We need to see goose bumps when your student ROCKS a code challenge. * Great Communicator.  There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course patience is a virtue when it comes to kids! * Street Cred.  Our college-level Code Coaches will have Comp Sci or Engineering or similar major at a nearby accredited school.  Our Veteran Code Coaches will have relevant industry experience. * Coding Skills.  Strong grasp of basic procedural programming.  General knowledge of languages is assumed - Javascript, PHP, HTML/CSS, Python, Java are most helpful.  Deep technical skills aren't required - we prefer you communicate well and find answers along with students than know everything upfront. * Experience teaching kids in Scratch/Snap or other languages is a plus  Interested?  Send us an email with a cover letter and resume and let's do it!

Title: QA Analyst - New Grad
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking a QA Analyst. As a QA Analyst at IXL, you will be responsible for ensuring that we consistently deliver software of the highest quality. You will work closely with our product managers and engineers to develop and execute test strategies for a variety of exciting new features.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Review business requirements and develop test plans, test cases, test estimations, and test execution reports Perform functionality, regression, integration, UI, smoke, exploratory, stress and performance testing Manage all communications related to QA status on a daily basis and report potential risks during all stages of development lifecycle Work closely with development and product teams to resolve any issues that arise out of the testing process Analyze test results and facilitate resolution of issues Iterate on existing testing processes and standards to improve efficiency and accuracy  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  BA/BS degree required Ability to work both independently and on a wide variety of teams Passion for making bullet-proof applications and improving education through technology Self-motivated, detail oriented, proactive and collaborative Excellent written and verbal communication skills Knowledge of JIRA, Unix, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, source control, and mobile device development is a plus Scripting or programming experience is a plus  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day. At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission. We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Full Stack Senior React-saavy Developer
Compensation: Offering competitive compensation, preferably beginning on a generous contract basis for a month or two to make sure you’re a good fit (but we’re flexible). Let us know if you have any questions!
Description: Refresh is an enterprise employee platform. We count among our ongoing clients Reddit, Foursquare, and the New York MTA. We connect the dots between existing SaaS products to create a unified employee experience, and offer a core suite of tools including end-to-end wellness/employee communication, health benefits discovery, expense reimbursement, and much more. If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/88f4a947/apply   About Toyota Research Institute At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. Title: Principal Full Stack Engineer (RoR/etc), Full-Time, Remote, Music Tech
Compensation: Competitive cash compensation paid biweekly plus good chunk of equity
Description: COMPANY JamKazam (https://jamkazam.com/) has spent the last 6 years building the best platform in the world to help musicians play together live and in-sync over the Internet from different locations with high quality audio and video. See one of our online music festivals for an example: https://youtu.be/JGShI6izZBA. And see this overview for an intro: https://youtu.be/ylYcvTY9CVo. We are a private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech.  OPPORTUNITY We are looking for a talented, experienced principal engineer with 7+ years of experience developing complex applications with full stack scope to join our core engineering team on a full-time contract basis for a long-term run – initially as a heavy individual contributor, and then ideally once you have sufficient exposure to the product portfolio, also as team lead. We want someone who is excited by our music mission, who can operate with relative autonomy across a broad scope of our application portfolio, and who enjoys development across front-end, back-end, database, and devops – pretty much everything. This gig is fully remote - the whole team is remote/virtual and always has been.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages • Experience and passion for all aspects of development – front-end, back-end, database, devops • Expertise and proficiency in Ruby on Rails • Experience in front-end application development with React/jQuery or similar • Proficient in use of current Web UI development technologies, in particular Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3 • Proficient in use of SQL  • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  COMPENSATION This is a 1099 contractor position. Very competitive cash compensation paid biweekly, plus a healthy chunk of equity in a rapidly growing music tech company in a highly compelling market segment.  LOCATION This is a fully remote position. No need to come into any office location.

Title: Software QA Engineer
Compensation: Anticipated salary of $77,000. Salary will be dependent on experience.
Description: Are you a big picture systems thinker? Do you feel energized by ensuring that tech products are the highest quality possible? Do you want to learn more how to leverage tech for good, be on the cutting edge of economic justice work, have a good laugh, brainstorm a lot, get frustrated sometimes but inspired frequently, and be on the right side of history? MAF is looking for a Software Quality Assurance Engineer who wants an opportunity to join an organization that sits at the forefront of economic justice work and leads with innovative and big ideas. From day one you’ll be challenged by exciting projects, working alongside the best and brightest, and enjoying an amicable work environment.  Our story:Mission Asset Fund (MAF) is a groundbreaking non-profit on a mission to create a fair financial marketplace for hardworking families. We’re a recognized nationwide leader in developing innovative and successful asset-building strategies. A hybrid between a tech start-up and a nonprofit, MAF is a great place to work for both nonprofit or for-profit professionals who are interested in tech for social good. As MAF grows and expands its areas of work,  we need a passionate and proactive Software QA Engineer that can help meet all of our release targets . This is a great opportunity for someone who wants not just a job, but also an opportunity to build the financial power in communities of color and be part of a community and culture that is committed to social good.  An awesome place to work: We’re right in the Mission District in San Francisco. It’s awesome here, with diverse restaurants, bars, and shops. We’ve got great team outings (fighting zombies, putt putt and bowling to name a few). And the team is ridiculously dedicated to the mission and fun to work with. As a nonprofit and tech startup, we attract people who like to jump in with both feet and who aren’t afraid of learning how to do better. With an open office environment, collaboration and teamwork are more than just values - they’re a way of life. Hailing from many different cultural and professional backgrounds, we are drawn together by a passion for embracing technology and creativity to make the world a better place for hardworking families. Reports to:Technical PM/MAF Lab Director Location: San Francisco, CA (currently remote) How To Apply: Click the following link to apply for the Software QA Engineer Role Software QA Engineer Application Link  The Opportunity:The Software QA engineer will be responsible for monitoring all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions and to meet quality standards. This position will work closely with the Product Managers in every phase of the development process to ensure that the design and software developed adhere to company standards, and to avoid release delays. The successful candidate will help develop and implement testing procedures and ensure that software runs smoothly and meets organization and client needs. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES  Create and execute detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies Drive innovation and streamline overall testing processes Review user interfaces for consistency and functionality You'll thrive in this role if:  A passion for social justice and a fundamental belief in the expertise, innovation, and strength of low-income and immigrants communities. A Bachelor’s or Master's degree in software design, engineering, computer science or similar degree. A minimum of 3 years’ experience as a QA test, QA engineer or similar position. Strong knowledge on software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. Knowledge of SQL and scripting, R or Python. Working experience in software development and software quality assurance. Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities. An analytical mindset with excellent organizational skills. Compensation and Benefits:  This is a full-time position with an anticipated salary of $77,000. Salary will be dependent on experience. We believe in work-life balance and are committed to keeping the workload in alignment with this value. We provide 20 days of Paid Time Off (160 hours)/year accrued for the first two years of full-time employment, 13 paid holidays, and a flexible, family-friendly schedule. We provide generous medical (HMO and PPO options), dental, vision, disability, life, flexible spending account, and AD&D insurance. We care about your financial future. We provide a matching 401K plan that is immediately vested. We will match up to 4% of your compensation/year. Commuter benefits & flexible savings accounts: pre-tax benefit accounts used to pay for expenses like healthcare or commuter expenses like parking, vanpool, public transit—including train, subway, bus, and ferry. Our Hiring Process and Timeline:  We will read your cover letter first; it’s important for us to understand whether this is the right fit for you. In your cover letter, please be sure to tell us why you are interested in this job, what you like about MAF, and share examples of past work you’ve done that makes you a strong candidate.  We will review applications on a rolling basis until the position is filled. We would like to have the selected candidate start as soon as possible. Please note: Unfortunately we are unable to sponsor visas. Equal Opportunity Employment: Mission Asset Fund is an equal opportunity employer; people of color and individuals from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Mission Asset Fund does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnic background, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, or disability. San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Deadline: Applications are processed on a rolling basis. The position will remain open until filled. Application:Software QA Engineer Application Link No phone calls. Do not contact the hiring team. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers.

Title: Code Coaches/Tutors Needed! (Remote)
Description: Are you an energetic individual with decent coding experience? We have a great opportunity that will help you continue to improve your coding skills and help you find your next job. Some our Code Coaches have found amazing opportunities with companies like Google, Cisco, Uber and others.   Who We Are ---------------- theCoderSchool is an after-school drop-off program for kids learning to code. We provide a fun, energetic, and inspirational environment to bring out that inner hacker in all kids! The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.  http://walnutcreek.thecoderschool.com  Job Summary ----------------- theCoderSchool is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world! You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code - and how to think like a coder - and be rewarded with an amazing experience.  This is a part-time position for anywhere from 2-15 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule and availability.  These hours can generally be sometime between 3-8 pm weekdays and 10 am - 5 pm on Saturday or Sunday.   Responsibilities ------------------- A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code. We teach students One-on-one or one-on-two coding lessons for kids. Younger students will be taught in Scratch, while older students gravitate towards more advanced platforms. The kids will generally create projects that you decide with them and generally follow our curriculum.   This position rocks because you will: • Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to be the next generation of coders! • Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the Bay Area. • Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology • Have the flexibility to teach what you're most comfortable with, and learn new things along the way  Requirements ----------------- What do we want from you? Read on.  • PASSION. All caps! This is all about giving back to the kids. We need to see goosebumps when your student ROCKS a code challenge.  • Great Communicator. There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course, patience is a virtue when it comes to kids!  • Street Cred. Our college-level Code Coaches will have Comp Sci or Engineering or a similar major at a nearby accredited school. Our Veteran Code Coaches will have relevant industry experience.  • Coding Skills. Strong grasp of general technologies, proficient coder and uber-logical thinker. General knowledge of Python, Javascript and Web development are most helpful. Deep technical skills aren't required - we prefer you to communicate well and find answers along with students than knowing everything upfront.

Title: Technical Lead, Software Engineering
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking a Technical Lead to manage a team of talented engineers and provide hands-on technical and project leadership.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Manage and build a high-performance team Guide and mentor engineers and project leads to ensure a high level of work satisfaction, technical advancement, and progress towards individual career goals Make company initiatives, mission, goals, and values clear to each team member Work with project managers, designers, and QA to maintain and surpass product usability and quality standards  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  At least 5 years of direct experience in software engineering and 2 years of engineering management Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or another object-oriented language Strong communication and leadership skills Exceptional analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Strong organization and time management skills Passion for improving education through technology We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day. At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission. We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Principal Solutions Architect
Description: Reali Principal Solutions Architect Job Label: Solutions Architect Reali Reali is here to make home buying and selling simple, affordable, and stress-free. We were founded to develop a seamless, transparent, and highly efficient residential real estate and homeownership experience by partnering technology with a customer-centric team and years of real estate, loans, escrow, and business experiences. Reali is seeking a Principal Solutions Architect with ability to think outside of the box, for the design and realization of an ecosystem of services and components that provide state of the art living experience. We are looking for someone who can hold conversations up and down the stakeholder ladder - from technical doers to CxO level leaders and therefore you will be a strong communicator who can take ownership, deal with ambiguity and complexity and focus on achieving success to ensure the clients’ business outcomes are met.The technologies include a rich API services mesh, Web and Mobile applications, cloud services, information systems, data analytics and BI, machine learning, and more. Report to the director of engineering and work with all stakeholders to define the best and most suitable options for the implementation of our products. What you will do: Lead and drive following technical aspects as part of cross-functional product teams across the software engineering organization:  Provide technical leadership for the transition and transformation of a program of solutions and services. Guide product teams on systems flexibility and constraints. Set and maintain architectural standards, policies and frameworks that govern all aspects of application integrations, development and maintenance that continuously improve with cloud enabled services that improve business agility and drive down operating costs Develop full stack “blueprints” for application architectures comprising of micro-services and messaging for digital user interfaces Support the impact assessment of changes to the systems/solutions brought about by the customer’s requests for change Be part of the engineering group, working collaboratively towards a common goal with experts and with partners across geographies and domains Provide the technical direction required to resolve complex issues to ensure the on-time delivery of solutions that meet client expectations Develop reusable solutions and workarounds that are innovative and demonstrate a deep technical knowledge of the affected products, processes, and the client environment Design and develop a core set of shared services that can be consumed by various other application modules or containers. Promote reuse and leverage existing software components, cloud components, and services Create, maintain and/or enhance a target enterprise application landscape that drives reuse where appropriate across the enterprise Collaborates with application teams across the enterprise and provides recommendations on competitive frameworks and solutions to address application inefficiencies, increase stability, and support scaling efforts on cloud platform Provide designs, prototypes, and implementations incorporating architecture & software engineering best practices.  Support business in assessment of IP and business development opportunities as a subject matter expert. Account for possible project challenges on constraints including, risks, time, resources and scope in solutions. Assist with technology roadmap design, creation, and execution.  Benefits & Perks    Competitive Salaries, Stock options, and 401k Choose from various full-family medical, dental, and vision plans HSA, FSA (2), ​Basic Life (2X), STD, LTD Flexible, Paid Time Off plus 11 US-based holidays Employee Referral Program Reali's Family & Friends Discounted Programs Healthy Workplace environment: The InvestingInU Initiative provides an inclusive series of wellness sessions to boost each Reali family member as a whole being, mainly focused on 4 pillars: Wellbeing, Physical, Financial, Social. D&I ​(Diversity & Inclusion) ​team and events    Reali is made up of experts and technologists who collaborate to deliver transparent, stress-free real estate solutions for buyers, sellers, and agents. Headquartered in San Mateo, CA and founded in 2016, Reali supports the entire transaction process from beginning to end with full-service offerings including loans, mortgages, real estate, escrow and more! By merging decades of industry expertise with proprietary technology, the Reali team has developed a suite of intelligent products including the PricePredictorTM tool, which takes the complexity and uncertainty out of buying a home. Reali has cemented a winning reputation with an A+ from the BBB and was voted one of 2019’s Best Places to Work.* We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Qualifications (Must Haves)  15+ years experience of designing and implementing software applications 10+ years experience of enterprise architecture and technical leadership Outstanding leadership, collaboration, interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to influence at a CxO level.  Outstanding The ability to understand the business needs, vision and direction and also the key trends and challenges and the technology enablers for the real-estate and financial sectors Experience in providing technical leadership with first-hand experience of the concepts of Lean approaches and the details of Agile methodologies and related methods, plus a working knowledge of an enterprise architecture framework Knowledge and understanding of contemporary technologies and platforms Excellence in strategic and analytical problem solving, with a quantitative, fact-based approach to team-based problem solving and a strategic approach to addressing issues and offering solutions with an aptitude for analytical concepts and thinking. Experience in decomposing large complex problems into component parts for skill centre engineering, as well as having the ability to provide and contribute at all levels across build, test, implementation and integration activities. A strong footing in the following areas: Cloud Technologies, Platform and Hosting, Workplace and Mobility, Security, Applications & Modernization, DevSecOps or Automation / Orchestration and Analytics Experience working on large-scale SaaS software projects working across the stack. Demonstrated knowledge of: Web and mobile applications; Web services; Application security; Systems architecture and design; Software design principles; Software architecture and design. Resilience. The ability to work under pressure and deliver to tight deadlines Facilitation skills. The ability to facilitate executive workshops and obtain consensus Negotiation skills. An understanding of principled negotiation strategies and the ability to resolve differing opinions and seek a win-win resolution to conflicts Defines functional and non-functional requirements including performance monitoring, alerting and code management and ensuring alignment with technology best practices and SLAs. Mentoring and coaching other members of the agile and\or Run team. Driving engagement with ITS Security and Infrastructure teams to ensure secure development and deployment of solutions Excellent oral/written communication, white board, documentation  Experience mentoring and growing individual contributors and teams. Demonstrated experience at setting standards around software development processes and helping organizations mature.            To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.      Apply for this job https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/ce/487050281/Reali/California/San-Mateo/Solutions-Architect?sourceType=9          Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.       Related Keywords: solutions architect, AngularJS

Title: Autonomous Vehicle Test Specialist | Fastest-Growing Rideshare Company
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/83fb23c4/apply   HireArt is helping our client hire an experienced and motivated Autonomous Vehicle Test Specialist. In this role, you’ll operate autonomous vehicles, work with engineering teams to develop test scenarios, and provide insightful feedback on test results. We’re seeking an Autonomous Vehicle Test Specialist who thrives in a  fast-paced, high-growth environment. You love a good challenge and are comfortable contributing as part of a distributed team. Ideally, you’re also interested in the autonomous vehicle space, have a passion for technology, can communicate effectively with technical teams, and value hard work and fun in equal measure. As Autonomous Vehicle Test Specialist, you will: Operate self-driving vehicles in both autonomous and manual modes.  Help plan, coordinate and execute structured tests with engineers.  Work with peers, software, hardware and tool engineers to develop appropriate means to conduct tests.  Develop scenarios, objects and environments that mimic real world scenarios as closely as possible. Maintain strong attention to detail, with an emphasis on safe, effective and efficient testing.  Provide feedback and analysis on test findings and outcomes to engineers.  Execute both co-pilot and driver responsibilities during a mission. Be a mentor to your peers.   If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/83fb23c4/apply   Requirements  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience Valid US Driver’s license with at least 7 years driving experience,  and a clean driving record (no more than 1 point in the last 3 years) Previous experience in a testing environment (hardware, software, quality control) Previous experience with workflow and bug tracking via Jira or similar  Excellent communication and documentation skills Ability to travel up to 25% of the time 1+ years of Autonomous Vehicle testing experience preferred Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 1-year contract position staffed via HireArt and based in Palo Alto, CA. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/83fb23c4/apply

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description: Who we are Farallon Geographics is a geospatial application development and GIS implementation company based in San Francisco, CA.  We build geospatial apps that manage assets, streamline the business of government, preserve cultural heritage, and protect our environment.  Our clients include local/regional/state and national governments, utility companies, non-profit and for-profit business located throughout the country and around the world.  We’re active contributors to Open Source projects and accomplished implementers of enterprise GIS technology.  As developers, we work across the technology stack from browser-based and native mobile front ends to highly scalable backend systems.  Farallon’s been developing custom geospatial applications for almost 25 years; we’ve helped the geospatial technology and data ecosystem grow and built award winning applications along the way.  As a core team member: You’ll be a key member of our team and bring you own unique energy and perspective to our software development practice.  Expect to work across multiple projects using Open Source and proprietary technologies to develop geospatial web applications, enhancing our clients’ stewardship of key assets in a changing world.   At Farallon, you’ll manage tasks as a member of a small Agile development team.  While we appreciate quality craftsmanship, we believe in real world pragmatism - never letting the perfect become the enemy of the possible.  Finding that sweet spot between beautiful code and robust, maintainable, and practical solutions will require that you communicate clearly and consistently with your team mates during all steps of development.    We approach our work fearlessly, learn quickly, improve constantly, and share our insights with one another. Everyone is welcome — our team members are comfortable in voicing their ideas and bringing their authentic whole selves to work.   As a Full-Stack developer: You’ll leverage your Python/Django experience to create superb backend solutions, then turn around and break out your web development chops in JavaScript/HTML/CSS to bring UI mockups to life.  You should be comfortable around databases like PostgreSQL given your previous experience developing data-driven web apps.  You have used frameworks like Knockout or Vue before, and you’re comfortable using source control tools.  While we work on many platforms you’ll definitely spend a lot of time working with Arches (www.archesproject.org), an open source data management and visualization platform used to enhance the stewardship of cultural-, natural-, and engineered resources around the world.  What you’ll do: • Team with other software developers to write backend and frontend code for our web and mobile applications • Identify and design appropriate solutions for implementing new features in Arches • Work closely with a technical mentor to grow your software development skills, then mentor new team members as they come onboard • Work effectively within an agile development process while ensuring that we meet our schedule and budget constraints to deliver great products • Ask for help when you need it, offer a hand when a team member needs another pair of eyes on an issue  Your skills already include: • Ability to write code in JavaScript and Python • Effectively debug your own code and code written by others • Understand the architecture of modern web applications and data flow between the client and server • Familiarity with PostgreSQL or similar database system • Comfort working with an IDE such as Visual Studio, Sublime, or similar tool • Familiarity with Git and Open Source workflows • Ability to communicate your development ideas to the team and respectfully voice an alternate approach when you believe that you have a better idea than what’s been proposed  Additional Skills or Experience that we value: • Experience with geospatial data and software libraries such as Mapbox GL, PostGIS, Leaflet, or esri products • Ability to consume RESTful services and web APIs for dynamic sites and web mapping • Experience with Docker and cloud platforms like AWS • Experience with Mobile development • Experience with React Native  As for more traditional experience and credentials, we don’t require a degree in Computer Science or similar disciplines.  Instead, we’re looking for smart, energetic people who want to write software that can help improve our world in meaningful ways.  If you’re bright, a quick learner and effective communicator we encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn’t tick every box.  A bit more about Farallon Farallon’s offices are located in downtown San Francisco in a bright and modern space, easily reachable by several Bay Area public transit systems. We’re an Apple office, and you’ll get a MacBook Pro and monitor to work on.  We’re a very flat organization, expecting that everyone will offer input on project decisions and take on the responsibility for achieving our shared goals.  Consequently, we’re comfortable with our team members deciding when to work remotely and how to manage their professional and personal obligations throughout the working week.  We offer: • Salary commensurate with experience • Health and dental insurance for you, your spouse/partner and children • 401k retirement plan with matching funds • Generous holiday and personal time off (PTO) policy • Flexible work schedule • Pre-tax public transit vouchers • Bonus plan  If you’d like to apply We believe in diversity and welcome applications from qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.  Please send us a resume and a cover letter telling us why you’re interested in this position and why you’d be a good fit at Farallon. Please include a link to a portfolio website, GitHub account, and/or other repository of coding samples in your application materials.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Senior Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our three extremely successful educational products and build new, innovative products. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Work with a team of talented engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products Drive the development process for your team, including design, coding, documenting, testing, debugging, and tuning Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  4+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language Strong communication skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day. At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission. We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech. You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=sfswe&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Certified Encompass Developer/Programmer
Description: REMOTE POSITION Full time Ellie Mae Encompass API/SDK/HTML Programmer/Developer  $130,000+/year commensurate with experience and ability Includes paid healthcare plus dental, vision and 401K plan Eligible candidates MUST have Encompass 360 Mortgage Lending Software experience  Certified Ellie Mae Encompass Developer & Administrator - writing complex business rules, designing input forms, handling day to day administration of Encompass software. Proficient in C#/.NET development, building Plugins, codebase assemblies, stand alone console apps, WPF and Winform based apps to interface with Encompass. Javascript, HTML and CSS and experience working with APIs and Ellie Mae Developer Connect. Must be able to make Encompass talk to other systems, automate data entry and delivery. Experience with many similar front end applications, data warehousing concepts, and productivity/code tracking systems such as JIRA, TFS, and Github. Innovative and highly technical with a good working knowledge of WPF and Encompass Software - design, coding and working with a team to develop for Encompass. Looking for at least 2-3 years experience. Microsoft certifications are a plus.  Qualities we are looking for: Great communication skills, verbally and written Willingness to learn and expand upon existing skill sets Team player & able to work without supervision High level of attention to detail Ability to effectively communicate technical information in simple terms Friendly, patient and positive nature  MortgageTech is one of the oldest Ellie Mae Consulting and Technical Partners. We provide support and technical services to a variety of companies who use the Encompass Mortgage Banking software. While we all work remotely, we are as much a family as we are a team. Being a remote company, making sure you have a dedicated workspace is essential. We meet virtually, so no travel is required. Honesty, transparency and timely communication are critical. Avoiding unnecessary calls and meetings is part of our culture, but we are efficient and punctual when we meet over MS Teams. We are a company that empowers our team to be independent decision-makers, always striving for high standards for contribution to the team. Although remote, our team is a tightknit and supportive group of individuals. Having excellent communication and interpersonal skills is something we highly value. We only employ the top front-end thinkers and software administrators in the industry, so you'll be working with some of the best and brightest. You will work on a variety of projects, so you must be able to switch gears easily. As you will work remotely, we are looking for a quick learner, someone who loves to work hard, delivers outsatnding work, is self-motivated, and loves programming.  Find out more about us at  https://mortgagetech.com

Title: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST – FORMS MANAGEMENT
Compensation: Commensurate with education and experience, W-2, 1099, or C2C, must be in US without sponsorship
Description: Sierra Cybernetics is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to work for us assisting our local government client – the Judicial Council of California.  The position will be remote until COVID restrictions are lifted; then it will be on-site in the JCC’s downtown San Francisco office.  This is planned as a 3 year contract assignment, starting about June 1.  You will perform a complete comparative product assessment for Judicial Council forms management and related services.  You will be responsible for conducting needs analysis, documenting business requirements and performing a comparative product analysis that will allow the branch to achieve its objectives for forms management and related services (forms platform and software; APIs, professional services; adaptive forms builder; certification and e-signature; versioning)  Minimum Job-Specific Skills/Qualifications Required (in order of relative importance):  • 10 years of professional experience as a Business Systems Analyst, with expert knowledge of and experience with:  o Gathering and documenting business requirements and functional specifications in business systems with multiple business functional areas o Identifying and evaluating technical solutions, identifying cost, pros and cons of each solution  o Researching, reviewing and assessing product/service information o Comprehensive product capabilities comparison and reporting o Effectively documenting and presenting findings in a clear, comprehensive, and cohesive manner • Excellent analytical skills • Excellent communication and presentation skills, for both technical and non-technical audiences, including creating and presenting executive summaries to steering committees and other executive level leadership  • Experience with procurement processes including the creation of RFP, SOW, evaluation methodologies, contracts, and procurement documentation • Ability to manage projects and develop and maintain project plans • Excellent written communication skills, including business and technical documentation, presentation materials, and correspondence  • Excellent interpersonal skills • Proficiency with Microsoft applications including MS Access, Excel, Visio and Project  Additional Skills/Qualifications Desired:  • Judicial system knowledge sufficient to survey branch entities • Judicial system and court operations • Best practices and emerging technologies (preferably forms-related)  • Project and program management • Previous work history with the State of California, local, or Federal agencies • Experience with document automation solutions • Experience with Web based tools design, development and deployment • Experience with digital platforms

Title: Code Coach (remote) at theCoderSchool Redwood City
Description: Are you an energetic individual with decent coding experience? Want to inspire young minds? -------------------- We have a great opportunity that will help you continue to improve your coding skills and help you find your next job. Some of our Code Coaches have found amazing opportunities with companies like Google, Cisco, Uber, Apple, and others.  Who We Are ---------------- theCoderSchool is an after-school drop-off program for kids learning to code. We provide a fun, energetic, and inspirational environment to bring out that inner hacker in all kids! The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.  http://rwc.thecoderschool.com  Job Summary ----------------- theCoderSchool is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world! You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code - and how to think like a coder - and be rewarded with an amazing experience.  This is a part-time position for anywhere from 2-15 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule and availability.  These hours can generally be sometime between 3-8 pm on weekdays and 10 am-3 pm on Saturday and Sunday.   Responsibilities ------------------- A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code. At theCoderSchool, we have three basic teaching styles - your assignment will depend on schedule, ability, and desire.  1. Private and Semi-Private Tutoring. One-on-one or one-on-two coding lessons for kids. Younger kids will be taught in Scratch or Snap, while older kids gravitate towards more advanced platforms. The kids will generally create projects that you decide with them and generally follow our curriculum.  2. Code Coaching Plus. Our more experienced Code Coaches will manage a team of kids who will collaborate to create a project together. Requirements, design, iterations - similar to a real development but with more fun team challenges and activities mixed in.  3. Code Class. Traditional curriculum-based classes with a larger student to teacher ratio, where all students follow a set specific curriculum.  This position rocks because you will: • Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to be the next generation of coders! • Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the Bay Area. • Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology • Have the flexibility to teach what you're most comfortable with and learn new things along the way  Requirements ----------------- What do we want from you? Read on.  • PASSION. All caps! This is all about giving back to the kids. We need to see goosebumps when your student ROCKS a code challenge.  • Great Communicator. There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course, patience is a virtue when it comes to kids!  • Street Cred. Our college-level Code Coaches will have Comp Sci or Engineering or similar major at a nearby accredited school. Our Veteran Code Coaches will have relevant industry experience.  • Coding Skills. Strong grasp of general technologies, proficient coder, and uber-logical thinker. General knowledge of Python, Java, and C++ is most helpful. Deep technical skills aren't required - we prefer you to communicate well and find answers along with students than knowing everything upfront.   Sounds awesome? Send us a message with your cover letter and Resume.

project approach, plans and schedules  • Proven track record in leading, organizing, and coordinating multiple work activities simultaneously.  • Proven track record in delivery of on-time, on-budget projects with a high degree of user satisfaction and quality.  • Proven track record implementing varying principles and techniques of project management, including the ability to develop and track complex project plans, manage risks, manage scope, and manage resources.  • Experience in managing project financials (budgeting, forecasting, tracking and reconciliation)  • Experience applying project management skills to application development.  • Knowledge of product development principles  • Proven track record of managing complex relationships among customers and stakeholders on
