Title: ReactJS Developer for Consumer Startup
Description: Pomp is looking for a ReactJS Developer to join our development team. We are looking for a skilled ReactJS developer to join our development team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing user interface components using React.js concepts and workflows. You will also be responsible for profiling and improving front-end and back-end performance and documenting the codebase.  Pomp is a new consumer-tech company that has just raised a Seed round. Come build the future of online skincare discovery and shopping. Ideally looking for consumer startup experience, and remote is ok.  Apply if: You are an expert in React.js and should have in-depth knowledge of JavaScript and React concepts, excellent front-end coding skills, and a good understanding of progressive web applications. Ultimately, a top-class React.js Developer should be able to design and build modern user interface components to enhance application performance.  Developer Responsibilities: Work closely with the CEO and development team to discuss strategy and implement development of user interface ideas, applications, and the roadmap. Reviewing application requirements and interface designs. Identifying web-based user interactions. Developing and implementing highly-responsive user interface components using React concepts. Writing application interface codes using React.js workflows. Troubleshooting interface software and debugging application codes. Developing and implementing front-end architecture to support user interface concepts. Monitoring and improving front-end and back-end performance. Documenting application changes and developing updates.  Lead Developer Requirements: Minimum 2 years of experience  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a similar field. Previous experience working as a React.js Developer. In-depth knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and front-end languages. Knowledge of REACT tools including React.js, Webpack, Enzyme, Redux, and Flux. Experience with user interface design. Experience with NodeJS, GraphQL, PostgreSQL a plus Knowledge of performance testing frameworks. Experience with browser-based debugging and performance testing software. Excellent troubleshooting skills. Good project management skills. A self-starting attitude: You work independently and effectively, with little oversight or management You’re excited about the opportunity to work very hard in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with high energy to build something incredible Possesses a strong sense of urgency, with the ability to get things done both autonomously and collaboratively Self-starter with excellent organizational and time management skills, who is comfortable in a hands-on, “roll up your sleeves”, start-up environment Startup experience a plus What you’ll love about Pomp: We offer competitive compensation, full medical/ dental benefits, and paid parental leave. We value each employee’s contribution and the shared effort of all, which is why all full-time employees receive equity in Pomp. We think work should be fun! We plan virtual and in-person happy hours, events, and offsite team outings. We offer flexible paid time off (vacation and sick days), in addition to 10 holidays and your birthday for all full-time employees. We love the sun, as long as you wear SPF! Summer Fridays (Memorial Day-Labor Day) We take accountability to make sure you are fulfilled, happy, and motivated to work at Pomp from day one. We feel physical and mental wellness is important and offer full-time employees one “wellness day” to focus on self-care or to give back to the community. We support local businesses and offer a quarterly facial/aesthetic treatment stipend. Last, but not at all least, we believe in healthy skin, so we offer all full-time employees their first Pomp skincare routine on us, in addition to quarterly discounts.

Title: Programmer Analyst - County of Sonoma
Description: The County of Sonoma Information Systems Department is seeking talented Programmers to fill two full-time Programmer Analyst positions in our Enterprise Development Division. These unique positions will support our GIS Team and our Applications Development Team. Starting salary up to $46.05/hourly ($96,111/yearly), plus a cash allowance of approximately $600/month* Working at the County of Sonoma offers expansive opportunities for growth and development, the ability to be a part of a challenging and rewarding work environment, and the satisfaction of knowing you're working to better our communities. You can also look forward to a competitive total compensation package*, including:  An annual Staff Development/Wellness Benefit allowance up to $500 and ongoing education/training opportunities Competitive vacation and sick leave accruals, 12 paid holidays, and an additional 8 floating holiday hours per year Significant portion of health care premiums paid by the County and access to several health plan options County contribution to a Health Reimbursement Arrangement to help fund post-retirement employee health insurance/benefits Retirement fully integrated with Social Security May be eligible for up to 8 weeks (320 hours) of Paid Parental Leave after 12 months of County employment Eligibility for a salary increase after 1,040 hours (6 months when working full-time) for good work performance; eligibility for a salary increase for good performance every year thereafter, until reaching the top of the salary range Information Systems Department (ISD) Supporting 29 County Departments, ISD employs 116 staff who provide technology solutions that support and enhance the service delivery systems of Sonoma County. Please visit the department's website for additional information.    The Enterprise Development Division supports the County’s Financial, Budget and Human Resource systems, the County’s Integrated Justice System, the GIS systems and the County Web sites, along with over 50 departmental line of business applications.    The Programmer Analyst role may vary from assignment to assignment. Typical duties involve all aspects of the software development lifecycle. Programmer Analysts often have direct interaction with business owners and end-users to understand their needs, and develop systems and processes that meet those needs.  The Information Systems Department looks for candidates with strong customer service skills, who are organized and are good communicators. Team players, who love to learn and are looking for growth opportunities would be a good fit for these positions.   The Positions The GIS Team publishes geospatial data and develops applications for use by County agencies and the public. The ideal candidate for this team will have a combination of programming and database skills that include: Strong skills with Visual Studio (C#, .Net), Python, and JavaScript Experience working with web services (e.g., REST); Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Reporting Services, and SQL Server Integration Services Familiarity working with spatial data and ESRI ArcGIS software products is a plus The Applications Development Team develops & maintains both business area specific and County Wide applications in support of the diverse needs of our business partners spread over 22 departments. The ideal candidate will have: Programming and database skills in some of the following areas; Visual Studio (C#, .Net, MVC), Python, JavaScript, Oracle, SQL Server, and/or Data modeling Experience building interfaces, reports, and use of ETL tools; Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Reporting Services, and SQL Server Integration Services Experience working with web services (e.g., REST), API, BizTalk and PeopleSoft skills is a plus Please Note: These positions will be required to have access to Sheriff’s Office or Probation Department facilities or view data or work with information systems for these departments. This requires that a more extensive “Security Clearance” be performed after hire by the Sonoma County Sheriff’s Office. Successful completion of the probationary period will be contingent upon passing the security clearance, which includes a Live Scan fingerprint based check of California Department of Justice (DOJ) and Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) criminal records. If you are offered a position, which requires a security clearance, the job offer letter will clearly specify this as a condition of the probationary period.  *Salary is negotiable and benefits described herein do not represent a contract and may be changed without notice. For more information, including minimum qualifications, & to apply, visit, www.yourpath2sonomacounty.org or call 707-565-2331. EOE Apply by 5/4/21

Title: Senior Embedded Firmware Engineer
Description: Description  219 Design helps great companies invent products that change the world. 219ers have improved patient outcomes, changed the way we enjoy sports, and revolutionized data transfer - just to name a few. We achieve better results because we create new solutions by crossing engineering disciplines and challenging assumptions.  As an embedded engineer at 219 Design, you will work on a diverse set of projects with a variety of clients. You will be a public face of 219 as you tackle big challenges for products that improve people's lives. We need engineers who are adaptable and passionate about their work. If 219 sounds like a good fit, please apply!  To apply, please fill out our application at https://www.219design.com/careers/.  Requirements  Contribute to development of embedded systems for a variety of projects in one or more of the following areas -Circuit design, schematic capture, and PCB layout for analog and digital circuits -Firmware development for embedded microcontrollers and microprocessors -Integration and debugging of complex embedded systems  Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers -Help define and execute tasks required to complete projects with well-defined or open-ended requirements -Manage client communication -Manage project schedule and logistics for self or small team -Maintain awareness of bigger picture context for 219 Design and our clients while executing lower level tasks  Minimum qualifications -Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar -5+ years of experience as an embedded systems designer -Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to clearly convey complex technical ideas in a customer-facing setting. -In-depth experience designing complex electrical circuitry and familiarity with embedded firmware development OR In-depth experience as a firmware developer with some exposure to electronic circuit design -Motivated by helping customers build great products -In a nutshell, you not only love embedded systems development, but are great at it. -You are authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.  Benefits  219 Design offers health/dental/vision insurance insurance as well as 401(k) + company match, and paid vacation & holidays.  At 219, you will develop compelling prototypes and products while maintaining an average 40-hour work week. You will share in the profit and help shape our company. You will continue to develop by learning to be a stronger technical and strategic thinker through weekly engineering discussion groups and transparent company operation. At 219, we see our job as more than just a way to make money – it is how we fulfill an inner drive to solve problems and to express our creativity.

Title: Project Manager Lead Programmer
Description: Please take the time to read through this listing in its entirety. We took the time to write it very deliberately, you should take the time to read it if you are seriously interested in this position.  Unique opportunity to join a highly rewarding company focused on providing a high quality of life for our employees. We believe happy employees are the best kind to have.  Custom Software Development Company seeks individual well versed in front and back end development of complete custom software packages from start to finish. We have standing orders for custom software.  Qualified individual should be able to take design parameters and in a timely manner create complete software packages ready to deliver. This individual will also head the support team for ongoing support after product delivery for projects they develop.  Being a custom software company strong communication skills are important to ensure clients desired outcome is achieved perfectly. The ability to properly send and receive data are vital to this position.  Full time salary work from home with occasional in person meetings when necessary. The ability to work diligently while working independently is a must, performance based bonuses and raises as incentives.   Flexible work schedule. Candidate must still possess the ability to accomplish set goals.   Time in between completed projects will be spent developing new ideas both for software we maintain as well as potential future projects. The primary focus will be on maintenance of developed software.  Candidate must be dedicated to our company. We value our employees. In order to show our appreciation we offer full time employees a comprehensive benefits package including performance based raises and bonuses.  Quality of work is just as important as how quickly we arrive at the destination.   We will provide you with unmatched service and gratitude. We do expect everyone we work with to share that same attitude.  Job Requirements  Experience with a range of programming languages, the benefits, uses, and real world applications for each type. Included but not limited to  JAVA, FXML, CSS, Python, html, javascript, etc. The right candidate should have the skill set to be able to adapt to meet the needs of each project. Database programming Creation of Searchable and usable Log file data MVC architecture GUI design Experience writing algorithms  Networking   Network Security Netty or similar... Streaming Video Cross platform support Gradle or similar... Experience with Arduino and RaspberryPi are a plus Graphics design would be a plus Experience interfacing with sensors through comm ports to input data into software as well as output data through comm ports to control various components such as LEDs definitely a plus. Laptop Internet Connection Creativity The right attitude Ability to Manage Time and Meet Goals Good Communicator and Listener Sincerity Honesty and Loyalty  Basically we are looking for a very knowledgeable well rounded individual and we will take very good care of the right person.  Pay depends on experience.  Contract to full time.  Send Resumes to the Craigslist provided email. Selected candidates will be contacted for an interview in a timely manner. All resumes should be submitted by no later than April 26th, 2021.  Thank you for your time. We look forward to working with you.

Title: Experienced Embedded Systems Engineer/EE, control loops
Description: Join a world class product team developing a game changing robotic furniture system. We are a group within an established startup backed by top venture capital, with the possibility to spin out.   This is a full time consulting role with the potential to lead to salaried employment based on performance.  This is an on-location job: you must be able to work in downtown San Francisco 3-5 days per week.  We are seeking an experienced, hands-on engineer that has brought custom PCBs from concept to production. The winning candidate will likely have taken a design from needs-specification to circuit schematic, dev-board validation, layout design, fabrication and assembly, through to onboard MCU flashing and shipping of working units. You have a breadth of experience across both firmware and electrical engineering.  About you: -You are a self motivated independent problem solver that can make almost any embedded system work. -You deliver. You may enjoy thoughtful conversations about problems and perfecting design, but in the end you know that what matters is delivering reliable manufacturable solutions.  Key qualifications: -10+ years of experience with embedded systems. -Strong in C/C++. -Knowledge of MCU architectures, peripherals, and development environments, particularly Texas Instruments MCUs. -Experienced producing electrical schematics and specifications. -Deep knowledge of control loops and systems. -Would feel comfortable implementing a system similar to this one: https://www.mathworks.com/help/control/ug/control-of-a-linear-electric-actuator.html -Strong EE fundamentals. -HW/FW/SW debugging skills with lab equipment. -Able to work in downtown San Francisco 3-5 days per week.  Preferred qualifications: -Experience with Texas Instruments MCUs. -Have implemented, tested, and tuned PID control loops on two or more systems. -Experience with TCP/IP stacks from a practical embedded perspective. -Experience with IoT systems and AWS IoT. -Experience with product management and/or Design Thinking.  In your reply, please link to your LinkedIn and provide a detailed copy of your resume listing previous projects.

Title: Senior .NET Developer (100% Remote)
Description: Cunexus is a small fintech startup with the resources and backing of a large parent company.  We're a small, autonomous team building software that makes lending easier, and we're looking for a veteran developer who's a great teammate, communicator, and problem-solver. We need someone who can dive into unfamiliar code, ask questions, figure it out, and make progress without much supervision.  The atmosphere at Cunexus is fun and supportive, and we take pride in writing quality code. We hold ourselves to the standard of being proactive, reliable, and communicative, and because of that we enjoy the benefits of working in an environment that thrives on trust, creative freedom, and the space needed to do our best work.   You should be an expert in .NET with a history designing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining production apps/services/APIs. Ideally with experience handling high traffic loads.   BONUS POINTS FOR EXPERIENCE WITH:  - Fullstack development & modern JavaScript (ES6+, npm, async, etc.)  - MongoDB  - Azure hosting/devops/CI/CD  - Vue (extra bonus for Vuex)  - Data security  - Financial software    TO APPLY please send over your resume and an explanation of why you’re a great fit.     BENEFITS & COMPENSATION  - This position offers a competitive senior developer salary  - We offer medical, dental, vision, 401k with employer matching, and yearly bonuses up to 15%  - Fully remote position  - We hire proactive, productive, communicative developers and give them lots of autonomy  - Join us and be a part of a fun startup that values building software right  CUneXus Solutions Inc. is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or long term unemployment circumstances. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our three extremely successful educational products and build new, innovative products. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.   WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Work with a team of talented engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products Drive the development process for your team, including design, coding, documenting, testing, debugging, and tuning Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products   WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  2+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language Strong communication skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL LEARNING  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Part-time Coding Tutors
Description: Who We Are   theCoderSchool San Jose is an after-school drop-off program for kids learning to code. The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World.   Job Summary   theCoderSchool is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world! You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code - and how to think like a coder - and be rewarded with an amazing experience. This is a part-time position for 2-15 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule. Our open hours are 3-8pm Monday-Thursday and 9am-3pm on weekends.   Responsibilities   A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code. At theCoderSchool, we have two basic teaching styles - your assignment will depend on schedule, ability, and desire.  1. Private and Semi-Private Tutoring. One-on-one or one-on-two coding lessons for kids. Typically in Scratch or Snap for younger kids, and Python, Javascript/HTML and beyond for older kids. Specialty programming like Unity or Swift are helfip as well.  2. Code Class. Traditional curriculum based classes with a larger student to teacher ratio.  This position rocks because you will:  * Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to be our next generation of coders!  * Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the Bay Area.  * Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology    Requirements  What do we want from you? Read on.  * PASSION. All caps! This is all about giving back to the kids. We need to see goose bumps when your student ROCKS a code challenge.  * Great Communicator. There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course patience is a virtue when it comes to kids!  * Street Cred. Our college-level Code Coaches will have Comp Sci or Engineering or similar major at a nearby accredited school. Our Veteran Code Coaches will have relevant industry experience.  * Coding Skills. Strong grasp of general technologies, proficient coder and uber-logical thinker. General knowledge of popular languages with hands on skills in a few is required - Javascript, Python, HTML/CSS, Java, C++ are most helpful. Deep technical skills aren't required - we prefer you communicate well and find answers along with students than know everything upfront.  * Experience teaching kids in Scratch/Snap or other languages is a plus  Sound awesome? Send an email with your resume to sanjose@thecoderschool.com.

Title: Principal full stack engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a principal full stack engineer to our core team of 8, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages, including Node.js • Proficient in developing on the AWS platform/stack • Proficient in the use of SQL  • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.  APPLICATIONS No recruiters please. If you are an applicant, please reply to this ad with your resume and a note explaining your interest. We will not reply to all applications, but we do appreciate your interest. We will contact you if you look like a potential match.

Growing service and product expertiseMore information about ITS can be found at: https://its.ucsc.eduJob OverviewThe Software License Coordinator serves as the liaison between Information Technology Services (ITS), vendors and end-users of all campus-wide software license agreements, acting as a central repository for license agreements and, supporting short and long-term planning for campus and divisional software licensing needs.  The Software License Coordinator works very closely with ITS Product Managers to facilitate the procurement of centralized and unique software licenses as needed to support campus operations. Procurement work will include close partnership with the ITS information security office and Chief Information Security Officer to complete appendix data security or appropriate exceptions, when required. This position also works closely with the divisional business office to track and process financial transactions as needed to reconcile software licensing expenses in the ledger. It is negotiable for this position to work remotely up to 100%, requiring a telecommuting agreement renewed on a regular basis. The employee shall be available in a full-time capacity during assigned telecommuting work hours (specific hours to be discussed with supervisor(s). During the assigned work hours, the employee shall not be the primary caregiver of any children, adults or elders. The employee shall agree to allow the University to assess safety and security of the remote workplace, to ensure that the designated work space is safe and free from hazards and to maintain, repair, inspect, or retrieve University-owned equipment. Pay, Benefits, & Work ScheduleSalary Information: Salary Range: $66,300 - $85,000/annually. Salary commensurate with skills, qualifications and experience.No. of Positions: 1Benefits Level Eligibility: This position is eligible for Full benefitsSchedule Information:Full-time, FixedPercentage of Time: 100%Average Hours Per Week: 40Days of the Week: Mon-FriShift Includes: Day, Evenings, WeekendEmployee Classification: This is a Career appointmentJob End Date: NoneWork Location: Scotts ValleyUnion Representation: NoneJob Code Classification: 007377 (ADMIN OFCR 3) Job Duties50% - SOFTWARE LICENSE ADMINISTRATIONSOFTWARE LICENSE PROCUREMENT AND TRACKING: Responsible for software license procurement (including resolution of appendix DS where applicable), tracking, and, renewals,, working collaboratively with other SAS vendors, UC campuses, vendors, IT Product Managers, Information Security and, others in ITS. Participate in system-wide software licensing discussions, tracking possible new software license agreements for the campus. Conduct cost-benefit analysis of software license acquisitions including cost recovery for distribution and administration. Work closely with IT Product Managers to support the development of standards for software licensing.  Coordinate campus wide license procurement process.  Develop and implement tracking mechanisms for licenses usage reporting and procurement cycles, document annual true up, reporting, and renewal processes.  Work with customers, other stakeholders, and ITS business office to procure and recharge software licenses as applicable.  Work with the divisional business office to process transactions needed to clean up software licensing expenses on the ledger and/or transfer software license expenses to customers as appropriate.  Represent UCSC and serve as a voting member of UCOP Software Services Group and IT Strategic Sourcing Committees. SOFTWARE LICENSE INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION: Partner with product portfolio managers and other responsible individuals on publication of software license information and communication, working collaboratively with Support Center, IT Product Managers and others in ITS. May include some hardware maintenance contracts as appropriate/time permitting.  Curates procurement/agreement calendar for software license (and some hardware) maintenance/service contracts, and timelines for renewals. Acts as an escalation point and resource for procurement process questions. Assembles data on divisional/campus wide expenses as needed to support data driven decision making. 10% - PROJECTS Participate on project teams for service definition or evolution, especially those related to UCSC-licensed products. Coordination of vendor demonstrations of software or hardware products of interest to staff on campus.ITS Security StatementInformation Technology positions are responsible for the security of UC Institutional Information and IT Resources. Supervisors are responsible for making sure their staff have appropriate security skills and qualifications, and complete all appropriate and required security training. Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. Has knowledge of software licensing concepts - including existing campus software, licensing contracts/agreements/terms. Knowledge of Information Technology security functions and practices, including appendix data security. Interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication, active listening, critical thinking, persuasiveness, advising skills. Excellent attention to detail, tracking on cycles and completing tasks on time with a high degree of accuracy. Strong skills in short-term planning, analysis, problem-solving, and customer service. Experience with campus fund accounts, credits/debits, methods for logical cost analysis and expense distribution including determining proportionate share per customer. Experience with procurement methods & working with vendors to obtain quotes and understand contract terms. Ability to write clear process documentation. Ability to communicate effectively with technical staff and vendors. Perform effectively in a busy environment with frequent interruptions, workload changes, and competing demands. Ability to organize work, prioritize tasks, and communicate status to team members in a timely manner. Ability to exercise flexibility, initiative, good judgment, and discretion. Experience developing schedules, and following up on assigned work to ensure quality of service delivery. Title: Programmer Wanted
Description: Cloacina LLC manufactures Packaged Wastewater Treatment Systems for municipal and beverage industries. We are currently filling the position of Programmer. The Programmer position has the primary responsibility for the development and implementation of Cloacina's DAQFactory control software applications for the control of it's various plant models.  Overall scope of these applications includes the development of control logic, data collection, operator interfaces, databases and network architecture.  Key responsibilities and duties include: · Create required programs and interfaces and configure controllers and computers as required per plans and specifications · Participate in project kick-off meetings for projects to ensure a complete understanding of each project · Monitor/review project budgets and schedule for any required changes or corrective actions · Perform factory testing to ensure software functionality · Participate and assist with field start-up and commissioning of equipment Experience in the areas of: · PLC Programming (Allen-Bradley, GE) · HMI and SCADA packages (DAQFactory, Wonderware, RS View, RSLogix) · Database Configuration and reports · Network Configuration (Ethernet, DH+, DH485, Controlnet, Devicenet, Modbus) The ideal candidate should possess: · Attention to detail · Deadline driven to meet or beat required dates · Strong problem solving and communication skills ·Previous experience in water and/or wastewater SCADA applications -Electronics/electrical degree a plus  This position will be located in our Arroyo Grande CA office.  Cloacina LLC offers it's employees competitive wages, full benefits package including Safe Harbor 401K, opportunities for career advancement, extensive training program,  Learn more about our company on-line at www.cloacina.com. Type: Full-time Experience: • PLC Programming, HMI and SCADA packages, Network, Alarm and Database Configuration: 1 year Education: • Associate degree or graduation from accredited trade school in automation

Title: Mid-senior backend engineer to join startup for the COVID Unemployed
Compensation: 110-150K/year DOE.  This is a contract-to-hire position.  We are a pre-funded opportunity.
Description: We are seeking senior backend or full stack engineer for our next big project. Our current site is built with LAMP (Laravel) and we need to build a new site in node.js/AWS Aurora exposing microservices to a React app. We will be using AWS Cognito for authentication (we are currently using Auth0).  We will have our current or next site generate sales and to help the 40MM+ COVID Unemployed. The new bigger and better site will also utilize AWS Lambda (serverless architecture for some background processes). Everything is hosted on AWS. What you will be helping to build all have a massive impact on the world as you'll part of a team helping Citizens, Students, Veterans and Parolees.This is a remote position only during COVID, once COVID is resolved, it will be an in-house role in our offices somewhere on Santana Row. It will be contract to start for the first 3 months, we want to make sure you are a good fit as we want to build a great culture. We we are currently pre-funded.   Benefits inc - (Medical, Dental, etc)  Education budget  Flex time  Flex day  6hr workday (after contract)  Every third Friday off  Paid Bail if arrested for peaceful protesting (Human rights, Gay Rights, Racial rights, Environment rights)  Profit share program

Title: Product Data Coordinator - Building Materials (Part- or Full-Time)
Description: BuildSite designs and develops software for construction professionals. Our mission: to help talented people be more productive, so they can focus on the parts of their job they love to do.   We are looking for a Data Coordinator to help us maintain our construction product database and to ensure consistent quality across the approximately 60,000 documents we house on our servers. The position requires a minimum of 24 hours per week, and can be full-time. It is an ideal position for someone looking for flexibility. Working remotely is an option.  The work is not rote data entry--critical thinking, editorial, and qualitative reasoning skills are required.     Roles and Responsibilities: - Use browser-based tools to review, update, and classify construction documents in a 60,000+ record database.  - Assist with the planning and execution of a number of expansive data overhauls - Run reports and compile data for customer analytics and reporting - Assist with customer support, marketing campaigns, and the maintenance of sales and marketing databases.   Candidate Profile: - Experience with product (or sales and marketing) databases   - Proven ability to creatively and proactively solve problems - Facility with MS Office including intermediate Excel  - Well-organized; self-starter; able to work collaboratively in a small company - Communication skills, both oral and written. Technical writers and editors are encouraged to apply. - Knowledge of building materials and construction a plus  We have an attractive office in Jack London Square, with proximity to good food and good coffee. Commuting by kayak is not out of the question. If you’re interested and qualified, please join us and find out more.   To apply, please send a resume and a cover letter to hr@buildsite.com. Please put “Data Coordinator” in the subject line. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Implementation Specialist and Customer Support
Description: We offer a powerful web-based ERP system which is used by many leading companies in the United States and Europe over the last 15 plus years. Our software manages all aspects of a business, including CRM, contracts, requests, employees, assets, properties, projects, reservations, maintenance and financials. The system has many unique features including a graphical workflow engine, a powerful scripting language and a sophisticated reporting tool.    We are looking for a new team member for Implementation and Customer Support. In this position you will be working in implementing and configuring our software for our clients and helping in the management of their implementation projects. The ideal candidate has a technical background and can also understand the underlying business processes in our target markets.   Job description: - Implementation/customization of the system for new and existing clients. - Analyzing client requests, creating requirements specifications. - Development of use cases and test scenarios. - Working with the system's workflow engine and creating new business workflows for clients. - Modifying screens, adding and removing database fields. - Developing new scripts to implement business functions. - Creating reports from the database, modifying existing reports. - Writing and updating documentation as necessary. - Training and supporting clients. - Developing project schedules. - Communicating with the clients.  Requirements:  - Software implementation background and experience. - Experience with database management or database-oriented systems is a plus. - A degree in computer sciences is a plus. - Background in Real Estate functions is a plus. - Experience with testing and documenting enterprise software is a plus.  Our offer:  - Working with highly skilled and motivated people. - Powerful and innovative technology. - Financially stable company with solid history and a great international customer base. - Opportunity to grow with a rapidly growing company.

Title: Two Data Engineers
Compensation: Commensurate with education and experience, W-2, 1099, or C2C, must be in US without sponsorship
Description: Sierra Cybernetics is seeking two Data Engineers to work for us supporting our government client’s site in either San Francisco or Sacramento.  Work will be remote until COVID restrictions are lifted; thereafter work will be onsite full-time.  The work will support the Judicial Council of California’s Data Analytics and Data Integration program.    The Data Engineer will work directly with program staff to design, construct, and maintain data systems in a branchwide data warehouse.  This is anticipated to be a three year assignment.  Minimum Job-Specific Skills/Qualifications Required (in order of relative importance):  • 5+ years as a data engineer, analyzing, designing, developing and maintaining optimal data pipelines, assembling large, complex data sets that meet business requirements, building the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud based technologies. • Prior experience implementing large scale multi-organizational data warehousing solutions using ETL tools, Machine learning, and Data APIs • 5+ years of experience with principles and techniques of analyzing and documenting all product life cycle artifacts such as: functional requirements, business cases, project charters, communication plans, test plans, detailed functional specifications • 5+ years of experience in data modeling • 5+ years of experience programming in SQL • 5+ years of experience using an enterprise grade ETL/ELT product (i.e., Talend, Informatica, Oracle Data Integrator, etc.) • 5+ years of experience using tools to perform data prep and data cleansing • Proven track record of written and verbal communication skills, with both technical and non-technical audiences.  • Experienced working with project schedules, identifying deliverables, milestones, and timelines for assigned projects.  • Confidence explaining decisions, analyses, and recommendations to stakeholders of varying levels of seniority and digital content knowledge. • Great inter-personal skills, flexible can-do attitude, and drive for continuous improvement. • Ability to assess and evaluate situations and identify creative problem-solving solutions  Additional Skills/Qualifications Desired:  • Recent experience within government agencies or public-sector bodies with projects of a similar type. • Experience using Snowflake, Talend, R, Power BI

Title: Software Engineer, Core Technology
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us build and maintain the core infrastructure for our extremely successful educational products.  The Core Technology team is responsible for researching, implementing, and maintaining back-end frameworks and server-side technologies used by our engineers and applications. The team also monitors and ensures all production and development environments are stable and provides support to other team members with the whole development cycle. Source control, the build and runtime system, as well as deployments, are all responsibilities of the Core Technology team.  As a Software Engineer on our Core Technology team, you’ll work closely with our product teams and have visibility to all parts of our code and products, focusing on performance, uptime, scalability, and reliability. Our servers run RedHat Linux and some amount of administration is done on the systems. We use a variety of storage technologies, which we configure and run, including Cassandra, Oracle, Redis, S3, and Zookeeper. At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Build/Release & Test Environment Engineer
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking an experienced Software Engineer who has a passion for technology and education to help us build a first-rate delivery pipeline for our extremely successful educational products.  As a Software Engineer on our Release Management team, you will implement and manage the release processes across IXLs products. Your team will own the Release Management life cycle, providing the tools and services needed for our development teams to seamlessly manage and deploy code to our users. You will collaborate with our development teams to manage project interdependencies, meet delivery goals, and measure success. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.  What You'll Be Doing  Manage the technical design, engineering from coding to QA, and deployment for our IXL’s products. Build automated release pipelines that package, test and deploy code Improve and adapt our release processes to changing business needs Own the source control system, third-party repositories, build system, and release data system Work cross-functionally with our Engineering, Product Management, QA, and Design teams to maintain and communicate a clear release schedule and ensure successful deployments   What We're Looking For  Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline 2+ years of experience in software engineering Knowledge of Release Management Excellent programming skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams Passion for improving education through technology  About IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Senior Implementer - SaaS (remote)
Compensation: Depends on experience; health and dental benefits, 401k matching, PTO
Description: Thrive with Agiloft  Are you an experienced Senior Implementer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?  Agiloft is looking for Implementers that thrive working in a fast-paced organization with interesting business challenges requiring smart solutions.  Why Join Agiloft?   Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant. Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years. The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row. Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization. Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies. Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.   As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards over achievement.  Position Overview  This individual has developed a level of understanding of the system’s capabilities that allows him or her to lead large-scale implementation projects. This role plays a leadership function within the project, serving as the leader of project design and assisting with project management duties where required.  A Senior Implementer has honed the necessary speed, accuracy, and design skills to independently design highly complex Agiloft systems. This is a challenging position, requiring the individual to have a strong analytical and logical mind, proven ability to communicate with customers and a team, and excellent attention to detail.  Job Responsibilities   Independently design highly complex Agiloft systems for customers Lead large scale, highly complex projects both in implementation and in customer communication Oversee and provide constructive feedback for junior implementers assisting with projects Participate as a lead or co-lead of Enterprise projects, in partnership with Architects Skillfully handle difficult customers with complex business requirements by: Anticipating and resolving complex escalations Holding complex discussions with clients Negotiating change orders and change requests of a medium size Handle initial escalation calls Provide quality control for senior implementer-led projects Write detailed specifications and test plans that can be built and performed by more junior implementers or partners Contribute to internal projects as needed   Required Qualifications   Technical background (with a preference for a 4-year college degree) 4-8 years working as an implementer or demonstrated experience equivalent Strong analytical skills, creativity, familiarity with web-based technologies, and the ability to continuously improve an individual’s implementation skills Ability to manage projects of high complexity, complex business requirements, and/or difficult customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Mentorship skills to provide guidance and feedback for junior implementers Ability to lead business calls to discuss project progress, handle escalation calls, and negotiate change orders Initiative in seeking ways to contribute to the success of the company that goes beyond a narrow definition of job responsibilities Experience with database concepts and web-based technologies is a plus Prior experience with LegalTech in general and with Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) specifically a significant plus   Company Benefits and Perks  Competitive salary Health, dental, and vision insurance Voluntary Life-AD&D, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability 401k plan with company match Paid Parental Leave policy Referral bonuses Generous vacation and flexible work schedules Professional development and career growth opportunities Awesome team members  Interested? Apply now!  For a full list of open positions and to submit your application, go to our website: http://www.agiloft.com/jobs.htm  Applicants from underrepresented groups such as minorities, veterans, or individuals with disabilities encouraged to apply   Agiloft is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination of any kind. All employment decisions at Agiloft are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or social ethnic origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, parental status, marital status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Backend Developer - Mobile App (Video Streaming, User Verification)
Description: Hiago.com is a startup in Mountain View, we are looking for a SUPERSTAR mobile backend developer for consumer/social applications to join us as our first full time hire.  We see many problems with Nextdoor.com such as bullying, racism, etc. that can be solved with more modern approaches. Think a mobile app with video and audio of real neighbor voices, mixed with Clubhouse-like conversations. Think you must be a neighborhood "lead" to join and invite others to activate each neighborhoods. Think Ring doorbell like "knocking" before sending private messages.  Think a new type of neighborhood social network based on voice—where neighbors come together to talk, listen and learn from each other in real-time.  We are a startup in Mountain View, we are looking for a strong backend developer, with prior experience or very strong interest in building new mobile applications using the Agora.io, Tencent framework, STKs, RESTful API and join our growing team as a co-founder. E.g., see: https://docs.agora.io/en/Agora%20Platform/landing-page  Think a mobile app with video and audio of real neighbor voices, mixed with Clubhouse-like conversations and Tik-Tok Videos. Think you must be a neighborhood "lead" to join and invite others to activate each neighborhoods or you need to be a Creator of content.   You will help build a new type of neighborhood social network based on voice—where neighbors come together to talk, listen and learn from each other in real-time.  You will be responsible for developing high-quality applications. They will also be responsible for designing and implementing testable and scalable code.   Job Requirements  Technical acumen and ability to write code for mobile and web applications; must have skills in either Android, iOS or React Native. Proficient  Swift or Python and project experience with Standard Design Patterns Experience in application metrics embedding like firebase, and other analytics tools Ideally Have audio/video/image processing/streaming related development experience; familiar with audio and video quality indicators, or familiar with network transmission congestion control and packet loss countermeasures. Strategize, plan and develop database schema and models to utilize, store, and manage video and audio in a streaming mobile application with tens of thousands of concurrent users. Develop quality software and web applications Analyze and maintain existing software applications Design highly scalable, cost efficient and CI/CD code Discover and fix programming bugs Understanding of html5 web sockets and XMPP is a plus  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related field Development experience with programming languages SQL database or relational database skills  A good understanding of AWS or GCP tools.  Backend developer job responsibilities include:  Responsible for writing the web services and APIs used by front-end developers and mobile application developers. Responsible for server-side web application logic as well as the integration of the front-end part. Main focus on coding and debugging. Conduct UI tests and optimize performance  Desired Skills beyond Backend skills (not necessary but a plus) :  Build native apps for iOS and Android devices. Create feature-rich web apps & portals that work consistently across all HTML 5 compliant browsers (Edge, Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Opera, and all mobile variants). Create a single app that looks, feels, and operates consistently across all platforms, both native and web based. Integrate to backend systems quickly and easily. Provide support, testing and system enhancements. Provide troubleshooting as necessary in Testing, QA, and Production environments. Identify application bottlenecks and opportunities to optimize performance. Contribute to a team-oriented environment that requires solid interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills. Participate in code reviews and take an active role in developing best practices within the team. Additional projects and responsibilities as assigned.  Education:  Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Experience:  Mobile programming experience. Web-based programming experience. Experience in geospatial social networks, mapping, and verification of users.   Skills:  Xamarin, MS Visual Studio, REST APIs, .Net/C#, HTML5, CSS3, PDF.js, JavaScript, SQL Server. Possess sound analytical problem-solving and documentation skills. Effective communication. Working knowledge of software development lifecycle methodology, including Agile. Ability to prioritize conflicting demands. Ability to work independently as well as on a team-assigned project.   Benefits negotiable/ Salary-Equity combination.

Title: Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor | $80,000 - $84,000 per year
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   HireArt is helping Transdev, a leader in global transportation solutions, hire an Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor. In this role, you’ll work closely with both operations leadership and autonomous vehicle teams to execute strategic initiatives.You’ll ensure drivers have the tools, information, and mentorship to succeed. You’ll define operational priorities, troubleshoot issues, and contribute data-driven insights to improve overall program performance.The ideal candidate is experienced in operations and in leading teams, and is passionate about autonomous vehicle technology.This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent role with the following available shifts:AM: 5:30 AM - 2:30 PMPM: 2:30 PM - 9:30 PMMoonlight: 9:30 PM - 6:30 AMAs Autonomous Vehicle Operations Supervisor, you will: Support operations leadership team in mission assignment, leading meetings, and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.Participate in lean/kaizen, black belt, and other operational excellence initiatives.Perform all vehicle driver safety evaluation ride checks, observation of drivers while on route/test track, and prescribe the necessary retraining.Respond to service problems including rerouting, accidents, and incidents with the goal of restoration of interrupted service, and support drivers in preparing accident reports such as post-accident drug and alcohol testing according to policy.Maintain telephone contact with transit vehicle drivers in conjunction with client’s dispatch. Debrief and manage drivers, and coordinate vehicle exchanges during each shift.Ensure compliance to global process standards throughout the site and work on continuous improvement initiatives.Inform other management personnel regarding operational or personnel problems as appropriate and offer ideas towards resolution.Investigate and respond to unsafe location/situation reports.Interpret metrics, find opportunities, and implement actions to drive results.Maintain routine records and perform a variety of clerical work activities related to the property operation.Maintain a high degree of confidentiality of all information.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations, or a related field, or equivalent work experience2+ years of operations experience in a supervisory roleA proven record of effective project and people managementStrong analytical and decision-making abilitiesExcellent written and verbal communicationHighly organized with acute attention to detailComfortable with computers and various software/appsAbility to travel as neededAbility to work outdoors in various weather conditions as neededPassion for technology and autonomous vehiclesMust be 21+ years of age Working Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to,  bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 25 lbs. The ability to work outdoors in various weather conditions is required. Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), permanent position through HireArt and based in San Francisco, CA. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply   About Transdev We are the largest private provider of multiple modes of transport in North America.Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities contract with us to operate their transportation systems. Our goal is to help our clients provide transit systems that are appealing, convenient, integrated networks that people actively choose to ride. In cities all across the country, we’re helping our clients move toward making public transit equivalent to the city’s lifeblood, circulating and connecting riders to the people and places they care about.We are part of a global company, Transdev, operating in 17 countries on five continents.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/1cf029bf/apply

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek is Accredited by Higher Learning Commission.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: STEM Teaching Fellowship
Compensation: Teacher Training Program in fall 2021; full-time, paid teaching in partner school by fall 2022
Description: Have you considered a career in teaching science, math, engineering or technology (STEM)? EnCorps STEM Teachers Program transitions accomplished career-changers to teaching middle and high school in California’s high need schools through a 1-2 year Fellowship. We are actively seeking our next cohort of aspiring middle and high school teachers who have previous industry experience. As an EnCorps STEM Teaching Fellow, you will have the opportunity to use your leadership and industry experience to inspire the next generation by working as a full-time salaried teacher in an EnCorps partner school.  Racial and socioeconomic achievement gaps persist in our schools today. There is a 26% or greater gap in math achievement between white students and students of color. We believe in the power of STEM to offer opportunities to students who need it most. You can change this by becoming a STEM teacher.  EnCorps STEM Teachers Program’s vision is to realize a day where all students, regardless of socioeconomic status, are inspired and prepared to pursue their dreams. STEM Teaching Fellows transition to teaching careers within 1-3 years with the support of EnCorps training, guest teaching field experience, credentialing guidance, EnCorps cohort and the EnCorps network of schools. When you become an EnCorps Fellow, you are committing to providing access to quality education within low income schools, supporting students who need your mentorship the most.  The EnCorps team will provide guidance as you begin the process to become a credentialed teacher. Additionally, the broad network of fellows provides first hand experience from people who, like you, transitioned into a teaching career.  Fellowship details: Fellows earn their credential from a university partner over the course of 4-14 months EnCorps will place you in a local partner school for 1 semester where you will spend 2-5 hours per week as a volunteer Guest Teacher Fellows train online/on-demand and at 3 in-person cohort events each year by participating in enhanced skills preparation workshops Fellows receive extensive support and mentoring from the EnCorps staff, their cohort, and EnCorps’ network of schools With the help of EnCorps, you will develop your unique timeline to become a credentialed, paid teacher, in as little as 9 months, or 3 years depending on your personal goals. *Find out more about the timeline and teaching credentials at https://encorps.org/teaching-fellowship/  Minimum requirements: Have a bachelor's degree  Have at least 1 year of hands-on STEM industry work experience or have an advanced degree in a STEM field* Financial plan to pursue your credential and participate in unpaid Guest Teaching Training for one semester For more specific eligibility and FAQ’s, please see https://www.encorps.org/teaching-fellowship/eligibility  *Looking for backgrounds in: Accounting, finance, banking, mathematics, statistics, data analyst, computer programmer, IT, coding, product manager, engineering (civil, mechanical, ALL), healthcare, scientific research, biotech, lab work, etc.  EnCorps’ Diversity Statement  At EnCorps, we challenge current educational inequalities by connecting high needs schools with high quality STEM educators to eliminate the systemic injustice preventing children of color from entering the future STEM workforce. By recruiting, training and supporting diverse and committed STEM professionals to volunteer and teach in communities most impacted by oppressive systems, we are able to provide opportunities and access to quality STEM education. We will continue to create learning opportunities that challenge assumptions and push our team to transform practices that better serve students in the communities we serve.  Want to empower students and inspire the next generation of STEM leaders? Join EnCorps today!  Final application deadline: April 30, 2021. Apply today at: https://www.encorps.org/application-part1   See EnCorps through the eyes of a fellow: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=waf-mAvcNjM

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=sfdata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Build Engineer(Azure DevOps) for R&D Org
Description: Our fast growing biotech client is currently searching for an experienced and energetic Senior Azure DevOps Build Engineer on a long term contract basis to start. Full benefits, very competitive pay, great mission, solid team. MUST be local to the Seattle area.   Job Summary:  The DevOps Build Engineer is a critical role within our agile development team tasked with defining, architecting, and implementing the next generation of build, configuration, and release tools and infrastructure using Azure DevOps 2019. This person should be passionate about creating a core foundational layer which enables software development, testing, and delivery to be as efficient, effective, and enjoyable as possible.  Essential Duties:  Gather requirements, design, and then implement the next generation of our scalable, multi-stage CI and CD tooling and infrastructure platform using Azure DevOps 2019 Own and continually improve our TFVC and Git branching, deployment, and release strategies Contribute to version-controlled C# code as well as build and deploy scripts as part of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipeline Improve the replicability of build and test environments using centralized configuration management, virtualization, and containerization (e.g. Docker) Adhere to established development, QA, and reporting procedures Work closely with the Development and Testing teams to seamlessly integrate automated testing and scripts into the CI/CD Pipeline Work both independently and in collaboration with cross-functional agile teams Excel in verbal and written communication skills  Desired:  6+ years’ experience in Information Technology as DevOps Engineer with hands-on experience in all aspects of DevOps (source control, branching strategies, continuous integration, deployments, etc.) Strong programming and scripting knowledge, e.g. C#, PowerShell, Bash, JavaScript, WiX Strong understanding of software configuration management systems and hosted TFVC and Git source code version control systems Strong understanding of software testing processes and strategies including integrating automated tests into the CI/CD process as well as the generation of meaningful test metrics Strong communication and coaching skills Strong knowledge of Azure DevOps, Windows 10/2016, and Active Directory. Linux system experience a big plus Strong knowledge of Docker containerization Working knowledge of Windows-based installers (WiX) Experience designing and working in a HIPAA compliant system is ideal

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=seattledata&utm_medium=job_board
