Title: Senior Implementation Specialist - (remote)
Compensation: Depends on experience; health and dental benefits, 401k matching, PTO
Description: Thrive with Agiloft  Are you an experienced Senior Implementer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?  Agiloft is looking for Implementers that thrive working in a fast-paced organization with interesting business challenges requiring smart solutions.  Why Join Agiloft?   Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant. Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years. The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row. Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization. Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies. Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.   As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards over achievement.  Position Overview  This individual has developed a level of understanding of the system’s capabilities that allows him or her to lead large-scale implementation projects. This role plays a leadership function within the project, serving as the leader of project design and assisting with project management duties where required.  A Senior Implementer has honed the necessary speed, accuracy, and design skills to independently design highly complex Agiloft systems. This is a challenging position, requiring the individual to have a strong analytical and logical mind, proven ability to communicate with customers and a team, and excellent attention to detail.  Job Responsibilities   Independently design highly complex Agiloft systems for customers Lead large scale, highly complex projects both in implementation and in customer communication Oversee and provide constructive feedback for junior implementers assisting with projects Participate as a lead or co-lead of Enterprise projects, in partnership with Architects Skillfully handle difficult customers with complex business requirements by: Anticipating and resolving complex escalations Holding complex discussions with clients Negotiating change orders and change requests of a medium size Handle initial escalation calls Provide quality control for senior implementer-led projects Write detailed specifications and test plans that can be built and performed by more junior implementers or partners Contribute to internal projects as needed   Required Qualifications   Technical background (with a preference for a 4-year college degree) 4-8 years working as an implementer or demonstrated experience equivalent Strong analytical skills, creativity, familiarity with web-based technologies, and the ability to continuously improve an individual’s implementation skills Ability to manage projects of high complexity, complex business requirements, and/or difficult customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Mentorship skills to provide guidance and feedback for junior implementers Ability to lead business calls to discuss project progress, handle escalation calls, and negotiate change orders Initiative in seeking ways to contribute to the success of the company that goes beyond a narrow definition of job responsibilities Experience with database concepts and web-based technologies is a plus Prior experience with LegalTech in general and with Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) specifically a significant plus   Company Benefits and Perks  Competitive salary Health, dental, and vision insurance Voluntary Life-AD&D, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability 401k plan with company match Paid Parental Leave policy Referral bonuses Generous vacation and flexible work schedules Professional development and career growth opportunities Awesome team members  Interested? Apply now!  For a full list of open positions and to submit your application, go to our website: http://www.agiloft.com/jobs.htm  Applicants from underrepresented groups such as minorities, veterans, or individuals with disabilities encouraged to apply   Agiloft is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination of any kind. All employment decisions at Agiloft are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or social ethnic origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, parental status, marital status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: Data Analyst Assistant sought for Financial Investment Modeling
Description: A personal assistant with demonstrable PowerBI and Data Analytic skills is being sought for 1-2 hours/week. Initial projects will focus on developing and refining financial investment models. No weekend work ... must be available during normal weekday hours. $40/hr. Perfect for knowledgeable  Professional with extra time, Post Grad or upper-level university student or retired  . Good for one’s CV  Candidate will need to:  1) adapt an Excel program that evaluates stock performance to PowerBI that provides trend performance with If/Then functions; 2) integrate other data sources; 3) generate report templates;  4) maintain the data...which can probably be done remotely; 7) reside on the Eastside; 8) have reliable transportation; and 9) have knowledge of bookkeeping principles (helpful.). My current activities focus on Crypto products, Stocks via active long volatility options. Please do not apply unless you have a WORKING KNOWLEDGE and preferably experience in these areas.   We anticipate this being long term relationship with more hours and a broader scope.  The offices are located near Bridle Trails/ Kirkland. My office is up 1 flight of stairs. The position initially requires meeting 1-2 hours/week in person. Mask not needed. Employer has received both Covid immunizations.  Please reply with qualifications, your location, and an email/phone number at which to reach you

Title: Senior Web Developer
Description: We are looking for a Senior Web Developer to join our team!  Located in Redmond, 1stMILE is a software technology company focused on providing payment solutions to businesses in the automotive marketplace. We have more than 12,000+ locations using our software to process payments and increase revenue via our integrated solutions.  Responsibilities:  Develop responsive, scalable, and maintainable web experiences Support troubleshooting, bug fixing, and other required upgrades for existing functionality Work with business stakeholders to define/clarify project requirements and acceptance criteria  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field required. 5+ years of experience required. Experience building dynamic, responsive web pages using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Experience building modern web and mobile applications using JavaScript libraries and tooling including React.js, Node.js, and Express. Working experience with REST Services and APIs, Windows, Linux, Bash, Git. Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.  We Offer:  Medical, dental, and vision benefits 401(k) with employer matching Training and mentorship to help you succeed A path and place to grow your career  1stMILE, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Senior devops engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a senior and experienced devops engineer to our core team of 10, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in modern/current devops technologies and practices on the AWS platform, including CDK, Lambda, SQS, VPCs, EC2, etc. • Proficient and experienced in CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, infrastructure management, deployment automation, and automated software release • Experienced in developing automated monitoring services and reports to track service, network, and application availability and performance, and to trigger notifications when intervention is needed • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.

Title: Waterjet Operator
Description: Local Metal Fabrication Shop looking for an experienced Waterjet Operator to join our team.  The Waterjet Operator performs a variety of duties and utilizes multiple skillsets.   Operator is required to:  * Proficient knowledge of the OMAX New Maxiem 2040 Waterjet Systems * Follow directions carefully * Has basic mechanical knowledge * Manual dexterity * Good eyesight and the ability to perform repetitive tasks * Attention to detail and quality is required * Reads and understands blue prints, isometric drawings and work orders * Forklift and material handling  * Receives and carries out directions from designated Supervisors * Must be able to understand and comply with Safety Practices * Identifies and obtains equipment, tools and materials needed to properly perform job function * Properly executes Hazardous Material Disposal activities * Maintains the work area and equipment in a clean and orderly, FOD free condition * Knowledge and use of common hand tools * Performs other duties as assigned * Must work well under pressure, meeting and completing multiple deadlines. The incumbent shall, at all times, demonstrate cooperative behavior with colleagues and supervisors. * Being at work on time and maintaining good attendance is a condition of employment and is an essential function of the job.  Compensation based on experience. Company provides health, dental, vision, IRA, PTO, vacation and paid holiday.

Title: Software Configuration Engineer
Description: Are you good at solving puzzles?    Could you write a regular expression to capture the house number in any US street address?   Could you write a program to compare two lists of city names and find the unique values from each list?   You may be the engineer we are looking for!  Melissa Data, a leader in providing solutions for data validation, is seeking a talented engineer for our Seattle-area Global Products Unit. In this position, you will become familiar with our Global Address software package and be part of a team that is configuring it to efficiently parse, match, correct, and format addresses for countries all around the world.  As an ideal candidate for this position you may have a background in quality assurance, programming, or sales engineering.  You will definitely have a good technical mind, be fun to work with, and enjoy solving technical puzzles.    The required skill set for this job includes: - 1+ years writing code as a Developer or SDET - Ability to identify the root cause of software/configuration failures - Excellent attention to detail and great follow through - Ability to learn and master complex technical systems - Ability to work both independently and as part of a team - Top notch interpersonal skills  Additional experience in any of these areas will be helpful, but is not absolutely necessary:  - 1+ year of experience doing initial triage on software test failures - Proficiency with regular expressions - Experience writing or modifying software applications in Java, C++ or C# - Basic reading/writing skills for any non-English language.  Melissa Data is an equal opportunity employer offering a compensation package that includes a competitive salary, full benefits and a 401k. Benefits: • 401(k) with company match • Medical, dental, and vision insurance • Paid holidays and personal time off  To apply for this position, email your resume  OR use this link:  https://www.melissa.com/jobs/jobapply.aspx  • No phone calls or recruiters please.  poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf (eeoc.gov) Melissa is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.  Melissa is a Government contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974 (VEVRAA), which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment four categories of “protected veterans.” These four categories are defined as follows: •         A “disabled veteran” is one of the following: o   a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or o   a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. •         A “recently separated veteran” means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. •         An “active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran” means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. •         An “Armed forces service medal veteran” means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

Title: Product Manager for Wine Production Software: Remote
Description: InnoVint is a rapidly growing software company, offering the wine industry’s leading wine production software solution. Our cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) solution helps commercial wineries’ wine production, winegrowing, governmental compliance, IT and finance teams efficiently manage the end-to-end operations of a modern, successful winery. From vineyard to bottle to filing mandatory compliance reports with the TTB, InnoVint is modern winemaking reimagined! Watch this 5-minute video for a quick overview of the InnoVint platform in action. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNBBZz08DWY   The Role We’re a passionate team focused on making it easier for winemakers to make great wine and now we’re excited to be hiring our first Product Manager. If you join us, you’ll contribute to our product strategy, orchestrate product execution and help shape our business, culture and internal processes.  An InnoVint Product Manager has a broad scope, but your initial goals will be to augment our small but mighty product design team by improving our design processes around mapping complex winemaking flows into software. You will be an active participant in ideation, goal setting, iteration, and approval of new features, while coordinating these cycles to ensure we’re on schedule and meeting business goals. You will be responsible for scheduling meetings, setting deadlines, collecting feedback, and getting buy in from multiple teams.  You will be stepping into a mature team that’s delivered complex and high-impact features over the last 8 years. Even with this expertise, we know there is a missing piece in our product design team and we’re ready to learn from you. Your job is to amplify the talents of our design team by creating an effective pipeline of product output.  You will establish goals for each feature and ensure those goals are met throughout the design process. You will work closely with the CEO, CTO, UX Lead, our users, and our internal winemakers to establish goals for each feature. You will ensure these goals are being met throughout the design process, while being careful and cognizant to keep the product team aligned and focused.  Beyond leading our product design process, your auxiliary responsibilities will be to work with customers and partners to inform our view of the market. You will work with marketers to go to market with valuable, differentiated offerings and to design and refine our core market positioning, work with sales on strategic accounts, and support our executive team and Board of Directors with pricing and strategic analysis.  An InnoVint Product Manager enables the entire company to execute a strategically differentiated and innovative product and business strategy. It’s a challenging but essential and highly visible, exciting role.   Does the Product Manager Role at InnoVint Excite You? If joining us as our first Product Manager is something that excites you, send us an email to careers@innovint.us. Please read the full job description here: https://www.innovint.us/contact/careers/productmanager/  At InnoVint we value diversity and believe diverse teams make better products and contribute to more successful companies.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Software Engineer Conservation Biology Institute -- Corvallis, OR -- Remote optional Conservation Biology Institute (CBI) is hiring a full-stack software engineer to help build science-powered, spatially-focused web applications to inform real-world decisions about conservation and the natural environment. About the position We are looking for an experienced and versatile developer who is comfortable working with all aspects of web application development. You will work with clients, users, and stakeholders along with other team members to conceptualize, plan, design, build, deploy, and maintain a variety of applications. You will help guide and mentor other developers, helping them debug code, develop strategies to solve problems, and test and improve code. We will try to match you with projects and roles that fit with your interests and give you opportunities to work with new, technologies, and responsibilities. About us CBI is a non-profit with a mission to conserve biological diversity and build a more sustainable world. We are a cohesive group of scientists, GIS analysts, spatial modellers, and software engineers. The small software team works closely with other staff at CBI, as well as with external clients to design and build custom, innovative software. As an organization, we have a unique capability to deliver software informed by scientific expertise and backed by high quality spatial data. We are responsible for Data Basin (a science-based environmental spatial data platform), as well as numerous online decision support applications. Requirements We are looking for applicants with 5+ years of software development experience. You should be skilled with the languages, tools, and frameworks used in front- and back-end web application development. You should be comfortable learning and applying new languages and tools on-the-job. We commonly use the following technologies in our work: Python, Django, modern JavaScript, ReactJS, CSS, Mapbox GL JS, and various GIS tools and software libraries. Compensation The salary range for this position is $70k - $82k. Benefits include: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; paid vacation, holiday, and sick days, employer matched Simple IRA retirement plan, and flexible work schedules. Apply Please email your résumé to Pam Frost and include: why you’re interested in this position, how your past experience relates to it, and any examples of your work that you’re able to share with us (GitHub, Stack Overflow, etc. profiles are welcome). We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Title: Hiring Senior Front-End Software Engineer for Bio-tech Company
Description: Our client is a fast-growing bio-tech company that is helping researchers and scientists tackle some of our most challenging diseases by developing software for research and diagnostic devices. They are currently looking for an established Senior Front-End Engineer with a strong Angular background to design and build user interfaces for these high-end medical tools. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of an organization that is using cutting edge technology to facilitate discoveries in Neuroscience, Immuno-Oncology, and various other fields. A successful candidate will join an elite team of engineers empowering healthcare during a high period of company growth.  An ideal candidate will have the following:  Proven experience designing and creating commercial SW applications Expertise developing with Angular 6+ Experience building large scale SPA solutions Confidence with Material Design, PostgreSQL, Windows Services, Web Api (Net core 3.1+), and container technology Proficiency creating API endpoints for frontend development using Microsoft Web Api and C# An ability to design solutions for unique software applications in embedded environments An eye for design and a collaborative mindset  Both our client and our team love that their work has such a meaningful outcome -- apply with West500 Partners and we can discuss this opportunity further!  Beyond this role, we are currently hiring for Senior .NET Engineers, Software Architects, Java Developers, Android Developers, Back-End Services, and more.    Applicants, please be local to the Greater Seattle area. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor at this time. U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=seattledata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Software Development Manager
Description: Software Development Manager  Downtown Seattle Full time  Downtown Seattle client continues to be a leader in growth in Seattle, continuing to build out new products and services for their national customer base. We are looking for a Software Development Manager who is a hands on leader, both technically as well as having the ability to lead small teams. Ideally, you've worked building massively scalable systems in a hands on role (Senior Dev or Technical Lead in the recent past) and are currently or looking to lead a small team building out some awesome services.   Some of the areas you will work on include: • Lead the architecture and implementation of web services and front end apps • Love tackling complex problems and are comfortable working across the full stack • Develop great user experiences on both web and mobile. • Encourage your small team to build rock solid code, that is efficient and ships code frequently • Iterate quickly and ship code frequently. • Working in a tight knit team and being comfortable taking ownership   Some of our technology includes: • JavaScript and modern front end frameworks, including React and Redux plus native apps on the front-end • Java, Python, and Node.js along with NoSQL and SQL technologies  Requirements for the role: • Minimum of 5+ years' experience as a software engineer, working in a fast pace environment, coding with Java, C#, JavaScript or Python. • As an SDM, we'd like to see 2+ years, either as an SDM over a small team or a Technical Lead, preferably someone who has consumer facing experience with the latest JS frameworks.  • Bachelors or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.  For consideration, please send resume to jeffr@triadgroup.com.  All inquiries will be kept confidential.   Jeff Roodhouse  TRIAD Group jeffr@triadgroup.com 425.454.0282 x220

Title: Software Engineer / Consultant (React / Node.js / TypeScript) (US-base
Description: We’re working on a range of exciting remote projects for clients in the renewable energy and travel verticals. The teams are nice, positive and collaborative, solving interesting technical challenges at scale in well run engineering environments.  You'll bring strong full stack software development in the JavaScript ecosystem, a passion for building intuitive full stack web applications, creative problem solving abilities and a great, positive attitude.  What you’ll be doing: Building consumer facing software at scale and solving interesting, real world business problems in a modern technical environment Writing high-quality, clean and maintainable code for new features across the stack, while providing consulting expertise and collaborating with engineering and product stakeholders Communicating clearly, professionally, and consistently with your team and your client Be a good person; we’re proud to work with every single Rooster Park engineer and you will be too!  What you bring to the table: 7+ years of professional software development experience 2+ years in the JavaScript ecosystem, ideally some combination of React / Node.js / TypeScript; bonus if you have experience with Cloud platforms Real-world experience building software in a complex and fast moving environment; a mix of enterprise and startup experience is ideal Strong collaboration and communication skills; you function well autonomously with drive and self-direction, but you’re also comfortable being part of a team and working in partnership with your engineering colleagues You are reliable, responsible, consistent, nice, and passionate about what you do  We pay competitively and have excellent healthcare and other benefits. This is a long term remote consulting opportunity, USA based. Unfortunately at this time we are not able to provide sponsorship for employment and request no agency submissions. Thank you!   We're Rooster Park, and we're a boutique consulting and recruiting agency obsessed with finding the right fits for a small set of partners. You can learn more at http://www.roosterpark.com/. Hope to hear from you!

Title: Principal Full Stack Engineer (RoR/etc), Full-Time, Remote, Music Tech
Compensation: Competitive cash compensation paid biweekly plus good chunk of equity
Description: COMPANY JamKazam (https://jamkazam.com/) has spent the last 6 years building the best platform in the world to help musicians play together live and in-sync over the Internet from different locations with high quality audio and video. See one of our online music festivals for an example: https://youtu.be/JGShI6izZBA. And see this overview for an intro: https://youtu.be/ylYcvTY9CVo. We are a private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech.  OPPORTUNITY We are looking for a talented, experienced principal engineer with 7+ years of experience developing complex applications with full stack scope to join our core engineering team on a full-time contract basis for a long-term run – initially as a heavy individual contributor, and then ideally once you have sufficient exposure to the product portfolio, also as team lead. We want someone who is excited by our music mission, who can operate with relative autonomy across a broad scope of our application portfolio, and who enjoys development across front-end, back-end, database, and devops – pretty much everything. This gig is fully remote - the whole team is remote/virtual and always has been.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages • Experience and passion for all aspects of development – front-end, back-end, database, devops • Expertise and proficiency in Ruby on Rails • Experience in front-end application development with React/jQuery or similar • Proficient in use of current Web UI development technologies, in particular Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3 • Proficient in use of SQL  • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  COMPENSATION This is a 1099 contractor position. Very competitive cash compensation paid biweekly, plus a healthy chunk of equity in a rapidly growing music tech company in a highly compelling market segment.  LOCATION This is a fully remote position. No need to come into any office location.

Title: Data Analyst Assistant sought for Financial Investment Modeling
Description: A personal assistant with demonstrable PowerBI and Data Analytic skills is being sought for 1-2 hours/week. Initial projects will focus on developing and refining financial investment models. No weekend work ... must be available during normal weekday hours. $40/hr. Perfect for knowledgeable  Professional with extra time, Post Grad or upper-level university student or retired  . Good for one’s CV  Candidate will need to:  1) adapt an Excel program that evaluates stock performance to PowerBI that provides trend performance with If/Then functions; 2) integrate other data sources; 3) generate report templates;  4) maintain the data...which can probably be done remotely; 7) reside on the Eastside; 8) have reliable transportation; and 9) have knowledge of bookkeeping principles (helpful.). My current activities focus on Crypto products, Stocks via active long volatility options. Please do not apply unless you have a WORKING KNOWLEDGE and preferably experience in these areas.   We anticipate this being long term relationship with more hours and a broader scope.  The offices are located near Bridle Trails/ Kirkland. My office is up 1 flight of stairs. The position initially requires meeting 1-2 hours/week in person. Mask not needed. Employer has received both Covid immunizations.  Please reply with qualifications, your location, and an email/phone number at which to reach you

Title: SENIOR MIGRATION PRACTICE LEAD
Description: Are you excited about data or databases? Do you like being involved in solving complex business problems by creating advanced and innovative technical solutions?  If yes — we’ve got a solution for you! Join DB Best team — we’ve been helping customers modernize legacy applications, create new solutions, and manage data/applications/infrastructure for almost 20 years. With close to 500 engineers and consultants in 8 offices worldwide, DB Best is considered to be the best company in the world for database and application migrations and modernizations having absolutely unique expertise in developing migration software for Microsoft and AWS. Taking care of data for customers to make sure it’s secure, available, consistent, and managed in a cost-effective manner with mitigated risks — this is in our DNA. So if you enjoy working with data and considering what’s your next career move, we’ll be thrilled to talk to you!  DB Best is looking for a Senior Migration Practice Lead to join our US team and lead the delivery of challenging customer’s projects. The key activities include supporting sales conversations, designing future-state architectures, and managing the technical team.  RESPONSIBILITIES Support customer sales conversations on calls and visits with technical insight Author high level architectural designs, and project plans and work-packages for proposals Manage the production of customer-ready proposals with detailed estimates from technical teams Lead multiple concurrent customer delivery projects of a highly technical nature Design work packages for technical teams at the necessary level of detail Lead the platform migration practice by improving process, tools, technologies and documentation Manage and hire team members; Conduct reviews, professional development and coaching QUALIFICATIONS 10+ years of experience designing and developing data-driven applications, and driving the full software development process, including familiarity with all the associated tools and processes Deep knowledge in .NET or Java stacks, both strongly preferred Technical background in databases, such as Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase, DB2, and/or other databases is strongly preferred Experience with leading design, refactoring or migration of application in cloud infrastructures and services for at least one of Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services and Google GCP Strong communication skills to both lead investigation and create and communicate new designs to customers and technical teams, combined with proven skills to create clear, detailed, concise documentation, such as architecture diagrams, presentations, and design documents Proficiency in the use of a variety of modeling and communication tools Extensive experience leading large distributed teams from start to finish through both technical leadership and personal coaching Prior extensive consulting experience managing large teams and presenting to customers at C-level PREFERRED SKILLS Broad IT industry exposure in different verticals and public speaking will be a plus.

Title: Senior Tableau Consultant - Remote (USA Based)
Description: We’re working with one of our favorite partners on a significant data initiative, and are searching for a seasoned and experienced Tableau consultant who will be the Tableau subject matter expert on a smart and motivated team, on a fast moving project. We’re looking for someone who really knows the ins and outs of Tableau, from building templates for dashboards to configuring and managing the API, setting up Tableau processes, combined with BI experience such as data ingestion and warehousing etc.  You’ll be closely integrating with our client and helping to launch their Tableau efforts.  What you’ll be doing:  Define Tableau best practices and supervise Tableau implementation Tableau API configuration and management Author Tableau templates and deliver exceptional and accurate data visualizations and dashboards Collaborate with small team and data scientists to create accurate reporting Work with product teams and analysts to gather and understand data requirements  What you bring to the table:  Deep experience within the entire Tableau ecosystem (API, Templating etc.), beyond creating dashboards 6+ years total BI reporting experience SQL experience + experience with a range of data warehouses such as Apache Spark (Databricks) etc. Strong ability to convert business requirements to wireframes/dashboards Excellent communication & interpersonal skills, cross functional experience Report/dashboard design experience Passion for effective data visualization and BI    This is a remote consulting opportunity, based in the Puget Sound. Unfortunately at this time we are not able to provide sponsorship for employment and request no agency submissions. Thank you!

Title: Entry Level - Software Developer
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area.  We are looking for developers who want to engage in challenging projects in futuristic technology, software development, and much more within a variety of sectors such as financial, health care, energy and federal.  Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C.  We will provide on the job training after you are hired.  **We have a continued investment in motivated, passionate individuals like you who strive to move forward in their careers through apprenticeship programs like Smoothstack. Please be aware we have modified our training so that we can continue to offer our apprenticeship program remotely until the CDC deems it appropriate to work in shared office spaces. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Web or Mobile (Remote)
Description: Email and personal productivity software are a never ending stream of exciting, customer-life-changing challenges. We’re looking for veteran engineers who want to use knowledge gleaned from years of working in software development teams to help us overcome them!  We have apps that millions of customers use every day (and pay for), and the infrastructure to support them efficiently and reliably at a reasonable cost. Our technology choices prioritize solving real user problems - when possible, we try to minimize complicated architecture and dependencies, but when it was necessary we built a proprietary hybrid machine learning architecture.  We need your judgment and experience to help us shave months of development time off critical projects, help us keep the servers alive a few extra nights a year, and share that judgment and experience across our engineering team.  The right candidate is already able to work at an expert level in one of the languages or frameworks we use at Boomerang (JavaScript, Python+Django, Swift, or the Android dialect of Java). You’ll be able to share stories of mistakes you’ve made and learned from in past work, and you’ll be able to identify the same mistakes as they are being made here. You already know how to interface with a product team, support team, marketing team, and leadership team to make everything run more smoothly.  You can differentiate between when new platforms, frameworks, and design patterns solve real problems and when they’re just shiny objects, and even more importantly, know how to communicate that knowledge to everyone who needs to know it. You’re comfortable expressing your thoughts clearly in writing. You’re collaborative and enjoy teaching people what you know, but also are receptive and open when someone else is in a position to teach you.  In return, you’ll work in an environment that welcomes responsibility, where your work will help millions of people focus on the most rewarding parts of their jobs, and as part of a friendly, fun, elite team.  Requirements: * 5+ years of full-time experience professionally developing software as part of an engineering team, with a computer science or engineering degree from an accredited university * OR 7+ years of full-time experience professionally developing software as part of an engineering team. * Deep knowledge of one of the technologies we use at Boomerang (see above) * An interest in productivity software  To apply, please send the following to i.want.to.work@baydin.com: * Your resume * A link to your Github (if available) * A cover letter that includes a paragraph about why you’re excited about what we do

Title: Senior Level Engineer - Gaming
Description: Our client is currently looking for a talented Senior Level Designer to join a growing team and help us create exciting new gameplay experiences. Exciting triple AAA opportunity!  Requirements: • 6+ years professional level design experience • Extensive experience designing and building levels (multiple genres a plus). • Experience with at least one full, cradle-to-grave AAA product cycle • Ability to conceptualize and communicate engaging gameplay experiences and the technical muscles to carry out your vision • Experience in 3d game spaces • Experience working with Unreal or Unity • Game scripting experience with Lua or Python • Familiarity with Maya / Max or equivalent. • Console development experience • Work onsite in Seattle or remote from anywhere in Washington state • FTE or contract position available • Client will not sponsor work visas

Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Description: Pure Watercraft Embedded Software Engineer Job Label: Embedded Software Engineer 04-2021 Pure Watercraft is creating revolutionary electric marine propulsion to ensure a future where boating will be clean, quiet, and powerful.  With your expertise and help we will provide the highest performance and reliability outboard motor system available on the market. Our ground-up proprietary electric propulsion system can replace millions of unreliable, expensive, and dirty gas marine motors worldwide. Our platform will also unlock totally new opportunities for users to interact with their boats and enhance performance, navigation, efficiency, safety, charging, maintenance, and security. We are looking for an Embedded Software Engineer who is able to add value at all levels of the development process, including requirements definition, OS and architecture selection, development, testing, manufacturing automation, and support.  Your responsibilities will span development efforts on multiple projects including proprietary Pure Watercraft hardware such as a throttle and user interface, battery management systems, electric outboard motor, high voltage charging, telemetry, over-the-air (OTA) updates, and manufacturing, field service, and data analysis tools. Our engineering prototypes have already delivered more than 1,000 hours of high performance boating and we are gearing up for commercial launch. Check out this video to learn more about our revolutionary company:  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. What You’ll ‘Mostly’ Do:  Develop, test, deploy, and support Pure Watercraft’s embedded firmware used by customers, including safety critical components. Specify, design, test, deploy and maintain embedded software/firmware to securely connect PWC systems to cloud based servers allowing for wireless updates and system level diagnostics and telemetry.   Work with electrical and manufacturing engineers to define and build test fixtures for automating manufacturing tests. Define and implement a framework for regression testing Be a leader Grow as a skilled person  What We Look For First:    BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent 3+ years experience with embedded software design, development, and testing with real-time embedded systems Bare metal, embedded Linux, and RTOS projects C and C++ Ability to read schematics and debug hardware    Bonus Superpowers: Competencies and experience with:  Developing and debugging on ARM, Cortex-M, and STM32 microcontrollers Laboratory tools including oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and power supplies UART, I2C, SPI communication interfaces  CAN communication and SAE J1939 stack Custom bootloader development Embedded Security and Encryption Architectures BLE, BT, and WiFi stacks Fast-growing startup company experience Electric vehicle experience (e.g BMSs and Motor Controllers) Electric systems with voltages above 200V and currents above 50A Experience with safety critical systems in automotive, aerospace, medical fields Mobile Application development             To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.       Apply for this job https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/ce/487180156/Pure-Watercraft/Washington/Seattle/Embedded-Software-Engineer?sourceType=9          Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.       Related Keywords: BMS, battery management system, firmware, ARM, C++, rtos, mobile, telemetry, telematics, software, lead, architect, embedded, EV, aerospace, boats, boating, fishing, electric, motors, startup, watersports, environment, tesla, autonomous, vehicle, electronics, full stack, MEAN, mobile, UI/UX, database, security, automotive, CAN Communication, SAE J1939, Cortex-M, STM32, BMS

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=seattledata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Certified Encompass Developer/Programmer
Description: REMOTE POSITION Full time Ellie Mae Encompass API/SDK/HTML Programmer/Developer  $130,000+/year commensurate with experience and ability Includes paid healthcare plus dental, vision and 401K plan Eligible candidates MUST have Encompass 360 Mortgage Lending Software experience  Certified Ellie Mae Encompass Developer & Administrator - writing complex business rules, designing input forms, handling day to day administration of Encompass software. Proficient in C#/.NET development, building Plugins, codebase assemblies, stand alone console apps, WPF and Winform based apps to interface with Encompass. Javascript, HTML and CSS and experience working with APIs and Ellie Mae Developer Connect. Must be able to make Encompass talk to other systems, automate data entry and delivery. Experience with many similar front end applications, data warehousing concepts, and productivity/code tracking systems such as JIRA, TFS, and Github. Innovative and highly technical with a good working knowledge of WPF and Encompass Software - design, coding and working with a team to develop for Encompass. Looking for at least 2-3 years experience. Microsoft certifications are a plus.  Qualities we are looking for: Great communication skills, verbally and written Willingness to learn and expand upon existing skill sets Team player & able to work without supervision High level of attention to detail Ability to effectively communicate technical information in simple terms Friendly, patient and positive nature  MortgageTech is one of the oldest Ellie Mae Consulting and Technical Partners. We provide support and technical services to a variety of companies who use the Encompass Mortgage Banking software. While we all work remotely, we are as much a family as we are a team. Being a remote company, making sure you have a dedicated workspace is essential. We meet virtually, so no travel is required. Honesty, transparency and timely communication are critical. Avoiding unnecessary calls and meetings is part of our culture, but we are efficient and punctual when we meet over MS Teams. We are a company that empowers our team to be independent decision-makers, always striving for high standards for contribution to the team. Although remote, our team is a tightknit and supportive group of individuals. Having excellent communication and interpersonal skills is something we highly value. We only employ the top front-end thinkers and software administrators in the industry, so you'll be working with some of the best and brightest. You will work on a variety of projects, so you must be able to switch gears easily. As you will work remotely, we are looking for a quick learner, someone who loves to work hard, delivers outsatnding work, is self-motivated, and loves programming.  Find out more about us at  https://mortgagetech.com

Title: Residential Proptech Product Leader
Compensation: No salary until we complete seed round but significant equity
Description: We are a company in stealth mode answering the question, "If I don't have to go back to my office and I can live anywhere in the world, where should I live?"  We are a team of technologists, data scientists, marketers, and operators who have a very big idea and are eager to share it with the world. You would be our first product team member and instrumental in helping us identify which features matter, testing them, and creating our PRD.   As we transition from our Proof of Concept to our MVP,  you will be owning core parts of the app experience, including browse, personalization, maps, search and filters, auto complete, updates and more. You’ll have a ton of visibility in the company, and you’ll be empowered to change our product trajectory.   We are currently bootstrapping. You wouldn't be expected to quit your day job (yet) but we would require 10+ hours per week. In return, you would get significant equity and then a market-rate salary when we do our raise. Experience working in either proptech, consumer-facing real estate apps, or geospatial companies is required.   We are an inclusionary company and encourage those with diverse and less-represented backgrounds to apply. But please no recruiters or agencies.

Title: Software Engineer - C#/.NET
Description: Want to work on a project that helps improve the quality of life around the world? How about a job where you can interact with hardware and see your impact in the physical world? Do you want to have a voice and help shape your product’s future?  WHAT'S THE JOB?  As a software engineer at Mitutoyo Research & Development America, Inc (MRDA), you’ll have the opportunity to create advanced software used to control large measurement machines. You'll be working in an agile environment as part of one of our scrum teams. Our project touches many challenging subjects such as 3D rendering, collision detection, collision avoidance, kinematics, undo/redo, geometry, etc. We utilize C#/.NET Core, WPF/XAML, Telerik, Unity IoC, NuGet, NUnit, Moq, Azure DevOps, Git, and other technologies. You’ll have exposure to the business, and be an important participant in product, design, and technology decisions.  We are currently looking for a talented full-stack software engineer to contribute to our Windows desktop application at MRDA.  WHY WORK HERE?  Your work here will help make a positive impact on society, and you’ll enjoy working in our casual and friendly environment, using our state-of-the-art facilities and equipment. We’ll support your career development with training opportunities and our cultural focus on individual growth. You’ll love our excellent benefits package, including 100% premium-paid medical/dental/vision package and 401k with matching contributions.   For additional benefits information, see our website.   WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED  We're working to create new innovations in our industry. You'll need to have an engaged and collaborative mindset, paired with great C# skills and a drive to become a technical leader in the structure and implementation of our user interface. Your ability to quickly understand, break down, and communicate complex problems will allow you to excel on our team.  For a list of required and beneficial skills and experience, see the job description.   OUR COMPANY  Mitutoyo Research & Development America, Inc. (MRDA), a wholly owned subsidiary of Mitutoyo Corporation, develops state of the art technologies and software that enhance people’s lives through-world leading metrology solutions. Our products are used to ensure quality in the automotive, aerospace, electronics, semiconductor, medical equipment, and machine tool industries. We are located in the beautiful Northwest in a modern well-equipped facility, and offer a challenging, team-oriented & casual work environment. We provide great benefits. We work hard, play hard, enjoy life, and have fun.  For more information about life at MRDA, see our website.   Please apply for this position here.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Melissa Data is seeking a talented software developer for our Lynnwood, WA office to help expand our global address products.  This interesting and challenging position requires top flight coding skills, a solid understanding of software architecture principles, and well developed system thinking skills.  You will use these skills to expand the data processing capabilities for our core global address products. You will refine existing data processing infrastructure and expand capabilities by adding new features and functions. You will be part of the team that is developing of our global address products, including the ecosystem of utilities and processes that support their development. You will take on everything from performance tuning to feature expansion. You will work closely with group leads to refine the development/configuration/QA processes that enable ongoing expansion of the Melissa Data’s family of global address products.  In addition to the skills listed above, the requirements for this job include: • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, closely related field, or relevant job experience • 2+ years of experience in software development • 1+ years writing back end or server-side systems • 1+ years writing software in C++ or C • Proven ability to exercise technical judgment to set work priorities • Proven ability to make consistent progress on problems with moderate levels of ambiguity • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team • Top notch interpersonal skills  Additional experience in these areas will be helpful: • 1+ year experience doing data cleansing work • Experience developing software on both Windows and Linux platforms • Experience with both Visual Studio and Eclipse IDE • Ability to do basic data manipulation in a SQL database • Familiarity with various models of software development (waterfall, agile, etc.) • Familiarity with writing functional and unit tests for your own code • Completion of 1+ years of a world language in college  Benefits: • Competitive salary • 401(k) • Medical, dental and vision insurance • Paid holidays and personal time off • Easy access to I-5 in the Lynnwood area To Apply: • E-mail your resume in PDF or Microsoft Word format; must include location/address to be considered • No phone calls or recruiters please, No remote workers • https://www.melissa.com/jobs/jobapply.aspx  • No phone calls or recruiters please.  poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf (eeoc.gov)  Melissa is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. • Melissa is a Government contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974 (VEVRAA), which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment four categories of “protected veterans.” These four categories are defined as follows: •         A “disabled veteran” is one of the following: o  a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or •    a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. •       A “recently separated veteran” means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. •         An “active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran” means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. •         An “Armed forces service medal veteran” means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

Title: Software Configuration Engineer
Description: Are you good at solving puzzles?    Could you write a regular expression to capture the house number in any US street address?   Could you write a program to compare two lists of city names and find the unique values from each list?   You may be the engineer we are looking for!  Melissa Data, a leader in providing solutions for data validation, is seeking a talented engineer for our Seattle-area Global Products Unit. In this position, you will become familiar with our Global Address software package and be part of a team that is configuring it to efficiently parse, match, correct, and format addresses for countries all around the world.  As an ideal candidate for this position you may have a background in quality assurance, programming, or sales engineering.  You will definitely have a good technical mind, be fun to work with, and enjoy solving technical puzzles.    The required skill set for this job includes: - 1+ years writing code as a Developer or SDET - Ability to identify the root cause of software/configuration failures - Excellent attention to detail and great follow through - Ability to learn and master complex technical systems - Ability to work both independently and as part of a team - Top notch interpersonal skills  Additional experience in any of these areas will be helpful, but is not absolutely necessary:  - 1+ year of experience doing initial triage on software test failures - Proficiency with regular expressions - Experience writing or modifying software applications in Java, C++ or C# - Basic reading/writing skills for any non-English language.  Melissa Data is an equal opportunity employer offering a compensation package that includes a competitive salary, full benefits and a 401k. Benefits: • 401(k) with company match • Medical, dental, and vision insurance • Paid holidays and personal time off  To apply for this position, email your resume to  https://www.melissa.com/jobs/jobapply.aspx • No phone calls or recruiters please.  poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf (eeoc.gov) Melissa is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Title: .NET Core 3.x.   VB6 Windows Forms (WinForms) C#
Compensation: 50-90 per hour as a contractor C2C/1099, with conversion to  100,000-140,000 w2 with benefits.
Description: Requisition Type: Full Time Contractor (or Employee) with conversion to regular employee after 90-365 days. Basically, we would discuss your being a regular employee verse contractor and your needs.  TSRI has an opportunity for an Intermediate or Senior Software Developer to join our team supporting a major software modernization project.    Key Qualifications   -- C# development experience building Windows Forms (WinForms) applications including successful implementation thereof in .NET Core 3.x.  A working knowledge of VB6.    -- .Net Core is as important as working knowledge (presumable means they can work in) VB6.  Location: Seattle Metro Area.  Due to COVID the position requires work from home with high bandwidth Internet access and experience in remote development.   Post COVID development work will require physical presence during normal business work hours in Kirkland, WA, TSRI’s headquarters and office.  See www.tsri.com for what we do or simply note we do Rule Engines that automatically convert languages with minimal human involvement.  Travel Required: None Please no students, unless you have six years of work experience at the minimum.   Also this is not a position opening in JUNE, it is NOW this week or next week, or a short window to start.  This is currently remote, but after COVID you would be wanted on site.    I am guessing August - can't be sure.   If you are a H1B and have an employer and have 7 years of work experience, then we will if you prove you understand the technology needs consider your.   Our historical preference is for US Citizens, and the average age at TSRI is near 50, significantly OLDER then other firms in the region.    In order of preference, it is all about the VB and C# skill sets, then location, and citizenship vs contract.   Recruiters may contact me if they have a valid candidate if contractor.  Background   Work with both senior and intermediate developers in an agile Kanban software development team in support of both internal projects and large customer contracts.  Initial project is the modernization of legacy VB6 migrating to C# .NET Core hosted in the MS Azure environment.  The effort will require understanding of VB6 and modern C# implementations, research into target mappings and application developed and deployed in a modern Azure .NET Core environment.      Key Qualifications  -- C# development experience building Windows Forms -- (WinForms) applications including successful implementation thereof in .NET Core 3.x.   -- A working knowledge of VB6.  -- “WinForms” and .Net are critical requirements, which should be included in the resume – TSRI won’t be able to prioritize folks who don’t have these.  Required Qualifications  -- Bachelor's degree computer science, software engineering, or related discipline.  -- 3-7 years of equivalent experience  -- Further understanding of Python, Web application server concepts and frameworks and Web programming- (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SQL and relational databases is a positive.   -- Experience in usage of Linux is a positive.  -- GNU C++ development experience is a positive.   Responsibilities  -- Requirements gathering and refinement, review and research of VB6 project external dependencies and resolving them in C# Azure environment.   -- Software design, utilizing object-oriented principles, implement solutions in C# operating on .NET Core in the Azure environment.   -- Develop Software Unit tests for target mappings.  -- Execute software quality packages (i.e. SonarQube) and refactoring.  -- Profile implementation, identification of bottlenecks and refactoring.  -- Translate application story’s, tasks and use cases into functional implementations in application  -- Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C# code  -- Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications  -- Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems  -- Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization  -- Strong written and verbal communications and good scrum team contributor.   Skills  -- Proficient in C#, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems.    -- Past working experience or strong familiarity with VB6 projects.  -- Familiarity with the .NET Core framework.   -- Skilled in writing reusable C# libraries.  -- Familiarity with Containers, REST API and orchestration.   -- Familiar with various design and architectural patterns and object-oriented design principles.  -- Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server.  -- Experience with RDP protocol and gateways.  -- Familiarity with Windows Presentation Framework and popular web application frameworks.  -- Understand fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.  -- Experience implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests.  -- Proficient understanding of code versioning tools Git and Mercurial, and GitFlow best practices.  -- Familiarity with Continuous Integration, DevSecOps and Azure software pipelines.  -- Familiarity with Azure services, software profilers and APM packages in the MS Azure environment.  -- Experienced in Agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).  -- Understanding of Model View Controller (MVC) design pattern  -- Understanding frameworks such as Spring Boot, AngularJS, and React is a plus.   What you will be asked:   -- What  is your 'need', 'want', 'desire' for your hourly rate C2C or W2 while contracting. -- ARE YOU LOCAL to the SEATTLE/KIRKLAND REGION -- Are you a US Citizen, Green Card, EAD-GC, and if Stem or H1B, when can you start working. -- Your Salary NEED, WANTLOW, WANTHIGH, DESIRE so I get a range on your salary.  Note:  During Covid until Dr. Fauci says it safe, probably we will not be physically meeting given many of our staff are more than 40 y/o.   So this is definitely remote until the pandemic is more controlled.     Our Medical/Stock  Plan:  Extensive once an employee.  We do NOT age discriminate and respect and value veterans who apply (and are qualified).

Title: Data Analyst Assistant sought for Financial Investment Modeling
Description: A personal assistant with demonstrable PowerBI and Data Analytic skills is being sought for 1-2 hours/week. Initial projects will focus on developing and refining financial investment models. No weekend work ... must be available during normal weekday hours. $40/hr. Perfect for knowledgeable  Professional with extra time, Post Grad or upper-level university student or retired  . Good for one’s CV  Candidate will need to:  1) adapt an Excel program that evaluates stock performance to PowerBI that provides trend performance with If/Then functions; 2) integrate other data sources; 3) generate report templates;  4) maintain the data...which can probably be done remotely; 7) reside on the Eastside; 8) have reliable transportation; and 9) have knowledge of bookkeeping principles (helpful.). My current activities focus on Crypto products, Stocks via active long volatility options. Please do not apply unless you have a WORKING KNOWLEDGE and preferably experience in these areas.   We anticipate this being long term relationship with more hours and a broader scope.  The offices are located near Bridle Trails/ Kirkland. My office is up 1 flight of stairs. The position initially requires meeting 1-2 hours/week in person. Mask not needed. Employer has received both Covid immunizations.  Please reply with qualifications, your location, and an email/phone number at which to reach you

Title: From INTERN to ENGINEER – Become an IT EXPERT in 5 Months
Compensation: The internship experience is for the benefit of the intern and is unpaid; participants have historically transitioned into positions starting at $60,000 to $120,000/year.
Description: We create Information Technology (IT) experts quickly through a specialized internship program that is a combination of intense learning and challenging experience. Internship participants start with little-to-no experience and exit five months later joining the best in the IT field.  This five-month, high intensity program is the result of a fifteen-year joint effort between Stanford University faculty, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, US Navy, DARPA, Department of Veterans Affairs, and our company – Acuitus. Out of our 900+ participants, over 98% have completed our program to exceptional standards. The graduates of our internship program have transitioned into hundreds of companies including Cisco, PayPal, Amazon, EMC, Palo Alto Networks, Brocade, eBay, Microsoft and Akamai. Many are now in senior-level positions, running teams and responsible for hiring – asking for hundreds more of our experts per year.  Our internships are: • Full-time, Monday - Friday, 8am-5pm, working remotely, from home • Five-month program, starting June 2021 to November 2021  Internship develops experts in: • Problem Solving, Troubleshooting, tactical and strategic Problem Analysis • System Administration • Operating Systems, such as Windows and Linux • Networks • Wireless • Security: Data Encryption, Hashing, PKI, Firewalls, VPNs • Virtualization / Cloud Computing • Email Systems • File Servers, Web Servers and much more.  Cost: Our internships are offered at no cost until you acquire a high-paying job in the field. We only succeed when you succeed.  --  If you want to do something very different, if you want to start a career and not just get an entry-level job, if you want to learn to see the world the way other experts see the world, reach out to us!  Note: VETERANS will find this program of particular interest because it presents a way to combine the leadership and management experience acquired during your service with technical expertise, which is a particularly valuable combination in high-tech careers.  Applications being accepted now for Tuesday, June 1, 2021 start date. Learn more https://www.acuitus.com/IT

Title: Software Engineer - Full Stack (JS, Typescript, React, Node, etc.)
Description: Software Engineer – Full Stack (FTE) Seattle, WA  Downtown client is looking for a solid all around engineer who is passionate about creating great user experiences, creating rock solid code and is interested in developing cutting edge mobile and IoT services.  We are looking for a senior level engineer who thrives in a fast-paced environment, someone that can create intuitive interfaces, loves to code and has great attention to detail.     Some of the areas we are looking for: • 5+ years’ experience writing code, ideally consumer-facing production code • Demonstrated track record of building sophisticated, highly interactive mobile applications or front end web applications in modern frameworks • Experience building production applications with JavaScript or Typescript as well as with modern frameworks such as React, React Native, Angular, and Vue.js.   • Experience with Node.js preferred (but not required) • Ability to work and thrive in a fast paced environment • You have the interest and desire to learn new technologies as needed  This is a full time/salaried position for a financially stable company that’s creating exciting new products all the time.
