Jeff Roodhouse jeffr@triadgroup.com TRIAD Group

Title: Senior Rails Developer
Description: Want to make an outsized difference on a product with millions of monthly pageviews and growing? Our Senior Full Stack Rails Developer contributes across the stack from understanding database operations at scale, writing clean, team-oriented Ruby, and building compliant UX (via HAML & SASS) that brings our intuitive designs to life for our 40k active sellers. This role touches all realms of Bonanza functionality, though if you find one area you're especially good at, we'd love for you to make it your specialty.  Job Description We're looking for a full-time, full-stack developer with a minimum of 3 years Ruby on Rails experience to help us tackle the many challenges of running a marketplace that scales.  Your projects will vary from sprint to sprint and you will play a critical role through every project’s lifecycle from design to development to maintenance. Some of the stuff we're working on includes:  API: enable sellers and third parties to sell on Bonanza Importers: allow sellers to effortlessly bring inventory from platforms including eBay, Shopify, and CSV Broadcaster: an advertising platform that takes Google Adwords and makes it comprehensible Fraud and compliance: keeping disallowed items and bad actors off the platform Mobile-first UX Third party integrations (checkout, dispute management, OAuth signup and login) Obviously these bullets only scratch the surface of the tasks we'll be working on at a given time. You will also have opportunities to research and integrate new technologies.  Job Requirements A minimum of 3 years of Ruby on Rails experience in a production environment. You'll be working in the full stack, from the database (MySQL) up to jQuery and HTML/CSS. You should have the doggedness to solve problems through documentation, research, and reviewing logs and past commits. You should have the empathy to see problems from our customers’ shoes and keep their needs in mind while building solutions.  We are a data driven company from the business level down to individual contributors, so we experiment with different methods to evaluate success. We are looking for developers who can come up to speed on new skills and technologies, turn that into a regular cadence of completed work, and who have time management skills to get through all their tasks coding or otherwise.  Job Benefits Bonanza is a product-first company run by a CEO who has spent most of his adult life as a Programmer. The implications of this are that we've obsessed for literally years about how to foster an environment optimized for Developer happiness and throughput. It starts with our salaries, which, at the high end, range to levels beyond those offered by the tech titans. More importantly, we provide a working environment where you will virtually never be interrupted by meetings, and where you will be given access to the best hardware available. Because your productivity should never constrained for lack of resources. We also offer a thoughtfully constructed collection of perks that stands apart from our competitors:  Profitable company that recently celebrated its 13 year anniversary. Work from home flexibility - work from home, a coffee shop, or even the office, if that's your bag. "Freedom February" - every February we retreat from Seattle and spend a month annoying our friends with selfies taken in Mexico, Belize, Europe, etc. Five bonus (not counted as vacation) days off in February to enjoy your vacation or staycation. Twice-weekly catered lunches. Professional development opportunities. Work from a waterfront office in downtown Seattle (food trucks aplenty!) convenient to many bus lines. Break room with ping pong, MAME cabinet, and coworker led office yoga. The boring stuff: fully paid health insurance coverage, holidays, stock options, and more.

Title: Senior Implementer - SaaS (remote)
Compensation: Depends on experience; health and dental benefits, 401k matching, PTO
Description: Thrive with Agiloft  Are you an experienced Senior Implementer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?  Agiloft is looking for Implementers that thrive working in a fast-paced organization with interesting business challenges requiring smart solutions.  Why Join Agiloft?   Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant. Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years. The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row. Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization. Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies. Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.   As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards over achievement.  Position Overview  This individual has developed a level of understanding of the system’s capabilities that allows him or her to lead large-scale implementation projects. This role plays a leadership function within the project, serving as the leader of project design and assisting with project management duties where required.  A Senior Implementer has honed the necessary speed, accuracy, and design skills to independently design highly complex Agiloft systems. This is a challenging position, requiring the individual to have a strong analytical and logical mind, proven ability to communicate with customers and a team, and excellent attention to detail.  Job Responsibilities   Independently design highly complex Agiloft systems for customers Lead large scale, highly complex projects both in implementation and in customer communication Oversee and provide constructive feedback for junior implementers assisting with projects Participate as a lead or co-lead of Enterprise projects, in partnership with Architects Skillfully handle difficult customers with complex business requirements by: Anticipating and resolving complex escalations Holding complex discussions with clients Negotiating change orders and change requests of a medium size Handle initial escalation calls Provide quality control for senior implementer-led projects Write detailed specifications and test plans that can be built and performed by more junior implementers or partners Contribute to internal projects as needed   Required Qualifications   Technical background (with a preference for a 4-year college degree) 4-8 years working as an implementer or demonstrated experience equivalent Strong analytical skills, creativity, familiarity with web-based technologies, and the ability to continuously improve an individual’s implementation skills Ability to manage projects of high complexity, complex business requirements, and/or difficult customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Mentorship skills to provide guidance and feedback for junior implementers Ability to lead business calls to discuss project progress, handle escalation calls, and negotiate change orders Initiative in seeking ways to contribute to the success of the company that goes beyond a narrow definition of job responsibilities Experience with database concepts and web-based technologies is a plus Prior experience with LegalTech in general and with Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) specifically a significant plus   Company Benefits and Perks  Competitive salary Health, dental, and vision insurance Voluntary Life-AD&D, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability 401k plan with company match Paid Parental Leave policy Referral bonuses Generous vacation and flexible work schedules Professional development and career growth opportunities Awesome team members  Interested? Apply now!  For a full list of open positions and to submit your application, go to our website: http://www.agiloft.com/jobs.htm  Applicants from underrepresented groups such as minorities, veterans, or individuals with disabilities encouraged to apply   Agiloft is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination of any kind. All employment decisions at Agiloft are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or social ethnic origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, parental status, marital status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Report Writer/Help Desk Technician
Compensation: Salary for this position is $19.94- $22.43 per hour DOE  Benefits include medical, dental, life, LTD, and 403(b)
Description: SNAP is seeking a qualified individual for a Report Writer/Help Desk Technician. This position is a full-time project position expected to last approximately six months.  It is open to all qualified individuals.   Position Summary: SNAP is looking for a report writer who has an ability to develop customized reports from the Salesforce database platform as well as other sources to extract and collect data according to program needs. The ability to analyze statistics and other metrics in addition to providing end-user assistance on report writing software is a must.   The capacity to assist in editing and revising of training manuals with structured, succinct, clear, accurate instructions and other supporting documents to communicate multifaceted and technical information. This would include paper-based and digital operating instructions, how-to manuals, knowledge-based articles, videos, as well as “frequently asked questions” pages to help staff and other users within the agency.  The ideal candidate will possess good customer service, strong writing skills, be comfortable with interacting with people, be highly organized, and be able to deliver quality deliverables on time. Attention to detail comes naturally to this person who will ensure all content provides clarity and accuracy, conveys the proper voice, and aligns with our internal guide.   Interested applicants must submit a completed SNAP application, cover letter and resume to the SNAP Human Resources Department 3102 W. Whistalks Way. Spokane, WA 99224. You may apply online at www.snapwa.org.  OPEN UNTIL FILLED

Title: Database Administrator
Description: Database Administrator  WSIPC – Reference # 210401 Salary Range: $81,417 -$88,995  Why WSIPC?  At WSIPC We Take Pride in Nurturing a Culture Where… We are a team – We care about the growth and development of our people and the Cooperative. We pursue excellence – We are continuously learning and striving to improve our skills, services and culture. We are passionate and creative – We are inspired by our Cooperative members to innovate and develop solutions that best fit their needs. We are accountable and supportive – We take responsibility for our decisions and collaborate to ensure the best outcomes. We communicate honestly – We work in a transparent, open, and trust-based environment. We have serious fun – We take the time to enjoy ourselves, because hard work and innovation are fueled by a good work-life balance and a lot of personality. We serve our community and we are our community – We are part of the community we serve and we are invested in its success.  About the Position WSIPC is seeking a database administrator to support enterprise database systems. The position will design, install, monitor, and tune databases to ensure high levels of data availability. Applicants must have strong analytic focus, and can work effectively in a high-paced environment, both independently or as a team. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated with attention to detail, and meets or exceeds the qualifications listed below.  Ideal Candidate Qualifications • College diploma or university degree in computer science and/or equivalent work experience. • Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices. • Experience with designing, building, documenting, configuring, tuning and supporting enterprise class database servers such as Progress and Microsoft SQL Server. • Ability to articulate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences. • Project management experience. • Exceptional customer service orientation. • Must be professional, ethical and have the ability to maintain confidentiality. • Ability to work additional hours to meet deadlines. • Ability to travel occasionally in or out-of-state, some overnight travel  Employment Benefits This is a full-time position. WSIPC provides a comprehensive benefits package including but not limited to twelve holidays, medical, dental, vision, and paid sick leave. Visit www.wsipc.org for a full list of benefit offerings.    Apply Now! What a great place to work! Apply now by emailing your resume to employment@wsipc.org   WSIPC is an EOE.

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=seattledata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Senior Backend Engineer (Node)
Description: Senior Backend Node.js Engineer Location: Remote Duration: FTE Compensation: Lucrative compensation package Start: ASAP   Our Seattle client is a well-funded, early-stage startup, looking to disrupt an $800 billion dollar industry on a global scale. This is a unique opportunity to leverage your experience and join an ambitious, fast-growing team, as a foundational member.   As a Senior Backend NodeJS Engineer, you will work closely with Product, Design, and Engineering teams to deliver new features and enhancements for our client's game-changing platform. An ideal candidate will have experience working as a strong, hands-on, technologist. Demonstrated experience managing concurrent initiatives in a fast-paced environment. Strong communication skills, self-direction, flexibility and the ability to navigate ambiguity are also key.   Responsibilities:  Design and implement high performance scalable data-centric serverless microservices Estimate engineering effort, plan implementation, and roll out applications with cross-functional impact Own continuous improvement and fine tuning of API performance, scalability and security Independently design, code, and test major features, as well as work jointly with other team members. Flexible approach to analyzing technical issues and clearly communicating recommendations/solutions Proficient in agile development methodologies  Requirements:  5+  years of professional Software Development experience Strong application development background and understanding of Web Application technologies and techniques  Back-end: JavaScript, Node, JSON, REST, Micro services, MongoDB, NoSQL Preferred - AWS Lambda or any cloud functions technology Knowledge of AWS and other cloud platforms Proven ability to define and implement effective software development methodologies Large-scale, high-throughput, low-latency, consumer-facing micro-services development Serverless solution development experience is desired Exceptional communication skills    Interested candidates are encouraged to forward your resume for consideration. We are seeking engineers at all levels, so we'd be happy to review your profile even if this particular role is not a perfect match.     Keywords:  JavaScript, Node, Java, Next.js, JSON, HTML5, Serverless, Microservice, AWS, Lambda, MongoDB, NoSQL, REST

Title: Unity Prototyper | $50 - $60 per hour
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/24d2ee64/apply   HireArt is helping the world’s largest social network find a Unity Prototyper to create Unity prototypes and build and enhance prototyping platforms. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years’ experience prototyping experience, with strong Unity and C# experience. As Unity Prototyper, you will: Create Unity prototypes showcasing applications, working closely together with product designers.Collaborate with other technical teams to build and enhance prototyping platforms.Set up and maintain prototypes and present to various audiences.Give and solicit real-time feedback from others in order to approve the quality of the product.Partner effectively with product managers, engineers, user researchers, content strategists, and quality assurance teams to oversee the implementation of the user experience from product conception to launch as well as post-launch design support.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/24d2ee64/apply   Requirements 3+ years’ prototyping experienceStrong Unity and C# prototyping skillsExperience with 3D and design softwareExperience using various headsets and other hardwareGood written and oral communication skills as well as experience and comfort presenting to team members and stakeholdersCommitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 3-month contract position through HireArt and based in Seattle, WA. This role will be performed remotely until offices reopen. Candidates should be able and willing to work on PST. HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/24d2ee64/apply

Title: Senior Software Engineer / Consultant (React + Node.js) (US-based Remo
Description: We’re working with one of our favorite long-term clients in the renewable energy space, offering exciting technical challenges at scale in a well run and positive engineering environment.  You'll bring strong full stack software development in the JavaScript ecosystem, a passion for building intuitive and complex full stack web applications, creative problem solving abilities and a great, positive attitude.  What you’ll be doing: Building consumer facing software at scale and solving interesting, real world business problems in a modern technical environment Writing high-quality, clean and maintainable code for new features across the stack, while providing consulting expertise and collaborating with engineering and product stakeholders Communicating clearly, professionally, and consistently with your team and your client Be a good person; we’re proud to work with every single Rooster Park engineer and you will be too!  What you bring to the table: 7+ years of professional software development experience 2+ years in the JavaScript ecosystem, ideally some combination of React & Node.js; bonus if you have experience with Cloud platforms Real-world experience building software in a complex and fast moving environment; a mix of enterprise and startup experience is ideal Strong collaboration and communication skills; you function well autonomously with drive and self-direction, but you’re also comfortable being part of a team and working in partnership with your engineering colleagues You are reliable, responsible, consistent, nice, and passionate about what you do   We pay competitively and have excellent healthcare and other benefits. This is a long term remote consulting opportunity, USA based. Unfortunately at this time we are not able to provide sponsorship for employment and request no agency submissions. Thank you!   We're Rooster Park, and we're a boutique consulting and recruiting agency obsessed with finding the right fits for a small set of partners. You can learn more at http://www.roosterpark.com/. Hope to hear from you!

Title: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (Javascript/Node.js)
Description: We are looking for a senior software engineer to join our team here in Portland. Initially, this will be a contract position for 6-8 months. We're open to having that transition into a full-time position with benefits after that period for the right candidate.  About Us We're a small, collaborative, laid-back group of people — 13 total, 5 in product development (3 engineers, 1 product manager, 1 QA). Our company is 9 years old and we are profitable. So this is a rare opportunity to work for a stable, well-run startup, but without all the bureaucratic/corporate bullshit that typically comes along with that.  Technology Stack Our web app is full-stack Javascript (Ember/Node.js) running on AWS. We are also about to deploy our first mobile app built on Flutter. We have a fully automated CI pipeline built on github, CircleCI, and AWS CodeDeploy, and CodeMagic. We have a coding style guide, and we do code reviews and write automated tests and all that good stuff, but we're not obsessive about it and we hope you aren't either.   We're located in a beautiful office in downtown Portland. We're open to you working remotely, but we are only considering local Portland candidates at this time.   About You  You have 5 or more years of professional (i.e. school does not count) experience developing web applications You have 2 or more years of professional experience with one or more modern client-side Javascript frameworks (Ember, React, Angular, Vue) People who have worked with you like you and would jump at the chance to work with you again You are not a recruiting agency, staffing company, or 3rd party dev shop. (If you are a staffing agency and you respond to this ad you will receive nothing more than a rude and profanity-laced reply.)

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Electronic Health Record Support Specialist
Description: http://www.mccfl.org/home/careers/ MID-COLUMBIA CENTER FOR LIVING - Loan Repayment Location - HRSA  Philosophy: Mid-Columbia Center for Living (MCCFL) is a Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinic (CCBHC) that specializes in providing services that are both trauma-informed and recovery-oriented to persons / consumers with mental illness and addictions. Trauma-informed care includes safety, choice, collaboration, trustworthiness and empowerment for both clients and staff. MCCFL serves Hood River, Wasco and Sherman Counties and utilizes a consumer-involved, consumer-engaged and consumer-driven model. MCCFL provides a whole-person care approach to adults and children to address both physical and mental health needs. MCCFL offers a variety of programs including a mobile crisis unit, intensive case management, ongoing counseling, community support, supported employment, jail diversion, hospital discharges, hearings and more.  Benefits (Note: subject to change annually) High deductible medical (Individual $1700 / Family $3400) Company contributes $1500 into employees HSA if primary insurance. Dental (Employer pays 70% of covered expenses year one; increases 10% annually) Vision Life and AD&D ($5,000 company paid life; additional voluntary insurance available for purchase) Flexible Spending Account Employee Assistance Program Retirement: Oregon Public Employees Retirement System (PERS), and Employees contribute to Social Security. 11 Paid holidays a year (including one floating holiday) 7.5 hours of sick leave accrued each month with a cap Generous vacation accruals (15 days each year)  Position Summary: This position is responsible for supporting the Electronic Health Record (EHR) Administrator and staff in using MCCFL’s EHR. The EHR Support Specialist will be responsible for desktop support as well as training staff on the use of e-mail, EHR functionalities for clinical documentation, managing the intranet and other web-based or data related duties. Is responsible for extracting data and submitting various reports to Leadership Team. A high degree of accuracy, efficiency in a diverse environment. Must be able to meet deadlines.  Minimum Qualifications:Any combination of education and experience that demonstrates the ability to perform the position’s essential responsibilities is qualifying. This might typically include:  High school diploma or equivalent AND advanced training in a computer related field and at least three (3) years of relevant experience, OR Associates or Bachelor’s degree with the completion of computer and network coursework, AND at least two (2) years of relevant experience in PC operation, PC maintenance, troubleshooting, and network administration and maintenance; Experience working with electronic health records is preferred (but not required) Must pass all criminal history check requirements as required by ORS 181.536-181.537 and in accordance with OAR 407-007-0200 to 407-007-0370.  Essential Duties: Provide desktop support and training for staff; troubleshoot user problems and provide general support to users.  Maintain desktop equipment, laptops, and software, including EHR system issues relating to functionality. Troubleshoot, diagnose and remedy system software problems and failures.  Interface with internal/external MIS/IT professionals & vendors to resolve problems.  Work to maintain integrity of agency computer systems, data input and report processes. Provide system-related program support; work with Billing Reimbursement Specialist to ensure that third party insurance and private pay data is accurate.  Implement confidentiality standards related to electronic client files information to ensure appropriate safeguards against unauthorized access. Oversight of Centralized database including productivity tools, standards and guidelines.  Collaborates with management to ensue EHR systems meet agency needs, reporting requirements, state and federal regulations; to include system modifications. Develop applications for prescribed specifications. Define, program, test, debug, install, evaluate and maintain EHR software.  Identify data sources; construct data flow diagrams; establish and document procedures for such.  Write code for database access, modification, and construction including stored procedures. Serve as contact for EHR system issues relating to software functionality. Troubleshoot, diagnose and remedy system software problems and failures.  Review and analyze software upgrades and enhancements, including testing and debugging.  Maintain database systems by performing routine maintenance, performance monitoring, and back-ups. Coordinate with EHR software vendor on program enhancements and modifications to programming system. Develop and maintain professional knowledge base regarding changes, trends and technologies related to data processing applications.  Evaluate and recommend new technology, systems integration and upgrades and website maintenance.  Other Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Knowledge:Knowledge of the basic principles of systems analysis and design; knowledge of hardware and software systems and components; knowledge of programming and computer hardware and software; knowledge of the techniques and procedures of software and network support; knowledge of PC word processing, database, spreadsheet, and PC based MIS, WANs, LANs including configuration and maintenance.  Skills:Skill in the use of electronic health records and reporting systems; skill in the use of other standard office software.  Abilities:Ability to detect, analyze, and resolve computer software and network problems; ability to provide clear and useful instruction and training; ability to identify and monitor potential operational malfunctions; ability to install and maintain computer software and hardware; ability to learn and utilize computerized data collection systems in use at the agency, including data entry and extraction; ability to prepare and maintain accurate reports; ability to maintain a strong service orientation and to work effectively on multiple projects; ability to use good professional judgment within the scope of the position; ability to maintain confidentiality; ability to organize and execute work effectively under the pressure of time-sensitive deadlines; ability to speak before groups of various sizes; ability to work with grace and good humor under pressure; ability to work cooperatively with other departments; ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; ability to establish and maintain harmonious work relationships with consultants, contractors, community partners, consumers, and with co-workers at all levels of the organization.  Visit our website at: http://www.mccfl.org/home/careers/  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: $46,793.00 - $56,886.00 per year

Title: Sr. C++ Embedded Engineer
Description: We are looking for a programmer with Expert level skills in C/C++.  Work requires conscientious and clean coding with the ability to worry details outside of your swimlane.    We get to do the fun stuff including: lasers, robotics, medical devices, nanotechnology, unmanned vehicles (drones and vehicles), and our claim to fame ... a device that creates Jello-shots.  We are an employee-based software consulting firm.   You would be a staff engineer with the full expectation for continued Full-Time employment.  We offer medical/dental and a 401K, and as much popcorn as you can eat and Diet Coke as you can drink.    We are a supportive organization, around since 1992, staffed with type-B personalities.   Humor is not a requirement but it sure does help.  We take pride in our work, the success of our teams and the ability to make a difference in the technical arena.    Candidate must have:  * Project Lead skills with ability to take part and/or lead * 4+ years embedded C++ * Excellent Documentation and communications skills * Skills around bringing up and integrating with hardware  C# and Java are a plus

Title: Marketing Automation Specialist
Description: Audigy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values a diverse and inclusive workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Women, minorities, veterans, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.   Everyone who works at Audigy has a direct impact on the company and the people we work with.  Our mission is to help our clients and their employees achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through their business.  Our passion is helping others realize their potential and our success is achieved by helping others achieve a higher level of success.  Audigy is a management company that provides business services for ENT and audiology practices across the nation. Whether our members are looking to create efficiencies within their four-walls, grow and expand, or exit out of their practice - we are here to help.  We are creative. We are driven. We are fun. And, we are looking for an innovative, experienced, lead-generating marketing automation enthusiast to join our team.  Position:  A Marketing Automation Specialist executes marketing automation programs for individual Audiology practice owners. The Marketing Automation Specialist is responsible for executing marketing campaigns designed to engage, educate, acquire, and nurture patients using a marketing automation platform.   This person will have a foundation in marketing automation and will be tasked with implementing and improving best practices ensuring continual enhancement of digital marketing efforts. The ideal candidate is technical, organized, results driven, has strong attention to detail and has a passion for digital applications. This position requires a candidate that has background/knowledge in executing marketing automation campaigns preferably with experience in Marketo. The right candidate must be enthusiastic, pro-active, detail-oriented, and a hardworking professional able to work well in a team-oriented, client-focused environment.  Performance Objectives: • Deploy, manage, track and report on automated trigger and nurture campaigns • Generate reporting and leverage data to draw insights and optimization of campaigns • Perform A/B testing to define and execute enhancements to productivity, conversion rates, programs/campaign ROI, and sales growth  • Responsible for the integrity and segmentation of databases • Marketo/SFDC sync related program/campaign management • Support growth and member utilization of the program  Capabilities/Key Competencies: • Timeline/deadline driven with extreme attention to detail • Proven commitment of exceptional and customer service delivery to both clients/customers and internal team members that allow effective working relationships with a diverse population • Superior interpersonal and communication skills; written, verbal and presentation • Exceptional time management skills • Adept at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment • Solution and problem-solving orientation • Passion for working in a high-growth, entrepreneurial environment, with the ability to demonstrate personal commitment and drive to set and exceed high standards  Education & Experience: • Bachelor's degree in marketing required or equivalent experience which provides the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities • 1-3+ years marketing automation experience in Marketo, preferably • Expert knowledge of database management concepts and best practices • Characteristics for Success include: Dedication, excellent work ethic, drive and ambition, ability to work seamlessly with a team and exemplary communication skills • Experience working in a CRM, OMS, or other related technology platform  • Strong understanding of the marketing funnel, multi-channel marketing, and lead generation best practices   Preferred Qualifications: • Marketo Certified Expert preferred, but not required • Experience in a medical field a plus  Our Benefits Include: 401k w/company match Parental/Family Leave w/transition back to work Medical/Dental/Vision Working from home (temporarily) Top technology platforms for easy remote access Day Care Flexible Spending Account PTO/Holidays And more…  Audigy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employees embody the values that Audigy has earned a reputation for and that is hard work, curiosity, dedication to our vision, passion for best in class deliverables and an atmosphere that encourages creativity and collaboration. Come join our team. Apply at: https://gn.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/AudigyCareers

Title: Customer Support Representative (Remote)
Description: Position Type: Non-exempt, Full-time, HourlyPositions Available: 2Hours: 8:00 am-5:00 pm PT (10:00 am- 7:00 pm CT, 11:00 am - 8:00 pm ET)  or 6:00 am-3:00 pm PT (8:00 am - 5:00 pm CT, 9:00 am- 6:00 pm ET) Monday through Friday, and occasional on-call weekend hours (on rotation with other team members) with the flexibility to work additional hours as needed or to accommodate fellow team members PTO/Sick Leave. We also offer a "flex Friday" schedule of M-TH 9 hour days with a 4-hour shift on Friday that can be discussed further in the offer process. Pay Rate: $18-20, Depending on experienceLocation: RemoteReports to: VP of Client Services and Success About HiringThingHiringThing is online software that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants and hire great employees. We were founded in 2012 with the mission to deliver intuitive, easy-to-use recruiting software across multiple sales channels and product types. HiringThing operates in a flexible startup environment where employees can be hands-on in helping build a new company. This is a remote position, so team members will thrive in a work-from-home environment. Our team stays connected through daily communication and regular video calls.SummaryHiringThing is seeking a full-time, remote Customer Support Representative with a technical background to provide support to our users and customers in accordance with our customer support philosophy and guidelines. Our support philosophy is encapsulated by our tagline Support Beyond Compare™. To expand on this, we aim to consistently deliver friendly, effective, knowledgeable, and timely support to our clients. We strive to provide a solution that results in Hiring Happiness™ the first time around. Technical skills required include a deep understanding of the operating systems and software, problem-solving skills, and a focus on quality. You will have internal and external resources at your fingertips to help you answer customer inquiries and solve issues knowledgeably. While our mascot is a robot, we are strongly opposed to the type of robo-support some companies employ that crafts an impersonal and suboptimal customer experience. So, what we won’t do is make you follow a script or dictate exactly how each customer inquiry is to be handled. Use our guidelines and your own discernment in answering customer inquiries, keeping our philosophy first and foremost in your actions. ResponsibilitiesBelow is a list of core, initial responsibilities associated with this position. This list is subject to expansion based on the Customer Support Representative's interest, aptitudes, and performance. We support each employee's growth in their individual role and help each person maximize their fulfillment in their role. Effectively manage and respond to high volumes of support phone calls, tickets, and/or chats submitted via email or through our support portal.Provide consistently friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and timely support to our clients, striving to provide the correct solution the first time around.Build relationships with clients through open and honest communication.Handle complaints effectively, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits and follow up to ensure resolution. Keep accurate records of customer support interactions using defined methods and tools.Communicate with clients and prospects using the correct branding (we offer our software under multiple brand names).Create and maintain existing support knowledge-based articles.Support new client implementations through virtual training. Review/verify new subscription accounts.Process manual paid job postings.Review job postings submitted for organic job board visibility.Participate in weekly team meetings.Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies.Actively use each customer interaction as an opportunity to deliver Hiring Happiness™.Actively add content and solutions to internal knowledge-base. Contribute articles to our client-facing support knowledge-base.RequirementsYou have excellent communication and active listening skills.You excel in your attention to detail.You quickly learn new software.Flexibility and adaptability are your middle name.You know how to prioritize, manage time effectively and follow through on tasks/responsibilities.Working independently and problem-solving fit in your back pocket. You have proven strong customer support experience.Familiarity with HTML and CSS stylesheets is a plus.You are familiar with both Windows and Mac OS-based operating systems.Your knowledge of all major web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, IE, Edge) is proficient.API integration knowledge is a plus.Who You AreYou are comfortable with technology.Self-motivation is your strength.You are Passionate about providing solution-focused support.Benefits$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursement401(k) Plan with Roth and Standard optionsAbility to work remotelyOpportunity to have an impact in a hands-on manner on the growth and direction of the CompanyPaid time off starting at 3 weeks per year8 paid holidays Participation in employee stock option planOpportunity for professional development Comprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesApplicants will be asked to complete a brief assessment as part of the application process. This will take approximately 20 minutes and cannot be re-entered once you exit the process. Please allow enough time to complete the assessment. Thank you.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/257403/customer-support-representative-remote?s=cl

Title: Product Manager for Wine Production Software, Remote
Description: InnoVint is a rapidly growing software company, offering the wine industry’s leading wine production software solution. Our cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) solution helps commercial wineries’ wine production, winegrowing, governmental compliance, IT and finance teams efficiently manage the end-to-end operations of a modern, successful winery. From vineyard to bottle to filing mandatory compliance reports with the TTB, InnoVint is modern winemaking reimagined! Watch this 5-minute video for a quick overview of the InnoVint platform in action. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNBBZz08DWY   The Role We’re a passionate team focused on making it easier for winemakers to make great wine and now we’re excited to be hiring our first Product Manager. If you join us, you’ll contribute to our product strategy, orchestrate product execution and help shape our business, culture and internal processes.  An InnoVint Product Manager has a broad scope, but your initial goals will be to augment our small but mighty product design team by improving our design processes around mapping complex winemaking flows into software. You will be an active participant in ideation, goal setting, iteration, and approval of new features, while coordinating these cycles to ensure we’re on schedule and meeting business goals. You will be responsible for scheduling meetings, setting deadlines, collecting feedback, and getting buy in from multiple teams.  You will be stepping into a mature team that’s delivered complex and high-impact features over the last 8 years. Even with this expertise, we know there is a missing piece in our product design team and we’re ready to learn from you. Your job is to amplify the talents of our design team by creating an effective pipeline of product output.  You will establish goals for each feature and ensure those goals are met throughout the design process. You will work closely with the CEO, CTO, UX Lead, our users, and our internal winemakers to establish goals for each feature. You will ensure these goals are being met throughout the design process, while being careful and cognizant to keep the product team aligned and focused.  Beyond leading our product design process, your auxiliary responsibilities will be to work with customers and partners to inform our view of the market. You will work with marketers to go to market with valuable, differentiated offerings and to design and refine our core market positioning, work with sales on strategic accounts, and support our executive team and Board of Directors with pricing and strategic analysis.  An InnoVint Product Manager enables the entire company to execute a strategically differentiated and innovative product and business strategy. It’s a challenging but essential and highly visible, exciting role.   Does the Product Manager Role at InnoVint Excite You? If joining us as our first Product Manager is something that excites you, send us an email to careers@innovint.us. Please read the full job description here: https://www.innovint.us/contact/careers/productmanager/  At InnoVint we value diversity and believe diverse teams make better products and contribute to more successful companies.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Software Engineer Conservation Biology Institute -- Corvallis, OR -- Remote optional Conservation Biology Institute (CBI) is hiring a full-stack software engineer to help build science-powered, spatially-focused web applications to inform real-world decisions about conservation and the natural environment. About the position We are looking for an experienced and versatile developer who is comfortable working with all aspects of web application development. You will work with clients, users, and stakeholders along with other team members to conceptualize, plan, design, build, deploy, and maintain a variety of applications. You will help guide and mentor other developers, helping them debug code, develop strategies to solve problems, and test and improve code. We will try to match you with projects and roles that fit with your interests and give you opportunities to work with new, technologies, and responsibilities. About us CBI is a non-profit with a mission to conserve biological diversity and build a more sustainable world. We are a cohesive group of scientists, GIS analysts, spatial modellers, and software engineers. The small software team works closely with other staff at CBI, as well as with external clients to design and build custom, innovative software. As an organization, we have a unique capability to deliver software informed by scientific expertise and backed by high quality spatial data. We are responsible for Data Basin (a science-based environmental spatial data platform), as well as numerous online decision support applications. Requirements We are looking for applicants with 5+ years of software development experience. You should be skilled with the languages, tools, and frameworks used in front- and back-end web application development. You should be comfortable learning and applying new languages and tools on-the-job. We commonly use the following technologies in our work: Python, Django, modern JavaScript, ReactJS, CSS, Mapbox GL JS, and various GIS tools and software libraries. Compensation The salary range for this position is $70k - $82k. Benefits include: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; paid vacation, holiday, and sick days, employer matched Simple IRA retirement plan, and flexible work schedules. Apply Please email your résumé to Attn: Pam Frost and include: why you’re interested in this position, how your past experience relates to it, and any examples of your work that you’re able to share with us (GitHub, Stack Overflow, etc. profiles are welcome). We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Title: Sr. C# developer, with with Automated Test Development Skills
Description: We are looking for a staff developer to join our team.   We are tool agnostic so Microsoft, Linux and mobile development are all plusses.   This would be an employee position with the vacation, sick leave, medical/dental and a 401K plan.  Present work is with a medical implantable.  The work is complex and rewarding, with the direct reward that you are doing a task that will help mankind.  Development would be around creating automated testing in C#.  Our present projects include: * Autonomous ground vehicle development * Satellite communication * Medical cart and cloud support * Robotic control * Medical devices  We've been in business for almost 30 years, ... and we get to do the fun stuff.

Title: C# Vue Software Developers
Description: Accepting local and remote applicants.Come join a small tight-knit team working on greenfield projects.Fantastic opportunity to make an immediate impact using the latest technology.We're working on: Next generation applications for the automotive industry and beyond, all cloud-based and mobile-first design We’re working with Vue, Vuetify, Azure, .NET Core, Entity Framework Core, and SQL ServerWe’re looking for: Mid-level full stack software engineer that can understand complex business requirements and provide technical solutions  Enjoys the challenge of learning innovative technologiesStrong C# Strong .NET Core Strong Entity Framework Code First  Strong JavaScript  Experience with:   Vue.js  Vuetify  Azure  SQL Server  Why work for us: Comprehensive benefits package (PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, etc.) Salary starting at $90k range with lots of career growth opportunitiesAbout us:Point S is a co-op of over two hundred independently owned tire and auto stores across the US. Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech. You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=pdxswe&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Front-End Software Engineer for Flight Management Web Application
Description: Avinode is hiring!  We are looking for a front-end engineer to join our Portland development team. You will work with a cross-functional Tech team (product, UX, engineering, and QA) to build the next generation of features for Schedaero, the charter aviation industry’s most popular web application for flight quoting, scheduling, and business aviation operations.    Who are we looking for?  You are the right person for this job if you:  Bring 3+ years of experience developing responsive web applications using a modern JavaScript framework (we use React for new development, while maintaining some legacy pages using older JavaScript technologies), as well as CSS and SASS. Thrive in an environment where you will be asked to both improve our front-end code and the infrastructure that powers it (our toolset currently includes NPM, Node, Webpack, and Babel). Can mentor other engineers on your team who are building their React skills. Have basic C# and .Net MVC experience with a focus on REST APIs. Care about automated testing (Jasmine and Jest experience are a plus). Know your way around agile software development. We tend to follow Kanban, but aren’t religious about it. Have recent experience with source control and bug tracking software (we use Git and Jira). Are an independent self-starter who isn’t afraid to ask questions. Communicate well. With offices in multiple time zones and multiple countries, this position requires strong written and verbal communication skills.  Why Avinode?  This is why we like it here: Interesting products mean interesting projects to work on. Flight management is a tricky business, and we all enjoy the challenge of helping our customers manage their flight schedules, pilot rosters, and aircraft fleets. Our products are used around the world - we're proud of that. Business aviation is kind of a glamorous industry, but we're a casual, laid-back office: we get along well, eat breakfast as a team once a week, eat lunch together frequently, and enjoy an occasional beer and MarioKart tournament. We care about the business and the business cares about us: we have a good relationship with management, sales, and support. We're all in this together.   We're small: that means a flat management structure, fewer meetings, and frequent opportunities to impact the software we develop. Software is our thing, but so is raising a family, rock climbing, watching baseball, or (insert your thing here). We have lives outside work and we work hard to keep it that way.  What else should you know?  This is a full-time, salaried position on a team based in Portland, Oregon. Our team is currently 100% remote due to the ongoing COVID pandemic. Post-pandemic, we expect this position to be partly onsite in our downtown Portland office, with the ability to work from home periodically. We offer competitive employee benefits.  About Avinode Group  Avinode Group was the first company to move business aviation online, disrupting an entire industry with a technology-first mindset. Today, we operate a growing suite of applications that 6,000+ air charter professionals use to do their everyday work. We take our role in their businesses seriously and make a point of delivering consistently excellent customer service and unique, ever-improving products. This level of sophistication doesn’t stop us from having fun, however. We “Noders” find it important to enjoy an open and friendly work atmosphere, where a bit of quirky humor is always welcome. With 100 Noders spread between Göteborg, Miami and Portland, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers every single person to come forward with new ideas, to make mistakes and initiate dialogue. Avinode seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work alongside smart, humorous and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us every day to exceed expectations. We are convinced that diversity contributes to building a more sustainable company and we strive to be good role model for diversity. Across the Avinode Group we actively work to make sure all employees have the same possibilities and rights regardless of age, ethnicity, gender, religion, sexual orientation or disability. To learn more about who we are and what we do, please visit our website: www.avinodegroup.com. About Schedaero  Owned by the Avinode Group, our Schedaero platform is a flight operations solution that streamlines all aspects of fleet management and flight scheduling. Schedaero brings diverse operations together in one place: scheduling, trip management, flight and duty logging. Rather than having data spread out across multiple on-and offline systems, Schedaero keeps data readily accessible 24/7

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
