Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description: Freedom Mortgage is hiring a Remote Senior Software Engineer! Freedom Mortgage is a privately held, full-service residential mortgage lender licensed in all 50 states, Washington D.C., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. We are one of the largest and fastest-growing privately held mortgage companies in the country, as well as a top 5 residential lender in the USA. And we are continuing to grow! Freedom Mortgage is proud to offer a variety of benefits with this role including:  Competitive compensation! 100% work from home role A strong team environment that prides themselves on quality loans Great training opportunities And so much more!  Job Responsibilities We are looking for a self-motivated hands-on Software Engineer to play a key role with a primary focus on enterprise wide Document Automation initiatives. This individual will have passion for technology and exception skills leading and developing applications/platforms using Cloud Technologies.  Responsible for leading a development team of contractors and employee Defines system solutions based on user/client needs, cost, and required integration with existing applications, systems, or platforms Works with Enterprise Architecture team and assists in development of policies for standardizing systems, development tools and security practices Provides expertise and guidance for the design, development, implementation, and sustainment of IT solutions that enhance overall system performance and availability Provide technical knowledge and analysis of high-level functional systems analysis, design, and integration advice on complex matters that require expert level knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation Lead development of various initiatives using but not limited to AWS Services, cognitive capabilities, n tier architecture using J2EE frameworks, containers such as Kubernetes Responsible for architecting and deploying cloud-native applications onto Amazon Web Services (AWS) or similar Identifying requirements, researching options, designing and implementing solutions at a leadership level for the application included in the portfolio  Job Requirements  5+ years of hands on experience developing applications using J2EE, Spring Frameworks, RDBMS such as Oracle, MS SQL Server Experience working with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB Extensive understanding and experience programming and designing software using Angular JS/ReactJS, Tomcat and AWS cloud services (AWS Machine Learning services, Serverless technologies), container technologies such as Docker Experience in implementing and overseeing cloud computing strategy, and cloud deployment, operations, maintenance, and troubleshooting Experience developing applications using Microservices Architecture Experience developing and integrating RESTful APIs Experience in application performance monitoring using enterprise tool Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines, test automation, multi-variant testing BS or higher in Computer Science or related technology field

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract)
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Compensation: Competitive with Benefits + Remote-Based Role in the U.S.A.
Description: Are you a full stack engineer with React, Node/Spring, Java/Scala/Kotlin, PostgreSQL/ Mongodb in your stack? If yes, we have an amazing opportunity to build scalable, reliable cloud-based applications.  *Please Note: You must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.A. without restrictions.  About Us  CarrierDirect - We are on a mission to modernize the Transportation, Logistics and Supply Chain industry.  CarrierDirect partners with clients who are leading the industry beyond disruption. We bring transformational business strategies and digital products to our clients, that make the world more efficient, connected and viable. We are inspired by people who are passionate, curious and want to innovate.  About the Opportunity  We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer (senior level, preferred) who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of engineering. Responsibilities will include translating requirements into scalable, reliable, ease of use cloud-based applications. We are working on challenging problems that require bright minds and persistent engineers to solve. We are bringing the transportation industry to the cloud and looking for ways to leverage data analytics to provide additional value to our customers.  Key Responsibilities Include:  Write, test, document and deploy code to support our client’s requirements Develop new user-facing features Build reusable code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Build backend APIs and optimize the application for speed and scalability Design and implement data storage solutions Develop awesome products for our clients using the latest frameworks Our preferred stack includes React, Node/Spring, Java/Scala/Kotlin, PostgreSQL/Mongodb Implement Infrastructure as Code and support CI/CD with tools like CircleCI Work with cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP and Azure Work side-by-side with our clients and the rest of the team Mentor junior team members  About You  Professional web development experience which includes hands on experience with:  Java and/or JavaScript in an API-focused environment Spring/SpringBoot and/or Nodejs/Expressjs JavaScript and React or Angular Excellent problem solving and debugging skills Understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks Proficient understanding of build and source control tools Proficient in creating and administering containers using Docker and Kubernetes Proficient in creating and maintaining REST APIs and micro services

Title: Entry Level Engineering Technician
Description: HP Tuners is currently seeking a full-time Entry Level Engineering Technician to join our team in Buffalo Grove, IL. As an Engineering Technician, you will be responsible for completing various services offered by HP Tuners as well as working closely with the Engineering team on new product research and development.  Candidate Requirements: --Education Level: High School Diploma. --Previous experience in automotive, electronics, etc. --Proficient with hand tools. --Possess basic soldering skills. --Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. --Authorized to work in the United States. --Ability to work at company’s office in Buffalo Grove, IL.  Skills & Abilities: --Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. --Ability to work autonomously on projects. --Good problem solving skills.  Position Incentives: HP Tuners subsidizes Health Insurance for the employee. HP Tuners also provides for the employee at no charge Dental, Vision, Long and Short-term disability Insurance and $100,000 in life insurance. There is also up to a 3% match in our 401K program. HP Tuners offers a fun and family like environment. There is a yearly review and bonus program.

Title: Senior devops engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a senior and experienced devops engineer to our core team of 10, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in modern/current devops technologies and practices on the AWS platform, including CDK, Lambda, SQS, VPCs, EC2, etc. • Proficient and experienced in CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, infrastructure management, deployment automation, and automated software release • Experienced in developing automated monitoring services and reports to track service, network, and application availability and performance, and to trigger notifications when intervention is needed • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.

Title: Windows Desktop App Developer
Compensation: Salary and benefits based on experience
Description: We are currently looking for a Windows Desktop App Developer for long-term, ongoing assignment to our programming team. Ideally, it would be helpful for them to have some familiarity and experience with imaging applications. - Proficient in C++ / .NET / MFC / ATL - Knowledge of MS Access, MS SQL Server, and Oracle. - Working Knowledge of VB 6.0 and vbscript - Experience working with MS Visual Studio, and Source Control Tools. - Nice to have experience working with cloud-based apps.

Title: Cloud Software Engineer
Description: Royal Cyber Inc. seeks Cloud Software Engineer in Naperville, IL.  Responsibilities: The Cloud Software Engineer is responsible for our software product enhancement and developments. Designs, develops, tests, and creates software solutions. Creates AWS cloud architecture and documents solutions to problems. Works with various teams for business solutions, portals, and architecture to create an overall user interface. Implements solutions with complete considerations on infrastructure capability, performance, supportability to achieve end user business results. Monitors file transfer portal related activities and provides technical clarifications, as needed. Writes, designs, codes, tests, implements, and debugs programs adhering to business requirements and standards. Implements PGP, HTTPS, FTPS, and SFTP solutions. Promotes technical best practices and maintains functional and technical documentation for all changes and enhancements. Other duties as assigned. Periodic/long-term travel may be required to various unanticipated worksites in the U.S. 50-70% of time; individuals may reside anywhere in the U.S.  Education: *Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or foreign equivalent).  Requirements: *1 year of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements include: 1 year of experience with Bash Scripting and Unix; 1 year of experience with transport protocols; 1 year of experience working with Python; 1 year of experience with continuous deployment and automated testing of code; and periodic/long-term travel may be required to various unanticipated worksites in the U.S. 50-70% of time; individuals may reside anywhere in the U.S.  * In lieu of a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or foreign equivalent) and 1 year in the job offered or related positions, employer will accept candidates with an Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or foreign equivalent) and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or related positions.  Mail resumes to Royal Cyber, 55 Shuman Blvd, Ste 275, Naperville, IL 60563 quoting job #CSE126

Title: QA Lead
Description: Royal Cyber Inc. seeks QA Lead in Naperville, IL.  Responsibilities: The QA Lead is responsible for creating and improving automation frameworks and testing. Identifies the scope of testing. Identifies the requirements for testing. Documents and carries out test care preparation and setup. Designs, develops, and maintains the testing of automation frameworks. Conducts and analyzes smoke testing, regression, integration testing, and bug tracking. May supervise 6-10 employees in the role of Senior QA Engineer, QA Engineer, Junior QA Engineer, and Trainee Test Engineer. Other duties as assigned. Periodic/long-term travel may be required to various unanticipated worksites in the U.S. 50-70% of time; individuals may reside anywhere in the U.S.  Education: *Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field (or foreign equivalent).  Requirements: *1 year of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements include: 1 year of experience using Selenium Web Driver or Selenium Remote Control; 1 year of experience using Java based script for Test Scripting; 1 year of experience with test management and bugs tracking tools, such as JIRA, Zephyr, or TestLink; 1 year of experience using ProtractorJS and CucumberJS for Angular based applications; and periodic/long-term travel may be required to various unanticipated worksites in the U.S. 50-70% of time; individuals may reside anywhere in the U.S.  *In lieu of a Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field and one (1) year of experience in the job offered or related position, employer will accept candidates with a Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field and five (5) years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or related position.  Mail resumes to Royal Cyber, 55 Shuman Blvd, Ste 275, Naperville, IL 60563 quoting job #QAL915

Title: Customer Support Representative (Remote)
Description: Position Type: Non-exempt, Full-time, HourlyPositions Available: 2Hours: 8:00 am-5:00 pm PT (10:00 am- 7:00 pm CT, 11:00 am - 8:00 pm ET)  or 6:00 am-3:00 pm PT (8:00 am - 5:00 pm CT, 9:00 am- 6:00 pm ET) Monday through Friday, and occasional on-call weekend hours (on rotation with other team members) with the flexibility to work additional hours as needed or to accommodate fellow team members PTO/Sick Leave. We also offer a "flex Friday" schedule of M-TH 9 hour days with a 4-hour shift on Friday that can be discussed further in the offer process. Pay Rate: $18-20, Depending on experienceLocation: RemoteReports to: VP of Client Services and Success About HiringThingHiringThing is online software that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants and hire great employees. We were founded in 2012 with the mission to deliver intuitive, easy-to-use recruiting software across multiple sales channels and product types. HiringThing operates in a flexible startup environment where employees can be hands-on in helping build a new company. This is a remote position, so team members will thrive in a work-from-home environment. Our team stays connected through daily communication and regular video calls.SummaryHiringThing is seeking a full-time, remote Customer Support Representative with a technical background to provide support to our users and customers in accordance with our customer support philosophy and guidelines. Our support philosophy is encapsulated by our tagline Support Beyond Compare™. To expand on this, we aim to consistently deliver friendly, effective, knowledgeable, and timely support to our clients. We strive to provide a solution that results in Hiring Happiness™ the first time around. Technical skills required include a deep understanding of the operating systems and software, problem-solving skills, and a focus on quality. You will have internal and external resources at your fingertips to help you answer customer inquiries and solve issues knowledgeably. While our mascot is a robot, we are strongly opposed to the type of robo-support some companies employ that crafts an impersonal and suboptimal customer experience. So, what we won’t do is make you follow a script or dictate exactly how each customer inquiry is to be handled. Use our guidelines and your own discernment in answering customer inquiries, keeping our philosophy first and foremost in your actions. ResponsibilitiesBelow is a list of core, initial responsibilities associated with this position. This list is subject to expansion based on the Customer Support Representative's interest, aptitudes, and performance. We support each employee's growth in their individual role and help each person maximize their fulfillment in their role. Effectively manage and respond to high volumes of support phone calls, tickets, and/or chats submitted via email or through our support portal.Provide consistently friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and timely support to our clients, striving to provide the correct solution the first time around.Build relationships with clients through open and honest communication.Handle complaints effectively, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits and follow up to ensure resolution. Keep accurate records of customer support interactions using defined methods and tools.Communicate with clients and prospects using the correct branding (we offer our software under multiple brand names).Create and maintain existing support knowledge-based articles.Support new client implementations through virtual training. Review/verify new subscription accounts.Process manual paid job postings.Review job postings submitted for organic job board visibility.Participate in weekly team meetings.Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies.Actively use each customer interaction as an opportunity to deliver Hiring Happiness™.Actively add content and solutions to internal knowledge-base. Contribute articles to our client-facing support knowledge-base.RequirementsYou have excellent communication and active listening skills.You excel in your attention to detail.You quickly learn new software.Flexibility and adaptability are your middle name.You know how to prioritize, manage time effectively and follow through on tasks/responsibilities.Working independently and problem-solving fit in your back pocket. You have proven strong customer support experience.Familiarity with HTML and CSS stylesheets is a plus.You are familiar with both Windows and Mac OS-based operating systems.Your knowledge of all major web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, IE, Edge) is proficient.API integration knowledge is a plus.Who You AreYou are comfortable with technology.Self-motivation is your strength.You are Passionate about providing solution-focused support.Benefits$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursement401(k) Plan with Roth and Standard optionsAbility to work remotelyOpportunity to have an impact in a hands-on manner on the growth and direction of the CompanyPaid time off starting at 3 weeks per year8 paid holidays Participation in employee stock option planOpportunity for professional development Comprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesApplicants will be asked to complete a brief assessment as part of the application process. This will take approximately 20 minutes and cannot be re-entered once you exit the process. Please allow enough time to complete the assessment. Thank you.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/257403/customer-support-representative-remote?s=cl

Title: Mid-Level Full Stack Engineer (J2EE)
Description: Freedom Marketing (www.freedomdam.com) is looking for full-time software engineers to help build and maintain digital marketing solutions for our clients. As an Adobe Business Partner, Freedom Marketing implements Adobe Experience Manager and related digital marketing tools for primarily U.S.-based corporate clients.   As a member of our technology practice, we want to provide you with a learning opportunity, the ability to see your work have an impact for our clients, and plenty of room to grow with our company.  We are headquartered in Arlington, VA with locations in Chicago, Atlanta, and Tempe but are open to applicants across the U.S., as we have a distributed team.  ABOUT YOU: We aren’t looking for someone who knows a lot about everything we do. While that would be great, we’re realistic about the chances of that happening (almost zero)! Instead, we’re looking for someone who: • Has a working knowledge of the following major technologies: Java/J2EE, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, including at least 1 framework (e.g. JQuery, Angular). NOTE: Candidates without solid Java experience will not be considered. • Is familiar with modern IDEs and Debuggers (We use JetBrains products – IntelliJ, primarily) • Is familiar with Git or Mercurial source control. • Has good verbal and written communication skills. As a remote employee, your ability to effectively communicate is critical. • Can effectively manage their time without suffocating oversight. We value people who can handle responsibility and want to be given the flexibility to do their job. • Knows how to learn and is eager to do so. • Can travel for client and company meetings (once safe to do so). This won’t be frequent, and we’ll give you plenty of notice. • Lives in the United States.  ABOUT US: Freedom Marketing is a Digital Asset Management focused consultancy whose goal is to enable our customers to more efficiently generate marketing creative materials to grow their business. We partner with Adobe to implement marketing technologies to meet that goal.  We have a small team of dedicated professionals and we’re growing rapidly. Within the company, we’re focused on hiring great people and letting them do good work in a relaxed environment. With our clients, we’re focused on developing long-term relationships and delivering solutions that meet their needs.  We offer solid compensation, good vacation/sick/holiday policies, and great benefits (various health-related insurances, short- and long-term disability, 401k with company match, etc).   TO APPLY: If you would like to apply for this position, please respond to this post with your resume, links to any open-source contributions you’ve made, and the best time(s) to discuss the position over the next week.  We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Principal Full Stack Engineer (RoR/etc), Full-Time, Remote, Music Tech
Compensation: Competitive cash compensation paid biweekly plus good chunk of equity
Description: COMPANY JamKazam (https://jamkazam.com/) has spent the last 6 years building the best platform in the world to help musicians play together live and in-sync over the Internet from different locations with high quality audio and video. See one of our online music festivals for an example: https://youtu.be/JGShI6izZBA. And see this overview for an intro: https://youtu.be/ylYcvTY9CVo. We are a private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech.  OPPORTUNITY We are looking for a talented, experienced principal engineer with 7+ years of experience developing complex applications with full stack scope to join our core engineering team on a full-time contract basis for a long-term run – initially as a heavy individual contributor, and then ideally once you have sufficient exposure to the product portfolio, also as team lead. We want someone who is excited by our music mission, who can operate with relative autonomy across a broad scope of our application portfolio, and who enjoys development across front-end, back-end, database, and devops – pretty much everything. This gig is fully remote - the whole team is remote/virtual and always has been.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages • Experience and passion for all aspects of development – front-end, back-end, database, devops • Expertise and proficiency in Ruby on Rails • Experience in front-end application development with React/jQuery or similar • Proficient in use of current Web UI development technologies, in particular Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3 • Proficient in use of SQL  • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  COMPENSATION This is a 1099 contractor position. Very competitive cash compensation paid biweekly, plus a healthy chunk of equity in a rapidly growing music tech company in a highly compelling market segment.  LOCATION This is a fully remote position. No need to come into any office location.

Title: Entry Level - Software Developer
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area.  We are looking for developers who want to engage in challenging projects in futuristic technology, software development, and much more within a variety of sectors such as financial, health care, energy and federal.  Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C.  We will provide on the job training after you are hired.  **We have a continued investment in motivated, passionate individuals like you who strive to move forward in their careers through apprenticeship programs like Smoothstack. Please be aware we have modified our training so that we can continue to offer our apprenticeship program remotely until the CDC deems it appropriate to work in shared office spaces. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=chidata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Principal full stack engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a principal full stack engineer to our core team of 8, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages, including Node.js • Proficient in developing on the AWS platform/stack • Proficient in the use of SQL  • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.  APPLICATIONS No recruiters please. If you are an applicant, please reply to this ad with your resume and a note explaining your interest. We will not reply to all applications, but we do appreciate your interest. We will contact you if you look like a potential match.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description: Freedom Mortgage is hiring a Remote Senior Software Engineer! Freedom Mortgage is a privately held, full-service residential mortgage lender licensed in all 50 states, Washington D.C., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. We are one of the largest and fastest-growing privately held mortgage companies in the country, as well as a top 5 residential lender in the USA. And we are continuing to grow! Freedom Mortgage is proud to offer a variety of benefits with this role including:  Competitive compensation! 100% work from home role A strong team environment that prides themselves on quality loans Great training opportunities And so much more!  Job Responsibilities We are looking for a self-motivated hands-on Software Engineer to play a key role with a primary focus on enterprise wide Document Automation initiatives. This individual will have passion for technology and exception skills leading and developing applications/platforms using Cloud Technologies.  Responsible for leading a development team of contractors and employee Defines system solutions based on user/client needs, cost, and required integration with existing applications, systems, or platforms Works with Enterprise Architecture team and assists in development of policies for standardizing systems, development tools and security practices Provides expertise and guidance for the design, development, implementation, and sustainment of IT solutions that enhance overall system performance and availability Provide technical knowledge and analysis of high-level functional systems analysis, design, and integration advice on complex matters that require expert level knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation Lead development of various initiatives using but not limited to AWS Services, cognitive capabilities, n tier architecture using J2EE frameworks, containers such as Kubernetes Responsible for architecting and deploying cloud-native applications onto Amazon Web Services (AWS) or similar Identifying requirements, researching options, designing and implementing solutions at a leadership level for the application included in the portfolio  Job Requirements  5+ years of hands on experience developing applications using J2EE, Spring Frameworks, RDBMS such as Oracle, MS SQL Server Experience working with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB Extensive understanding and experience programming and designing software using Angular JS/ReactJS, Tomcat and AWS cloud services (AWS Machine Learning services, Serverless technologies), container technologies such as Docker Experience in implementing and overseeing cloud computing strategy, and cloud deployment, operations, maintenance, and troubleshooting Experience developing applications using Microservices Architecture Experience developing and integrating RESTful APIs Experience in application performance monitoring using enterprise tool Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines, test automation, multi-variant testing BS or higher in Computer Science or related technology field

Title: Rails Engineer (Remote)
Description: HiringThing is looking for a Software Engineer to focus on growing our Rails and React-based applicant tracking software platform. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions, and development priorities.  We practice continuous integration and deploy on-demand throughout the day.  Your primary focus will be developing our hiring platform but you'll also spend some time with test automation, API development, front-end React development, and infrastructure automation.Requirements Minimum 2 years of Ruby on RailsFamiliarity with modern Rails best practicesExperience with database-driven web applications (SQL)Some experience working with ES6 and modern front-end web frameworksIndependent work ethicFully remote workspace experience preferred Strong communication skillsParticipation in a triage engineering rotation and an on call engineering rotationTechnologies in Play Ruby on Rails MySQLReact (Webpack, ES6)Amazon Web ServicesTerraformDockerCompensation/Benefits401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursementAbility to work remotelyComprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesOpportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the CompanyUnlimited PTO policyOpportunity for professional development 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employeesParticipation in employee stock option planAbout HiringThingHiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.We’ve been a fully remote company since day 1 so we know how how to work in a virtual office across multiple time zones. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. You can work from home, your porch, or the beach as long as the work gets done.We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take a vacation, take time off for illness, and shift schedules as necessary.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/249152/rails-engineer-remote?s=cl

Title: Front End Engineer (Remote)
Description: HiringThing is looking for a Software Engineer to focus on growing our Rails and React based applicant tracking software platform. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions and development priorities.  We practice continuous integration and deploy on demand throughout the day.  You'll be responsible for building new frontend features with React/Redux, both independently and within a cross-functional team. You'll also be responsible for the maintenance of existing features, including bug fixes,some features are written in other frontend technologies such as jQuery.Requirements Minimum 2 years of javascript experienceAt least one year of React and ReduxStrong knowledge of HTML/CSS/SCSSFamiliarity with javascript testingExperience configuring webpackSome experience working with backend technologies (Rails specifically)Independent work ethicFully remote workspace experience preferredStrong communication skillsParticipation in a triage engineering rotation and an on call engineering rotationTechnologies in PlayReact with and without ReduxMocha/ChaiRuby on Rails MySQL Amazon Web ServicesDockerTerraformCompensation/Benefits:401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursementAbility to work remotelyComprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesOpportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the CompanyUnlimited PTO policyOpportunity for professional development 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employeesParticipation in employee stock option planAbout HiringThingHiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.We’re a fully remote company with a virtual office. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. We meet as a team daily and are required to connect with other teams during standard business hours. You can work from home, a coffee shop or the beach as long as the work gets done. We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take a vacation, take time off for illness and shift schedules as necessary.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/249153/front-end-engineer-remote?s=cl

Title: React Native Expert needed for a HOT HOT HOT startup!
Compensation: EQUITY in company. We do NOT need an employee. We need a reliable team member.
Description: We are a great team of 6 who managed to create a new Fintech SaaS platform that has been invited for funding by the US National Science Foundation and has been accepted for incubation within a Sandbox of a foreign country's Central Bank. The project became a Harvard case study in May 2020 and the team members have over 100 years of combined technical experience. Also, we are all based in Chicago and we all have other jobs.  We need a brilliant React Native developer, mainly to help us create the only left element of our stack, which is the android Mobile App. We already have a dedicated IOS developer, but our plans is to use React Native to recreate that same IOS mobile app for the Android platform and eventually for the IOS platform as well.  We own the patents for this technology and this startup will forever change the retail industry, once we roll out. We have a few stores lined up and whoever gets this opportunity will have a great chance to be part of the founding team and will get equity in the company.  We need someone who is EXPERT, RELIABLE & TRUSTWORTHY. If you have less than 3 years of experience doing React Native, chances will be slim, unless if your talent and personality will stand out.  If this post sparks your curiosity and if you fit the criteria we need, let's speak and once we show you what we are working on, then it is up to you to decide if this opportunity is worth it for you or not.  Note: We are in the process of hiring someone to create that same Android app. But, we need you to work with that person and to eventually take0over and own this part of our technology, so that our team remains self sufficient.  Thank you,

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program. Title: Software Engineer-Bringing Custom Machines to Life Around the World!
Description: Manufacturing Technology, Inc. Software Engineer-Bringing Custom Machines to Life Around the World! Job Label: Software Engineer 2021-MTI Are you a Software Engineer with in-depth programming experience in one programming technology?  Have you developed and maintained machine interface and machine control software? Are you looking for a consistently challenging opportunity with an industry leading, global manufacturing company that is thriving? For over thirty years, Manufacturing Technology, Inc. (MTI) has been combining sophisticated control systems with friction welding technology to create the world's leading automated friction welding equipment, friction welding technology and friction welding services. Our custom engineered solutions have served companies around the globe by solving their part joining and manufacturing problems in the most efficient way possible. As a Software Engineer for MTI, you will work with a multi-disciplined engineering team of Controls, Mechanical, and Fluid Power Engineers to provide a variety of machine control and machine interface solutions for industry titans that drive the world economy and lead technical advancements including: NASA, Honeywell, Boeing, Pratt and Whitney, and GE. This is an opportunity to bring together your years of experience and intimate programming knowledge to state-of-the-art, custom-engineered solid-state joining & welding solutions and equipment! As a Software Engineer for Manufacturing Technology, based in South Bend, Indiana, your primary mission is to develop, document, integrate and maintain control software for Friction Welding Machines. The software scope spans low-level device drivers through end-user HMI development and implementation. Because of your extensive background and demonstrated programming experience, you will have no problem interpreting requirements from customer specifications and developing the technical requirements for the needed software and documentation. You'll leverage your considerable programming experience to design and implement user interfaces and control software for manufacturing machinery.  You will also have an opportunity to build or leverage experience and understanding of machinery, machine controls and process knowledge. You will assist the Controls Engineers, as necessary, with machine start-up, interface software commissioning, software de-bug and operational readiness of the machines. You will be responsible for the architecture and programming conventions of new software applications and be a key player in the improvement process for existing architecture and programming conventions. Additionally, you will be relied upon to develop, advocate for and maintain programming techniques, standards, verification and validation methods. Your strong communications skills will be important in this role as you provide technical support to customers, Service Technicians and machine build and installation personnel. If you are ready to apply your software engineering experience and expertise in a challenging role with an industry leader, please apply now. Referrals welcome. Manufacturing Technology, Inc. (MTI) is a privately-held, fourth-generation company headquartered in South Bend, Indiana, specializing in transformational, custom-engineered friction welding and resistance welding solutions for manufacturing processes. Our leading-edge expertise is available worldwide on-site for industry applications such as aerospace, oil and gas, automotive, agriculture, construction, consumer product electronics, and military. MTI has delivered machines to Boeing, GE, Rolls- Royce, Pratt and Whitney, Federal Mogul, and many of their tier one suppliers.  Here is link to everything great about South Bend, Indiana: http://www.ci.south-bend.in.us/ MTI is a EOE/Affirmative Action and Drug Free Workplace.            To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.       Apply for this job:  https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/ce/486869003/Manufacturing-Technology-Inc/Indiana/South-Bend/Software-Engineer?sourceType=9          Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.       Related Keywords: C, C++, Visual Basic, VB, VB.NET, programmer, software engineering, software engineer, machine diagnostic, heavy machinery, machine tools, HMI, flow charts, sequence of operations, controls, control systems, user interface, PLC

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=bosdata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: IT Systems Analyst
Compensation: Starting at 80,000 Annually depending on experience
Description: To support our mission to educate, entertain and enrich the lives of our readers, putting books in their hands, wherever, however and whenever they choose, we need exceptional people!  The Quarto Group is seeking a IT Systems Analyst responsible for providing business analyst support for Microsoft Dynamics GP system, including accounting, sales, inventory, job cost modules and reporting services.  Are you an analytical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills? Come join our dynamic team in our Boston North Shore office!  The key responsibilities for this role include:  Provide system/business analyst support for Microsoft Dynamics GP system, including accounting, sales, inventory, job cost modules and reporting services. Develop and support data integrations between ERP system and multiple fulfillment warehouses using eConnect, Integration Manager and SQL stored procedures. Understand and guide business processes to make best use of ERP software. Provide ERP administration, setup up new users and assign access based on job descriptions. Troubleshoot issues to provide recommendations/solutions. Develop and support reports using SQL Server Reporting Services. Support TrueCommece EDI system, monitor incoming and outgoing documents to ensure documents are processed accurately. This role will require the following skills and qualifications:  Degree in Computer Science or related technical field required. 2-3 years of Microsoft Dynamics GP software experience. 2-3 years of SQL Server experience and strong skills in writing SQL Experience using SQL Server Reporting Services and Integration Services True Commerce EDI Effective oral and written communication skills Strong time management and organizational skills. Accountable for work quality and decision-making Preference for working in a high-level collaborative environment promoting teamwork. Desire to problem solve using root cause analysis.  To apply for this role please submit your resume and cover letter by e-mail careersusa@quarto.com  QuartoUS is an equal opportunity employer; M/F/D/V are encouraged to apply.

Title: Back-End Developer
Compensation: competitive total compensation package commensurate with experience
Description: Applied Invention is a multi-disciplinary innovation company that partners with corporations to design and build new technologies to help them grow and adapt to rapidly changing environments.  We are a group of experienced technologists that have especially strong skills in building complex systems that incorporate data analytics, artificial intelligence, cloud computing, machine learning, distributed sensors, robotics and data visualization. We work at the speed of a startup, with quality that comes from years of working together as a cohesive team.  Our relationships with our partners, primarily Fortune 1000 companies, are confidential and encompass a broad range of industries including agriculture, transportation, manufacturing, information technology, energy, medical and healthcare.  If you are a self-starter who shares our passion for solving problems that matter, for pushing the limits of what’s possible, and for asking hard questions, we want to meet you.   Description  Applied Invention is looking for a server-side developer with experience on a variety of architectures. This full-time job will have a mix of architecture, design, development and testing, as well as other activities such as code reviews, customer meetings and prototyping in support of a variety of the company’s projects. The role offers multiple growth opportunities including work in big data and machine learning.  Responsibilities  • Architect, develop and test both prototype and production server-side applications • Deployment in cloud and customer environments • Stay current with the state of the art in development tools, frameworks and methodologies • Adapt to customer requirements and technology choices  Requirements  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related subject; or 4+ years of industry experience • Experience with production software development • Interest in working across industries and applications  Experience in the following categories:  • any of Python/Java/C++/Go/Rust • SQL and NoSQL databases • web protocols (HTTP, REST, JSON, etc) • version-control tools (e.g. Git, SVN) • cloud environments (e.g. AWS, Azure)  Additional Skills  Experience with the following categories are not required, but can be valuable to the role: • Robotics, ROS • Web applications technologies, including Javascript, Typescript, React, etc. • Mobile applications (iOS, Android) • 3D engines, including Unreal or Unity • Geospatial engines • Machine learning    Applied Invention is an Equal Opportunity Employer  To apply for this position, use the link below:  https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=5f54061b-30da-4865-9231-dcc10cb67cbe&ccId=19000101_000001&jobId=339717&lang=en_US&source=CC4

Description  Applied Invention is looking for a full-stack developer with experience on a variety of server-side and client architectures. This full-time job will have a mix of architecture, design, development and testing, as well as other activities such as code reviews, customer meetings and prototyping in support of a variety of the company’s projects. The role offers multiple growth opportunities including work in robotics, big data and machine learning. Title: React/React Native Frontend Developer (Remote, Contract)
Description: React/React Native Frontend Developer Needed (Remote, Contract)  Seeking frontend developer with a proven track record working with React. Applicants should have proficiency with: • React and/or React Native • Redux • Sagas • Typescript  Work will be 100% remote using Slack and kanban.  30-40hrs/week 20-25/hr DOE  Starts immediately NDA required and must be US citizen and currently reside in the US. Potential for future contracts if fit is good  Please respond with: -Availability (start date, hours per week) -Replies must include a resume in PDF format -Github/portfolio: send over link to public projects that demonstrate knowledge of react, e.g. links to specific github repos in addition to your github profile -Use subject line: FE dev -Replies that do not have the correct subject line will be ignored

Title: Contractor Backend Developer
Description: Agency is looking for a backend developer to supplement work on an existing project on a contract basis. Work is mostly adding features, some bug fixes.  Technology stack is express, typescript, postgres Must have demonstrated experience using postgres or other sql databases Must have demonstrated experience on production apps Must have example code to share (e.g. a link to a github repo that demonstrates core competency with the listed technologies)  Work will be 100% remote using Slack and kanban. Experience with remote work is preferred as you'll be working with an experienced remote team of developers.  30-40hrs/week 25-35/hr DOE  Starts immediately NDA required Potential for future contracts if fit is good  Please respond with: -Availability (start date, hours per week) -Replies must include a resume in PDF format -Github/portfolio -Use subject line: BE dev -Replies that do not have the correct subject line will be ignored

Title: Entry Level - Software Developer
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area.  We are looking for developers who want to engage in challenging projects in futuristic technology, software development, and much more within a variety of sectors such as financial, health care, energy and federal.  Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C.  We will provide on the job training after you are hired.  **We have a continued investment in motivated, passionate individuals like you who strive to move forward in their careers through apprenticeship programs like Smoothstack. Please be aware we have modified our training so that we can continue to offer our apprenticeship program remotely until the CDC deems it appropriate to work in shared office spaces. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=bosdata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Certified Encompass Developer/Programmer
Description: REMOTE POSITION Full time Ellie Mae Encompass API/SDK/HTML Programmer/Developer  $130,000+/year commensurate with experience and ability Includes paid healthcare plus dental, vision and 401K plan Eligible candidates MUST have Encompass 360 Mortgage Lending Software experience  Certified Ellie Mae Encompass Developer & Administrator - writing complex business rules, designing input forms, handling day to day administration of Encompass software. Proficient in C#/.NET development, building Plugins, codebase assemblies, stand alone console apps, WPF and Winform based apps to interface with Encompass. Javascript, HTML and CSS and experience working with APIs and Ellie Mae Developer Connect. Must be able to make Encompass talk to other systems, automate data entry and delivery. Experience with many similar front end applications, data warehousing concepts, and productivity/code tracking systems such as JIRA, TFS, and Github. Innovative and highly technical with a good working knowledge of WPF and Encompass Software - design, coding and working with a team to develop for Encompass. Looking for at least 2-3 years experience. Microsoft certifications are a plus.  Qualities we are looking for: Great communication skills, verbally and written Willingness to learn and expand upon existing skill sets Team player & able to work without supervision High level of attention to detail Ability to effectively communicate technical information in simple terms Friendly, patient and positive nature  MortgageTech is one of the oldest Ellie Mae Consulting and Technical Partners. We provide support and technical services to a variety of companies who use the Encompass Mortgage Banking software. While we all work remotely, we are as much a family as we are a team. Being a remote company, making sure you have a dedicated workspace is essential. We meet virtually, so no travel is required. Honesty, transparency and timely communication are critical. Avoiding unnecessary calls and meetings is part of our culture, but we are efficient and punctual when we meet over MS Teams. We are a company that empowers our team to be independent decision-makers, always striving for high standards for contribution to the team. Although remote, our team is a tightknit and supportive group of individuals. Having excellent communication and interpersonal skills is something we highly value. We only employ the top front-end thinkers and software administrators in the industry, so you'll be working with some of the best and brightest. You will work on a variety of projects, so you must be able to switch gears easily. As you will work remotely, we are looking for a quick learner, someone who loves to work hard, delivers outsatnding work, is self-motivated, and loves programming.  Find out more about us at  https://mortgagetech.com

Title: Xamarine Software Developer
Description: Our company, a Boston based system developer is looking for full stack hands-on Xamarin Software Developer to join our team! It's not a remote job, it's a full time employment and you need to be on site everyday.(some flexibility is available) We are small team of 4 people in the office on a daily basis. We provide SaaS products to our clients throughout the US and internationally. We focus on customer software solutions in the unattended retail marketplace, including scheduling and routing, sales and inventory transaction processing, remote data acquisition from automated and unattended points of sale, service call tracking. DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:  Design, develop, test, and maintain mobile applications for iOS and Android on the Xamarin platform  Diagnose complex issues, evaluate, and recommend/execute the best resolution  Influence system design by identifying and recommending design and requirement needs for software  Write code that meets the production requirements and design specifications  Implement manual and automated testing for the mobile application development process  Participate in design reviews to provide a technical perspective on implementation  Able to perform research of Third-party tools and undertake implementation of them  Be able to comprehend, analyze and communicate Business requirements and issues arising from existing published implementations  Publishing app to testing environments and app stores. SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:  Bachelor’s in computer science, Computer Systems Engineering or a similar engineering discipline.  2-5 years of Full Stack experience in Software Development with Xamarin and associated Microsoft development tools and environment  Proven delivery experience with Xamarin, C# .NET and SQL, as well as ASP, MVVC, WCF, REST. Significant SQL server experience including schema development, query analysis and optimization.  Visual Studio and Infragistics.  Knowledge and expertise with Bluetooth and general wireless communication protocols This is a hands-on software development role with opportunity to grow and take on enhanced responsibilities for the development and direction of the product. The company name is Synectic Software Solutions. Web site is http://www.synecticssi.com/ The product is here: http://www.vendsys.com/ Synectic Software Solutions is a subsidiary of the Nayax company: https://www.nayax.com/about- nayax/

Title: PowerBuilder Programmer/Analyst Position
Description: McCracken Financial Solutions, located in Billerica Ma., is a leading software provider for the financial lending industry. McCracken clients are the top commercial lenders including Mortgage Bankers, Banks, Insurance Agencies, Government Agencies, Credit Companies and Thrifts servicing mortgage loans on our STRATEGY system.  Our products support the origination and servicing of commercial loans from the application process to the disposition of the loan including asset management, accounting and customer communication.     Job description:  The ideal candidate will work as a member of the development team for our Strategy application. Candidates will be responsible for analysis, design, development, and testing of user interfaces using PowerBuilder and DB2.  Requirements: This position is for a PowerBuilder candidate to work in PowerBuilder   • 2-4 years of PowerBuilder required - will support current software application which is written in PowerBuilder using PFC and object oriented techniques. • Will be writing SQL stored procedures in DB2 on IBM  iSeries. • Must be able to hit the ground running - object inheritance, client server experience, relational DBMS experience. • Must have excellent written and verbal communications skills and be a team player.  • Must be competent working through all phases of the SDLC, in either a team environment or independently.  • Outstanding analytical skills - Self starter, someone who naturally takes initiative, is pro-active and can work independently on a variety of projects.   • Ability to write technical documents and provide adequate documentation in code and in formal formats.  Desired Profile: • Object Oriented Programming experience is preferred • Prior PowerBuilder experience required • Two+ years of PFC (PowerBuilder Foundation Classes) preferred  Applicants must be a U.S. citizen or a "U.S. Person". A U.S. Person is defined as a person who is a lawful permanent resident “Green Card holder" as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1101 (a)(20) or who is a "Protected Individual" as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).  No telephone calls for this position will be accepted. No third party recruiters
