Title: Mortgage Loan Underwriter
Description: Founded locally in 1969 by Marshall M. Sloane, Century Bank is New England's largest family‐run bank with 27 branches throughout Greater Boston. Today Century Bank is the Bank families and businesses rely on -- a place where you can count on getting personal attention. Whether you need a free checking account, easy online banking or a sophisticated financial solution, you'll find it at Century Bank. For more information, visit www.CenturyBank.com. Currently, we are searching for enthusiastic individuals to join the Century team!   Job overview:   Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Consumer Lending, the candidate for this position analyzes employment profile, credit strength, property characteristics, and all other information pertinent to the credit decision process on each mortgage application.  Underwrites and recommends for approval, denial, suspension or counteroffer, mortgage applications in accordance with established bank strategies, policies and procedures while also ensuring compliance with state and federal regulatory requirements. Maintains a constant working knowledge of portfolio and PMI underwriting guidelines as outlined in the bank’s credit policy manual.  Works closely with processing staff and branch managers to ensure all required documentation is obtained, reviewed and acceptable. Responsibilities:   Works with the Mortgage Originators and Branch Managers to acquire all needed information, circulates and explains rates, terms, obligations, etc.   Supports processor and closer in the review of loan packages, ensuring that all necessary documentation is included, requesting additional documentation, at his/her discretion, to strengthen the package.  Responsible for underwriting 1st and 2nd lien position mortgages, home equity lines,  Mass Save Heat loans, personal loans, auto draft requests and auto loans in accordance with portfolio guidelines.  Reviews and evaluates data to ascertain loan viability and identifies all potential lending risks including potential fraud.    Assists with the timely and efficient movement of all loans in the underwriting pipeline, ensuring that all internal guidelines, regulatory timelines and requirements are met.  Conducts credit analysis relative to home loan applicants, verifying borrower's credit, assets and employment history. Reviews appraisal report on property evaluating property condition, sales price, etc.  Underwrites mortgage loans in accordance with portfolio guidelines, following the Bank’s credit policy, in a timely and accurate manner.  Issues Adverse Action Notices when applicable denying unqualified applications and reviews financial situations for counteroffer opportunities.  Ability to evaluate and analyze complex income documentation to establish accurate qualifying income to evidence the borrower’s ability to repay.    Thorough understanding of state and federal regulations is required as well as a solid understanding of HMDA, Reg Z, Reg B, rules and processes.   Assists branch managers and branch employees in resolving customer issues.  Maintains ongoing communication with senior management and department heads to ensure issues, application changes and/or other important information are properly communicated.   Provides input on new or existing underwriting processes and procedures.    Maintains underwriting exception report.   Assesses underwriting program effectiveness and provides input for improvement.   Completes continuing education through company and/or industry sponsored classes or seminars.    Contributes to a positive work environment by maintaining courteous, respectful and effective interaction, teamwork and communication with all employees and customers of the bank.  Ability to work from home, if required.    Performs related and unrelated duties as may be required or requested.  The above is a description of the ordinary duties of the position. It should be expected that from time to time, other duties both related and unrelated to the above may be assigned and therefore required.      Qualifications:    Associate’s degree or its equivalent in specialized lending coursework or training and MHP One Mortgage familiarity are all a plus but not required. At least two years’ experience in mortgage underwriting is preferred. Must have strong organizational, analytical and customer service skills.  Must possess at least intermediate technology skills, including knowledge of word processing, database and spreadsheet applications. Must be a self-starter with the ability to work in a fast pace environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills are a must.    General Office Environment.  The physical demands listed are typical of those an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. We may make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform those duties. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk, see, hear, read, write, walk, sit, stand, stoop, kneel or bend; reach with hands and arms; use office equipment such as computer, telephone, calculator, and fax machine. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.  For more information on Century Bank or to apply, please visit our website at www.centurybank.com.  Century Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Mortgage Loan Closer
Description: Founded locally in 1969 by Marshall M. Sloane, Century Bank is New England's largest family‐run bank with 27 branches throughout Greater Boston. Today Century Bank is the Bank families and businesses rely on -- a place where you can count on getting personal attention. Whether you need a free checking account, easy online banking or a sophisticated financial solution, you'll find it at Century Bank. For more information, visit www.CenturyBank.com. Currently, we are searching for enthusiastic individuals to join the Century team!   Job overview:  The focus of the Mortgage Loan Closer is to coordinate loan closings for purchase and refinance mortgages, home equity lines/loans and HEAT loans in compliance with industry and banking regulations and standards. Responsibilities:   This individual will be responsible for the accurate preparation and reconciliation of legal documents such as TRID disclosures, the initial and final Closing Disclosure in accordance with all State and Federal guidelines as well as bank’s policies and procedures as stated in the Bank’s credit policy manual.    Responsible for creating residential loan closing packages and conducting a final review of the file and closing documents for accuracy. Also responsible for coordinating closing dates with settlement agents and bank attorneys, preparing closing figures, and ensuring the funding of all loans.  Responsible for managing closing calendar along with daily CD and Post Closing reports.  Entering loan data completely and correctly into the loan operating system ensuring all required disclosures and documentation generated are accurate and complete.  Maintain loan files, ensuring that they are complete and in compliance including but not limited to; regulatory compliance forms & disclosures, regulatory testing, and insurance requirements, which may include flood, hazard, PMI, etc.  Confirm that a title search was properly executed and title is in good order.  Obtain verbal verification of employment and loan review within 10 days of closing on all files that require PMI.  Maintain working knowledge of the bank’s policies and procedures. Maintain a working knowledge of the bank’s loan origination system (LOS) and interfaces. Address concerns with uploads and upgrades.  Monitor, follow up and provide missing file data and documents to ensure that all loan files meet with regulatory guidelines.  Prepare applicable general ledger tickets and wire transfer information to ensure timely funding of loans.  Prepare monthly reports for delivery to Senior Management.    Responsible for the accounting of loan proceeds, approval of the disbursement of monies upon review of required items and arrangement of the funding of all loans closed.    Uphold the bank's customer service standards by providing exceptional customer service and timely responses in support of internal and external customers.    Ability to work independently and harmoniously with others in a fast-paced environment.   Well-developed verbal and written communication skills.    Solid computer skills including Outlook, Microsoft Word, and Excel applications.   Attention to detail and ability to meet strict deadlines.   Assume additional responsibilities as required or requested by management.    Ability to work efficiently from home, if required.      Qualifications:    Minimum high school diploma or general education degree (GED) required. Minimum 2-3 year of previous experience as a loan funder or closer preferred but would be willing to train the right person with previous industry experience. Must be able to work independently or as part of a team in a high- paced environment. Working knowledge of MS Office skills required.   General Office Environment.  The physical demands listed are typical of those an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. We may make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform those duties. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk, see, hear, read, write, walk, sit, stand, stoop, kneel or bend; reach with hands and arms; use office equipment such as computer, telephone, calculator, and fax machine. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.  For more information on Century Bank or to apply, please visit our website at www.centurybank.com.  Century Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Junior Items Processing Analyst
Description: Founded locally in 1969 by Marshall M. Sloane, Century Bank is New England's largest family‐run bank with 27 branches throughout Greater Boston. Today Century Bank is the Bank families and businesses rely on -- a place where you can count on getting personal attention. Whether you need a free checking account, easy online banking or a sophisticated financial solution, you'll find it at Century Bank. For more information, visit www.CenturyBank.com. Currently, we are searching for enthusiastic individuals to join the Century team!   Job overview:   Under the direction of the Items Processing Systems Analyst, this individual will help support the Items Processing applications and operations. Responsibilities:   Perform and Monitor the daily backups and replication for all Items Processing applications utilizing Veeam and CommVault.  Application support for 150+ devices in mixed virtual and physical environment.  Application server system administration.  Active Directory for application user and computer management  Assist with testing patches based on priorities consistent with bank policy and within system maintenance windows.  Research and resolve Deluxe application vulnerabilities within the system maintenance windows.  Provide exception reporting and conduct monthly analysis related to application activity.  Assist in disaster recovery testing and business continuity planning including the development and maintenance of applicable policies and procedures.  Help support the Systems Analyst with various task and duties.  On call backup support  Monitor and or ensure compliance with federal and state laws and regulations including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act and Anti Money laundering, in addition to, bank operating policies and procedures.  Perform other duties as assigned.    Qualifications:    MCSE/MCITP/MCP or equivalent with 3 to 5 years Windows 2008 / 2012 /2016 administration including systems builds, repairs, and performance tuning selection.  Knowledge of application security best practices.  Experience using diagnostic utilities and conducting performance tuning on both virtual and physical servers.  Experience developing and implementing operation policies and procedures for replication and backup tasks, system operations and security.  Ability to work independently and as a team member.  Knowledge and / or Experience in the following:   Experience in researching and resolving application vulnerability findings.  Strong working knowledge of Active Directory Management.  Experience with monitoring health status and upgrades.  Operating knowledge of Microsoft SQL server 2008 to 2018.  Familiarity with Microsoft Visio and Project, PowerShell, VBScripts and other scripting technologies.  This position requires organizational skills with attention to detail as well as effective verbal and written communication skills to perform the various administrative tasks. Understanding and articulating the risk associated with application maintenance and its impact on the production environment of Operations. Continuous advances in technology necessitate the ability to research developments and learn new technologies. Financial services industry experience is beneficial. Title: Data Science Fellowship
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=bosdata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: SEEKING A SYSTEMS INTEGRATION OR PROCESS ANALYST
Description: Freedom Mortgage is hiring a Remote Senior Software Engineer! Freedom Mortgage is a privately held, full-service residential mortgage lender licensed in all 50 states, Washington D.C., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. We are one of the largest and fastest-growing privately held mortgage companies in the country, as well as a top 5 residential lender in the USA. And we are continuing to grow! Freedom Mortgage is proud to offer a variety of benefits with this role including:  Competitive compensation! 100% work from home role A strong team environment that prides themselves on quality loans Great training opportunities And so much more!  Job Responsibilities We are looking for a self-motivated hands-on Software Engineer to play a key role with a primary focus on enterprise wide Document Automation initiatives. This individual will have passion for technology and exception skills leading and developing applications/platforms using Cloud Technologies.  Responsible for leading a development team of contractors and employee Defines system solutions based on user/client needs, cost, and required integration with existing applications, systems, or platforms Works with Enterprise Architecture team and assists in development of policies for standardizing systems, development tools and security practices Provides expertise and guidance for the design, development, implementation, and sustainment of IT solutions that enhance overall system performance and availability Provide technical knowledge and analysis of high-level functional systems analysis, design, and integration advice on complex matters that require expert level knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation Lead development of various initiatives using but not limited to AWS Services, cognitive capabilities, n tier architecture using J2EE frameworks, containers such as Kubernetes Responsible for architecting and deploying cloud-native applications onto Amazon Web Services (AWS) or similar Identifying requirements, researching options, designing and implementing solutions at a leadership level for the application included in the portfolio  Job Requirements  5+ years of hands on experience developing applications using J2EE, Spring Frameworks, RDBMS such as Oracle, MS SQL Server Experience working with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB Extensive understanding and experience programming and designing software using Angular JS/ReactJS, Tomcat and AWS cloud services (AWS Machine Learning services, Serverless technologies), container technologies such as Docker Experience in implementing and overseeing cloud computing strategy, and cloud deployment, operations, maintenance, and troubleshooting Experience developing applications using Microservices Architecture Experience developing and integrating RESTful APIs Experience in application performance monitoring using enterprise tool Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines, test automation, multi-variant testing BS or higher in Computer Science or related technology field

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: Freedom Marketing (www.freedomdam.com) is looking for full-time software engineers to help build and maintain digital marketing solutions for our clients. As an Adobe Business Partner, Freedom Marketing implements Adobe Experience Manager and related digital marketing tools for primarily U.S.-based corporate clients.   As a member of our technology practice, we want to provide you with a learning opportunity, the ability to see your work have an impact for our clients, and plenty of room to grow with our company.  We are headquartered in Arlington, VA with locations in Chicago, Atlanta, and Tempe but are open to applicants across the U.S., as we have a distributed team.  ABOUT YOU: We aren’t looking for someone who knows a lot about everything we do. While that would be great, we’re realistic about the chances of that happening (almost zero)! Instead, we’re looking for someone who: • Has a working knowledge of the following major technologies: Java/J2EE, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, including at least 1 framework (e.g. JQuery, Angular). NOTE: Candidates without solid Java experience will not be considered. • Is familiar with modern IDEs and Debuggers (We use JetBrains products – IntelliJ, primarily) • Is familiar with Git or Mercurial source control. • Has good verbal and written communication skills. As a remote employee, your ability to effectively communicate is critical. • Can effectively manage their time without suffocating oversight. We value people who can handle responsibility and want to be given the flexibility to do their job. • Knows how to learn and is eager to do so. • Can travel for client and company meetings (once safe to do so). This won’t be frequent, and we’ll give you plenty of notice. • Lives in the United States.  ABOUT US: Freedom Marketing is a Digital Asset Management focused consultancy whose goal is to enable our customers to more efficiently generate marketing creative materials to grow their business. We partner with Adobe to implement marketing technologies to meet that goal.  We have a small team of dedicated professionals and we’re growing rapidly. Within the company, we’re focused on hiring great people and letting them do good work in a relaxed environment. With our clients, we’re focused on developing long-term relationships and delivering solutions that meet their needs.  We offer solid compensation, good vacation/sick/holiday policies, and great benefits (various health-related insurances, short- and long-term disability, 401k with company match, etc).   TO APPLY: If you would like to apply for this position, please respond to this post with your resume, links to any open-source contributions you’ve made, and the best time(s) to discuss the position over the next week.  We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Mid-Level Full Stack Engineer (J2EE)
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area.  We are looking for developers who want to engage in challenging projects in futuristic technology, software development, and much more within a variety of sectors such as financial, health care, energy and federal.  Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C.  We will provide on the job training after you are hired.  **We have a continued investment in motivated, passionate individuals like you who strive to move forward in their careers through apprenticeship programs like Smoothstack. Please be aware we have modified our training so that we can continue to offer our apprenticeship program remotely until the CDC deems it appropriate to work in shared office spaces. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

Title: Entry Level - Software Developer
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=phnxdata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Earn $$$ from home - Pixel phone tester
Compensation: 45,000 on average in your first placement
Description: Looking to start a new career in tech? Want a new job making over $40,000/year in just a few months for $0 upfront? We're here to help. Merit America is a nonprofit organization offering working adults without Bachelor’s degrees an opportunity to transform their careers with no upfront cost. Learn more and apply here. Application deadline is May 1st.  Past Merit America graduates in new roles have had a 70% wage increase. As Robert, a recent Merit America graduate, said in the NYTimes: “It’s the American dream stuff that didn’t seem feasible for me until now.”   👉Here are some of the benefits of our programs: ✅$0 upfront cost. You’re only responsible for payment if you land a job with a $40,000 annual salary or higher. No questions asked. ✅Flexible & part-time. Courses are designed for working, busy adults. Classes take 15-20 hours per week for 14 weeks. ✅Get skills employers want. We've identified the specific skills you need to get a new career in tech. ✅On-going career services. Merit America offers coaching, career services, and connections to local employers, all focused on helping you get a new job in tech. ✅Quick & easy application.  It takes just 5 minutes to submit your online application. No Bachelor's degree is required.  You can read about us in The New York Times or CNBC, or watch one of our graduate’s success stories featured by Grow with Google.   This is your chance, and you’re ready.   🚨Apply today🚨 FAQs  How long does the application take? The initial application takes no more than 5 minutes.  When does the program start? The next cohort begins in May, 2021. Applications will be accepted until May 1st, 2021.  What are the applicant requirements to be accepted for this training? - Applicants must have a high school diploma or GED, but no Bachelor’s degree. While those with Associate’s degrees are welcome to apply, those with a Bachelor’s degree or who are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program are not eligible unless your graduation date was over 5 years ago and you're currently unemployed or underemployed. - You are a fluent English speaker, reader, and writer. - You are authorized to work in the U.S. and able to pass a background and reference check. - You are savvy using modern technology with consistent internet access through your personal devices or nearby public spaces (e.g., libraries, coffee shops).  Is there an age limit? We do not have an age limit and welcome all adults with a GED or High School diploma to apply.  What type of IT jobs are graduates qualified for? Graduates will have the business and technology skills to pursue rewarding careers as IT support professionals. Specific job titles include: Help Desk Technician, Computer User Support Specialist, Computer Network Support Specialist, Technology Coordinator, and more.  Am I guaranteed a job? Merit America cannot guarantee employment. Graduates who are not offered a position will receive support from Merit America to identify other career opportunities leveraging their new skills. Merit America coaches and employer placement teams work with each graduate to support their job placement goals.

Title: 📈Become an IT Specialist & Transform Your Career with Merit America
Description: MUST ATTACH RESUME AND PROVIDE CONTACT INFORMATION FOR US TO GET BACK IN TOUCH WITH YOU.  THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION....  We are hiring a Systems Engineer who has a web development background. Candidates must have 7-10 years’ experience and a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. This position is located on-site in North Las Vegas, NV.  Systems Engineer Responsibilities: • Lead and participate in various IT initiatives and organizational projects • Design, implement, monitor and maintain a comprehensive IT environment • Ensure the high availability of LAN/WAN system resources (desktops, servers, storage, appliances) • Provide effective design and administration of core systems hardware/software and related infrastructure  Web Developer Responsibilities: • Build and maintain websites, web apps, and/or features from specifications • Write responsive web markup using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript that is cross-browser compatible • Collaborate with the internal Graphics Department to assist in UI & UX design and create standardized policies to ensure future websites meet technical requirements • Use and troubleshoot SSH/SFTP, FTP connections using a Security Key • Maintain and update Social Media platforms for each property  Systems Engineer Qualifications: • Proficient knowledge of object-oriented programming (OOP) • Experience administering network infrastructure such as desktops, physical/virtual servers, wireless and physical networking, hardware and software installations. • VMware ESXi 6.x infrastructure design and administration • SAN/NAS storage design and administration • Cisco network infrastructure administration • Microsoft Windows Desktop, Office, Windows Server (administration, clustering, IIS, DHCP, DNS/WINS, DFS, Group Policy, WSUS) • MCSC or MCITP certification  Web Developer Qualifications: • Proficient knowledge of PHP (5+) is a requirement • Proficient knowledge of MySQL (5+) is a requirement • Experience with CSS pre-processing scripts including SASS and LESS • Experience with asynchronous request handling using AJAX • We are migrating to the following server software: Docker, Apache (2.x), PHP (7.4), MySQL (8.0.21), PHPMyAdmin for MySQL 8.x • We are migrating to the following backend software: Docker, Composer (1.9.1), Laravel (7.x), Node.js / NPM (6.14.6), Webpack (4.43.0), and Vue (2.5.17)

Title: Systems Engineer/Web Developer/No Contract Work + Benefits
Compensation: Hourly compensation will be offered for work performed.  Room for advancement to salary and benefits.
Description: We are looking for a talented person capable of handling schedules, basic writing and proof reading, taking notes and assigning tasks to responsible associates.  Write letters, research businesses, send out meeting invites, etc.  This position will advance into a permanent position within the ranks of management.  Please help us understand your capabilities such as software programs you have used, tasks that you have successfully completed, your past job and educational experiences.  Please highlight your hourly rate requirements and the hours and times you’d be interested in working daily, weekly and monthly.  we look forward to learning more about you.

Title: Management assistant - virtual
Compensation: $25 per hour to start but once FT will convert to base salary plus commission
Description: National Mobile App development company looking for candidates that have experience in project management or sales with a software/technical background being a huge plus. We are starting a training program that will start off as part time, approx 20 hour per week, working remote from home and may last anywhere from 30-90 days. Once succesfully completing the program, the position will become full-time and will cover the Mesa and surrounding region for our client base. The Project Manager duties are:   Managing project development from initiation to closure  Understand the scope of the project, identify the project participants, and keep updated contact information  Evaluate the progress of the project to ensure that the timeline is followed steadily and consistently  Effectively manage project scope by ensuring any changes to scope are documented and approved with project change request form  Understand and evaluate the project Architecture  Track and report on project milestones and provide status reports to client  Collaborate with the lead architect, developers, business analysts and company executives in order to determine the software's technical direction, system design and implementation plan  Provide input into strategic planning, wire framing and asset creation processes  Embrace the role of researcher, anticipating that at some point in the project, you will have to investigate some element that is vital to its culmination   Make recommendations to team about schedules, prioritization and resource allocation with input from team members  Develop tools and best practices for project management and execution  Assisting team in design and development tasks creating test plans and testing efforts  Providing independent advice to the team on the management of projects  Organizing the various professional people working on a project  Work on MS Project outlining scope, goals, deliverables, budget and timing  Complete work breakdown structure to estimate effort required for each task  Clearly communicate expectations to team members and client  Making sure that all the aims of the project are met and making sure the quality standards are met  Prefer basic software architecture and development knowledge  Bachelors Degree is preferred, but prior experience as a PM, Software Developer or Software Sales will be considered as a substitute.

Title: Project Manager
Description: Summary  Positive Technology is looking for a great candidate to fulfill an immediate direct hire position.  Potential candidates will need to have some experience in enterprise applications utilizing Quality Assurance toolsets. Additional requirements include a thorough understanding of SQL and the ability to create and manage test scripts. The projects you’ll be assigned to include current Point-of-Sale product offerings as well as custom development projects.  As a quality assurance team member, you'll be required to lead meetings, execute and manage team goals, and report to superiors on team issues and timelines.  Positive Technology is a great place to work with flexible hours and a very relaxed, casual atmosphere.  While temporarily remote, this is an on-site position, working out of our North Scottsdale office.  Requirements  1) Minimum 2 years of QA Experience  2) Minimum 3 year of test case writing & management  3) Minimum 1 years of Microsoft SQL experience  Nice to Haves  1) Test Automation  2) Point-Of-Sale experience  3) Mobile Testing experience  4) Web App Testing  5) Web Services Experience  Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Quality Analyst
Description: Job description FULL TIME WORK ONLY  About Ylopo  Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company, leading in the U.S. for Real Estate digital marketing on Facebook. Using Dynamic Ads, big data, catalogs and APIs, Ylopo runs campaigns at scale for successful real estate clients nationally. With this cutting-edge technology, Ylopo can provide seamless internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to our clients. We have over 1,000 real estate clients and generate over 1MM+ leads annually. We are also proud to share that Facebook themselves have completed three case studies on our technology and are actively working on a fourth.  Why work for Ylopo?  At Ylopo we offer our team members:  - A commitment to personal development and happiness in your role. - Guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company. - Excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts. - Team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and work from home Fridays. - A supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.   Overview:  The Website Support Jr Team Lead is responsible for managing the branded site experience of new and existing clients. The Junior Team Lead will supervise non-client-facing branded sites team members, including Web Specialists and Quality Assurance Analysts.  The Junior Team Lead is also responsible for managing the processes associated with branded sites project management, including new site builds, site edits, and at times, custom design work. The Website Support Jr Team Lead will report to the Manager of Onboarding & Implementations, and will work closely with other members of CS Leadership, including the VP of Operations, CTO, billing, product, and sales teams.  Candidates with Team Lead experience are strongly desired, this is a lead role and so we are accepting non-technical resumes with experience in building SOPs, Creating team/individual KPIs, process oriented and strong organizational skills. Candidates with experience reporting team metrics to an executive team and being able to redirect goals as needed, also desired.   Requirements:   - Undergraduate degree preferred - Previous experience in an Account Management, Project Management, Product Management, or Web Design Role - Operational mindset with technical ability to learn and understand complex processes/concepts and adjust as needed. - Ability to understand and convey detailed information about our services and systems - Ability to take the initiative and see projects and tasks through to completion - Ability to effectively manage a team of both US and Manila team members - Ability to multitask, and work independently toward deadlines - Experience with Squarespace, web design, CSS/HTML, or Digital Marketing/SEO a plus, but not necessary - Understanding of real estate and the real estate profession a plus, but not necessary - Management experience a plus, but not necessary - Positive demeanor, trustworthy and professional character - Strong written and verbal communication skills - Strong attention to detail  Responsibilities:  - Supervise branded sites team members and manage their performance and goals, including conducting regular check-ins, and performance reviews. - Develop processes to improve efficiencies within the branded sites team, with regard to project management, site creation, site edits, and custom design work - Develop strategies to hit team KPIs - Track and manage team and goals and effectively communicate progress and metrics to executive leadership - Serve as the client-facing point of escalation for issues related to branded sites - Help complete tickets, requests, and other tasks as needed to support branded sites team members - Work closely with the training team to ensure accurate, updated branded sites training resources are available to clients and other internal departments - Attend weekly CS Team Leadership meetings and contribute to the success of the overarching CS team and company goals - Work closely with leadership in other departments to ensure a cohesive and high quality customer experience across the board and to ensure the branded sites product is well incorporated into the Ylopo Product Suite as a whole. - Help with interviewing and hiring and training new branded sites team members   Salary: 50-55K DOE   Location: Remote to start, will be in-person in Phoenix once we are cleared to return to in-office setting.

Title: Website Support Jr Team Lead
Description: Job description  About Ylopo  Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company, leading in the U.S. for Real Estate digital marketing on Facebook. Using Dynamic Ads, big data, catalogs and APIs, Ylopo runs campaigns at scale for successful real estate clients nationally. With this cutting-edge technology, Ylopo can provide seamless internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to our clients. We have over 1,000 real estate clients and generate over 1MM+ leads annually. We are also proud to share that Facebook themselves have completed three case studies on our technology and are actively working on a fourth.  Why work for Ylopo?  At Ylopo we offer our team members:  - A commitment to personal development and happiness in your role. - Guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company. - Excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts. - Team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and work from home Fridays. - A supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.  The Branded Sites Account Manager is responsible for managing the branded site experience of new and existing clients.  The Account Manager will work closely with both new clients going through an initial branded site development project and existing clients going through site edits or custom design projects.  The Account Manager will work closely with other members of the Branded Sites Team to ensure project milestones are completed timely and accurately.  Team members well-suited to this role will have a track record of being client-focused and providing exceptional service, both internally and externally within an organization. They will have excellent communication skills through email and over the phone. Candidates should be tech-savvy, quick-thinking, detail-oriented, and able to keep clients on task with branded sites projects through clear, proactive communication.    Requirements:  - Undergraduate degree preferred - Previous experience in a project management, account management, or client services role - Operational mindset, and ability to understand complex processes and make adjustments as needed - Technical ability and ability to learn and understand complex concepts - Professional manner - Consistent work habits and strong work ethic - Ability to multitask, and work independently toward deadlines - Strong attention to detail - Strong written and verbal communication skills - Positive demeanor, trustworthy character - Ability to take the initiative and see projects and tasks through to completion - Ability to understand and convey detailed information about our services and systems - Understanding of real estate and the real estate profession a plus, but not necessary - Experience with Squarespace, web design, CSS/HTML, or Digital Marketing/SEO a plus, but not necessary - PMP certification desired, but not necessary   Responsibilities:  - Work directly with new and existing clients to manage branded sites projects, including new site builds, site edits, and custom site designs - Communicate with clients, via email, phone, and Zoom - Respond to clients in a timely manner - Proactively follow up with all clients with open projects/items - Support Sales and CS teams in creation of client's Branded Website Statement of Work - Manage clients expectations pro-actively to scope of work defined and billable policies - Develop excellent client relationships that aid in overall client retention - Assign and follow up on action items to internal branded sites team members to ensure projects are completed timely and accurately - Serve as a point of contact for clients with mild escalations related to branded sites and work with Branded Sites Team Lead to ensure resolution - Work closely with Onboarding and Account Management teams to ensure clients are supported - Collaborate with sales, billing, marketing, international, and technical teams on special projects  Applicants for this position must be located in Phoenix, AZ. This role is currently fully remote due to current events, but normally is located at an office in central Phoenix and offers one day per week work from home and semi-flexible schedules. Some small amount of long distance travel may be required for training, client events, or meetings at company headquarters.  Compensation and full benefits include starting pay in the $46K-52K range depending on experience; medical, dental, and vision benefits; paid holidays, vacation, and sick days; option to contribute to a 401(k); paid monthly parking (if applicable); and an extremely nice, supportive group of people as your co-workers.

Title: Account Manager - Branded Sites
Description: We are a small but well-established 25 year plus company developing applications for first responders. We have an in-office 75% of the time position for a c#, .NET, SQL application developer. Seeking someone with over 4 years of experience. Ideal candidates can participate in sprint/wireframe meetings and excel in an iterative development environment. We do have an offshore team as well and we tag teams on work on a daily basis. This position is only w2 salaried with benefits. Outsourced or contract will not be considered.

Title: .net c# SQL  Application Developer
Description: Freedom Mortgage is hiring a Remote Senior Software Engineer! Freedom Mortgage is a privately held, full-service residential mortgage lender licensed in all 50 states, Washington D.C., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. We are one of the largest and fastest-growing privately held mortgage companies in the country, as well as a top 5 residential lender in the USA. And we are continuing to grow! Freedom Mortgage is proud to offer a variety of benefits with this role including:  Competitive compensation! 100% work from home role A strong team environment that prides themselves on quality loans Great training opportunities And so much more!  Job Responsibilities We are looking for a self-motivated hands-on Software Engineer to play a key role with a primary focus on enterprise wide Document Automation initiatives. This individual will have passion for technology and exception skills leading and developing applications/platforms using Cloud Technologies.  Responsible for leading a development team of contractors and employee Defines system solutions based on user/client needs, cost, and required integration with existing applications, systems, or platforms Works with Enterprise Architecture team and assists in development of policies for standardizing systems, development tools and security practices Provides expertise and guidance for the design, development, implementation, and sustainment of IT solutions that enhance overall system performance and availability Provide technical knowledge and analysis of high-level functional systems analysis, design, and integration advice on complex matters that require expert level knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation Lead development of various initiatives using but not limited to AWS Services, cognitive capabilities, n tier architecture using J2EE frameworks, containers such as Kubernetes Responsible for architecting and deploying cloud-native applications onto Amazon Web Services (AWS) or similar Identifying requirements, researching options, designing and implementing solutions at a leadership level for the application included in the portfolio  Job Requirements  5+ years of hands on experience developing applications using J2EE, Spring Frameworks, RDBMS such as Oracle, MS SQL Server Experience working with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB Extensive understanding and experience programming and designing software using Angular JS/ReactJS, Tomcat and AWS cloud services (AWS Machine Learning services, Serverless technologies), container technologies such as Docker Experience in implementing and overseeing cloud computing strategy, and cloud deployment, operations, maintenance, and troubleshooting Experience developing applications using Microservices Architecture Experience developing and integrating RESTful APIs Experience in application performance monitoring using enterprise tool Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines, test automation, multi-variant testing BS or higher in Computer Science or related technology field

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: HiringThing is looking for a Software Engineer to focus on growing our Rails and React-based applicant tracking software platform. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions, and development priorities.  We practice continuous integration and deploy on-demand throughout the day.  Your primary focus will be developing our hiring platform but you'll also spend some time with test automation, API development, front-end React development, and infrastructure automation.Requirements Minimum 2 years of Ruby on RailsFamiliarity with modern Rails best practicesExperience with database-driven web applications (SQL)Some experience working with ES6 and modern front-end web frameworksIndependent work ethicFully remote workspace experience preferred Strong communication skillsParticipation in a triage engineering rotation and an on call engineering rotationTechnologies in Play Ruby on Rails MySQLReact (Webpack, ES6)Amazon Web ServicesTerraformDockerCompensation/Benefits401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursementAbility to work remotelyComprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesOpportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the CompanyUnlimited PTO policyOpportunity for professional development 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employeesParticipation in employee stock option planAbout HiringThingHiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.We’ve been a fully remote company since day 1 so we know how how to work in a virtual office across multiple time zones. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. You can work from home, your porch, or the beach as long as the work gets done.We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take a vacation, take time off for illness, and shift schedules as necessary.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/249152/rails-engineer-remote?s=cl

Title: Software Developer
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek Institute of Technology certified to operate in Virginia by State Council of Higher Education for Virginia (SCHEV). We are an AWS Academy Accredited Member Institution.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-a-015ca-sp21-tickets-149699534337

Title: Start Your New IT Career Today
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: We are a $4 Billion (assets) company, with a strong capital and income position with 23 years of history, operates in the US and Canada while based out of a home office in McLean, Virginia.  The company is the largest in its core business, owning and leasing auto dealership real estate.  With a 7.5 year history originally on NASDAQ, and since 2005 under private equity ownership, the company plans to add to its current business with an additional industry focus.  The company’s executive team averages over 15 years together, and the 35 team members average over 6 years working together.  The successful candidate is a creative problem solver who can develop and modify our Salesforce platform to optimize our operational efficiency. If you enjoy a fast paced, collaborative team environment, with impactful projects that are essential to our company’s success, this is the perfect role for you!     Reports to: SVP Director of Portfolio Management Primary Activities: Salesforce  Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce environment for all CARS Users Ensure the integrity of the data within salesforce including periodic uploads of company data Handle all administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine tasks to include pipeline, LOI tracking and other ad hoc reporting as requested Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for upgrades Manage Salesforce data feeds and other integrations Oversee continual development of the Salesforce environment to optimize the system for CARS.  Coordinate the evaluation, scope and completion of new development requests Train new users, increase engagement, and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization Ensure assigned Salesforce seconds are adequately trained to support and act as backup to administrator  Navigator (Crowe Portfolio Analyzer)  Serve as primary system administrator for Crowe Portfolio Analyzer (Navigator/CPAL) environment  Maintain CPAL system and make live updates as needed to attributes, entities, credit group hierarchy structure, document submission settings and covenant alerts (LCRs). Set-up new entities for underwriting acquisitions Set-up/Add new internal users (CARS employees) to CPAL system and set up/add/maintain external financial statement customer portals for document submission Build and maintain portfolio reporting for CARS stores/peer data (new feature) and develop/build new reports as necessary, including ad-hoc reports for credit tapes, investor reports, brand/portfolio exposure reports Develop and maintain Quarterly Credit Review reports and trackers (RCR chart, Covenant exception report, financial statement tracking) In coordination with CAD department, optimize system/identify functionalities to enhance usefulness of CPAL and work directly with the Crowe team through weekly calls to make enhancements and resolve any system issues submitted through the CARS Support Portal.  Manage Navigator cases in Salesforce At the direction of CAD develop custom calculations and performance alerts to focus credit reviews on the highest risk accounts   Technology  Support the information needs of all CARS users Develop continuity among all CARS’ information systems utilizing Salesforce as the hub Serve as one of the inhouse SMEs for our office technology such as projecting to the TV screens, web video conferencing, etc.    Requirements:    Work Experience: Advanced experience working with Salesforce/Navigator/database preferred Technical competencies:  Strong knowledge with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams and OneNote or equivalent is required.  Specifically, the applicant must have the ability within these programs to create charts, ad hoc reports, and master templates.  Strong organizational, time management and written and oral communication skills  Please apply through this posting only -- do not call or email us.  As the first company solely focused on providing highly tailored sale-leaseback capital to the automotive retail industry, Capital Automotive has exclusively supported automobile dealers since 1997. The company’s stock was publicly traded on NASDAQ through December of 2005 when we completed a privatization with DRA Advisors LLC.  In October 2014, Capital Automotive was acquired by Brookfield Property Partners and its institutional partners. Through custom tailored real estate finance, we have assisted dealer groups in growing their organizations, acquiring new locations, upgrading existing facilities, constructing new stores, and facilitating estate planning and partner buyouts. In many situations, we have aided dealers by maximizing liquidity and flexibility. Our creation was a collaboration of automobile dealers and experts in real estate, and finance. Since inception, our team of professionals has developed and maintained relationships throughout the industry that have provided us with an in-house level of expertise unparalleled in the marketplace. By listening to our clients and prospects, we continue to add new products and tailor existing products to better serve the auto retail industry.

Title: Information Software Administrator
Description: Background The mission of the National Weather Service (NWS), an agency within the Department of Commerce's National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is to provide weather, water and climate forecasts and warnings for the United States, its territories, and its adjacent waters and oceans to protect life and property and to enhance the national economy. The Weather and Climate Infrastructure Services (WCCIS) contract supports the NWS's Central Processing and Information Dissemination portfolios. The contract is managed by the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) Central Operations (NCO).  WCCIS supports NCO's mission which is to deliver national and global weather, water, climate and space weather guidance, forecasts, warnings and analyses to a broad range of users and partners. These products and services respond to user needs to protect life and property, enhance the nation's economy, and support the nation's growing need for environmental information.  Position Description Will perform development in support of NOAA's National Weather Service (NWS). Will primarily support the Model Guidance and Analyses (MAG) project. The full stack consists mostly of PHP and PERL. May contribute using other various languages such as C++, Python, NCL, and Java using both OOP and functional programming paradigms. Will participate in both unit testing and full integrated system testing. Applications will include standard software tools and/or services for decoding, calculation and display of scientific data including satellite, radar, observational, numerical forecast models, and forecast products; for creating and editing graphical products; and to transform such graphics into alternative data formats such as BUFR, GRIB, GIF, and agency-specified formats. Specific activities will include:  Bug fixing and developing new products as requested by the product owner Integrating, testing, and supporting software developed by other centers or development partners Maintaining the software test environment to support migration activities, including auto-builds of stand-alone executables on servers and simulation of user operations.  Required Skills 1 + years of experience with PHP, Perl, and writing code in one or more programming or scripting languages. Must have experience with PHP and Perl. Must also be able to:  Document code so other developers can understand and contribute to it. Fix bugs in existing projects. Review colleagues' code. Meet with designers, developers, and project staff for progress updates. Contribute to implementing an agile product development environment. Effectively communicate technical information and work status accurately and reliably to project leads and managers. Desired   Experience with Jira and Confluence. Experience with Git and GitLab CI/CD. Experience in AGILE development. Background in Meteorology (or other Physical Sciences). Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident and be able to pass a background investigation to obtain a security badge to enter the applicable government facility.  Education BS in computer science, physics, meteorology, related discipline, or equivalent.  Submit resume to ERT’s Career Opportunities Web Page at: https://phh.tbe.taleo.net/phh04/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=ERT&cws=49&rid=2572  Earth Resources Technology, Inc. (ERT) ERT is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer - All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Title: Junior Software Developer
Description: Background The mission of the National Weather Service (NWS), an agency within the Department of Commerce's National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is to provide weather, water and climate forecasts and warnings for the United States, its territories, and its adjacent waters and oceans to protect life and property and to enhance the national economy. The Weather and Climate Infrastructure Services (WCCIS) contract supports the NWS's Central Processing and Information Dissemination portfolios. The contract is managed by the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) Central Operations (NCO).  WCCIS supports NCO's mission which is to deliver national and global weather, water, climate and space weather guidance, forecasts, warnings and analyses to a broad range of users and partners. These products and services respond to user needs to protect life and property, enhance the nation's economy, and support the nation's growing need for environmental information.  Position Description Will work directly with the software developers that are creating and delivering state of the art applications that support the US Weather-Ready Nation initiative. Will take their code and install, configure, test and troubleshoot the applications in a Test environment and then move the application to operations where you and the team will support any issues that arise. Will maintain, monitor, and support complex, mission-critical software systems in an operational 24x7 enterprise environment. Will develop Linux scripts to automate, monitor, and deploy system components. Will maintain large and complex program/system; analyze program logic and logistics; improve efficiency; prepare program documentation. Provide clear documentation and standard operating procedures for system tools. Will implement new systems and system upgrades into the production environment. Will provide trouble-shooting for any developed software running in the clustered environment. Provide off-hour, on-call support (on a rotating basis with team members). Will interact with system stakeholders to field questions on operational configuration, system performance and application support. Will support software testing and implementation including debugging, integration testing, and test reporting and documentation for application and associated scripts and codes in a real time, operational environment. You will be supporting the following applications:  RADAR and other weather data displayed via ArcGIS - https://nowcoast.noaa.gov/ Weather alerts to cell phones - (not a public site) Space Weather - https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/ Water Models and processing - https://water.noaa.gov/about/nwm Data Assimilation and distribution - https://madis.ncep.noaa.gov/ Next-Generation IT Web Services - https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gsd/ato/iwds/developmentefforts/NGITWS.html  In this role you will work with following applications and tools:  VMWARE and VCENTER NETAPP Storage RedHat 6,7,8 Puppet Python Java Bash Perl Foreman RabbitMQ Tomcat Apache Wildfly NGINX Postgres 9,10 MongoDB Redmine Git ServiceNow ArcGIS  Required Skills 6 - 10 years of experience with Linux/Unix operating systems and scripting including shell scripting, Perl, and/or Python. Must have working knowledge of procedural computer languages, such as FORTRAN, C/C++ and Python. Will need to be able to code monitoring scripts in bash and python and use your Linux skills to troubleshoot issues that occur while running in a virtualized environment. Requires the ability to integrate with our team and the flexibility to be on call for ~1 week each month. Must be comfortable with standard office tools (Office and/or the google suite). Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills  Desired Skills  Expert level knowledge of Unix/Linux operating environments Experience with scientific data dissemination and observation systems, especially in the NOAA/NASA/Defense environment Experience with weather operations, satellite operations, or numerical modeling principals Experience supporting a 24x7 mission-critical system Experience with change management tools such as Subversion, Bugzilla, Redmine, Git, Experience with monitoring tools such as Big Brother or Check_MK Experience with GIS and ESRI products Experience working in VMWARE Virtualized Linux environments. Requires a background in fundamental root cause analysis (troubleshooting) and the ability to articulate and describe a problem. Will work with developers, system administrators, and network engineers to develop logical and repeatable triage steps to determine why the problem occurred, and how it can be fixed and detected.  Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident and be able to pass a background investigation to obtain a security badge to enter the applicable government facility.  Education BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, related discipline, or equivalent.  Submit resume to ERT’s Career Opportunities Web Page at: https://phh.tbe.taleo.net/phh04/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=ERT&cws=49&rid=2607  Earth Resources Technology, Inc. (ERT) ERT is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer - All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Title: Software Engineer (Application Support)
Description: Background The mission of the National Weather Service (NWS), an agency within the Department of Commerce's National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is to provide weather, water and climate forecasts and warnings for the United States, its territories, and its adjacent waters and oceans to protect life and property and to enhance the national economy. The Weather and Climate Infrastructure Services (WCCIS) contract supports the NWS's Central Processing and Information Dissemination portfolios. The contract is managed by the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) Central Operations (NCO).  WCCIS supports NCO's mission which is to deliver national and global weather, water, climate and space weather guidance, forecasts, warnings and analyses to a broad range of users and partners. These products and services respond to user needs to protect life and property, enhance the nation's economy, and support the nation's growing need for environmental information.  Position Description Will support the installation, implementation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of agency wide-area networks (WANs) and local-area networks (LANs). Assist in designing and managing the WAN infrastructure and any processes related to the WAN. Provide Production Support of the Network, including: day-to-day operations, monitoring and problem resolution client Networks. Provide second level problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems. Support the dispatch of circuit and hardware vendors involved in the resolution process. Support the escalation and communication of status to agency management and internal customers.   Define, design, plan, and implement LAN/WAN infrastructure changes including cabling, switches, routers, and firewalls, Layer 2 and Layer 3 design, and network configurations. Operate and maintain all network hardware and software. Plan and execute network migrations, network OS upgrades, network hardware upgrades, firewall implementations and VPN installations. Provide in-house technical training to staff on a continuing basis. Monitor network activity including, but not limited to, network equipment health, data transfer rates, network connectivity, bandwidth consumption, and security intrusions. Create, maintain, and disseminate system documentation and Standard Operating Procedures for network maintenance activities. Monitor, troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve problems with Very Small Aperture Terminal (VSAT) satellite systems. Maintain and operate communication devices and services including Network Management tools, equipment and software, and telephone support lines (such as the 1-888-OPSnet line). Deliver monthly reports concerning network metrics including, but not limited to, network uptime statistics, bandwidth consumption, network link utilization, and outages for both network links and network equipment. Configure and operate CISCO Unified Communications server (Call Manager) in support of enterprise wide VOIP Phones and DVTCs. Configure Quality of Service (QOS) over a Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) network to support classes of service and voice/video traffic. Monitor system health and configurations in order to ensure system health and functionality as well as remediate issues. Provide the on-call and after hours support as required. Required Skills 4+ years of network engineering experience or related. Ability to work under general supervision. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures. Ability to provide technical oversight or supervision of others.   Desired Working knowledge in various software systems and architectures, communications protocols, and network hardware devices.  Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident and be able to pass a background investigation to obtain a security badge to enter the applicable government facility.  Education BS in Engineering, Computer Science, related discipline, or equivalent.  Submit resume to ERT’s Career Opportunities Web Page at: https://phh.tbe.taleo.net/phh04/ats/careers/v2/searchResults?org=ERT&cws=49  Earth Resources Technology, Inc. (ERT) ERT is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer - All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.
