Title: Product Management Fellowship
Description: Our client is a young rapidly growing real estate developer and operator specializing in multifamily and mixed use properties. Since their inception 10 years ago they have acquired and developed a multi-billion dollar portfolio that includes over 10,000 units in 20 states.    The Business Analyst is a newly created role on their IT team.  This person will report up to the VP, IT.  Responsibilities:  • Oversee and manage the implementation and continuing SAAS software project(S) primarily in the area of document management, expenses, travel, HR, IT support and SharePoint (Microsoft) systems • Work with the training department to design and create a training plan for all supported software • Work with communication department to develop and execute a communication plan for new software and releases • Manage projects to ensure that the project deliverables are on time and at the required level of quality. • Capture end-to-end business requirements, identify interdependencies, and ensure understanding and communicate those requirements to vendors for the creation of business requirement documents • Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems; publishing progress reports, and recommending actions • Lead and coordinate with vendors to perform system, integration and user testing and work with outside development to creates test scripts to ensure a clean product for new implementations and upgrades • Establish priorities which meet the project goals and objectives, and identify areas of improvement • Being a bridge between the client’s business needs and the technical capabilities. Orchestrate the collaboration between, Business Sponsors, SMEs, and Development groups by removing roadblocks and facilitating communication • Produce monthly status reports detailing technical tasks, progress of work accomplished, remaining tasks, outstanding problems, work planned for following month, along with other details are required for the project • Ensure usage of all systems and monthly report on user adoption • Oversee and manage all software functionality, report, bug and the request list • Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement • Understand business IT system functionality and integrations and how the systems support the business and integrate with each other • Become a trusted and valued partner of the system’s business stakeholders and client executives • Maintain strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products  Requirements:  The ideal candidate will have:  • 6+ years’ experience as a business analyst with project management duties as well • Customer focus orientation • Experience with document management, HR and Sharepoint implementations • Strong analytical skills, communication, presentation, and project management skills. • Six Sigma, Lean or related certification desired, but not required • Deadline driven and ability to meet deadlines • Experience in writing and executing testing scripts • Demonstrated ability to create requirement specifications and technical documentation • Experience prioritizing competing demands and obtaining buy-in from stakeholders • Demonstrated ability to manage and resolve conflict with stakeholders • Experience modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques • Demonstrated ability to understand and explain issues from both a technical and a business functional point of view • Excellent knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio) • Self-starter • Ability to perform multiple tasks and adjust priorities based on workload, management directives, and customer demands • Flexible management style; ability to quickly adapt to diverse and changing environments  Our client is based in Bethesda, Maryland.  Eventually, they would like candidates who could come into the office on a regular basis.  For now, the work will be remote, but they still want local candidates.  This is a full-time permanent employee position working directly for our client.  Salary is in the 100-120K range + bonus.    If this sounds like you, please respond with your Salary/Hourly rate requirements as soon as possible.  Please no telecommuters or agencies.  ================================================  About AAJ Interactive Technologies:  AAJ Interactive Technologies, established in 1997 by cutting-edge technology executives, is a technology professional-services company supplying project-based consulting, staff augmentation and recruiting services to leading firms throughout Metropolitan Washington, DC.  We work differently from most of our competition.  We have been in both a position of hiring, mentoring and managing large staffs inside a corporate culture, as well as consultants for hire.  This unique perspective allows us to understand both sides of this business.  We take the time to ensure our consultants/candidates placed will be successful.  We believe that because of our principals we have succeeded where others have failed.  The greater DC technology space can be full of companies that are not really looking out for your interests. Ask around, we’re not one of them!  We want you to succeed, and we’ll do everything we can to help you do just that!

environments  Our client is based in Bethesda, Maryland. Please no telecommuters or agencies.  ================================================  About AAJ Interactive Technologies:  AAJ Interactive Technologies, established in 1997 by cutting-edge technology executives, is a technology professional-services company supplying project-based consulting, staff augmentation and recruiting services to leading firms throughout Metropolitan Washington, DC.  We work differently from most of our competition.  We have been in both a position of hiring, mentoring and managing large staffs inside a corporate culture, as well as consultants for hire. Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: Senior Manger Document Review Services      Managed review teams assists organizations and their legal counsel by helping to improve the overall document review process. Our focus is on streamlining the review, improving accuracy, and creating cost savings through leading practices and workflows such as pre-and post-processing data culling, the use of predictive coding and other analytics, and providing real-time reporting.  In addition, as part of managed review, our experienced team of attorneys and analytics professionals will provide consultative support to outside counsel regarding quality control workflows, privilege logs, document chronologies and synopses, and assistance with deposition and trial preparation.  A Document Review Senior Manager will design the scope of work for various engagements and lead multiple concurrent projects or portfolios. Senior Managers will assist counsel and clients with compiling, analyzing, and documenting facts for matters under investigation or in litigation, and will prepare and execute detailed work plans for various engagements in regulatory, legal and forensic investigations. Senior Managers will also collaborate closely with eDiscovery data managers on engagements to provide seamless delivery to our clients across the entire eDiscovery lifecycle, from collection and processing to review and production. This role will lead preparation of proposals and participate in marketing initiatives, and research market issues to identify external opportunities.  Senior Managers will possess excellent writing skills and communicate effectively to all levels of engagement leadership, clients and counsel, and must display a consultative orientation and ability to deliver a broad range of innovative and value-added services. Senior Managers will prepare final deliverables on complex business litigation matters, and are responsible for coaching, mentoring and providing training for Managers, Senior Consultants and Consultants.  Required Qualifications  5+ years of eDiscovery/Discovery Consulting experience Deep experience consulting on review projects and managing the daily aspects of complex client portfolios and client projects Experience building, managing and assessing teams of more than 40+ personnel Experience with global data privacy considerations a plus Advanced knowledge of litigation management software including Relativity, Brainspace, etc. Demonstrated ability to provide document review services for multiple cases simultaneously Ability to analyze companies from a financial, operational, and industry perspective Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Access Professional demeanor and strong communication skills, both written and oral JD required and a good standing license that is non-practicing within at least 1 US State Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Title: Director of Managed Review - Remote
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a senior and experienced devops engineer to our core team of 10, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in modern/current devops technologies and practices on the AWS platform, including CDK, Lambda, SQS, VPCs, EC2, etc. • Proficient and experienced in CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, infrastructure management, deployment automation, and automated software release • Experienced in developing automated monitoring services and reports to track service, network, and application availability and performance, and to trigger notifications when intervention is needed • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.

Title: Senior devops engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek is Accredited by Higher Learning Commission.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-e-015ca-sp21-tickets-149698858315

Title: In-Demand IT Career Skills
Description: We are working to change the way Fans engage with their Stars and changing the way Influencers and their Audiences raise money for Charities all around the world. Utilizing innovative technologies and social channels, We will change the world, and you can be a part of it! We are looking for some really smart engineers to work with us  who can help us with preparing our MVP. We are almost close but we need additional help. We mostly use Python but people with GO Lang or Java are encouraged to apply. Knowledge of Kotlin or Flutter will be a bonus.  People with OPT are welcome to apply. No sponsorship is available at this time.

Title: Seeking Jr level Engineer
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech. You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=dcswe&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Product Management Fellowship
Description: Infotek Solutions is going to start a new job-oriented weekend training program for Non-IT & IT candidates in Software testing field With COVID-19 Norms: Software testing (QA)/ BA/ ISTQB (certification) training program Software testing(QA) online training program Selenium automation online/classroom training program Infotek Solutions is one of the leading organization in transforming Non-IT candidates to IT career for a successful life. From last 4 years, we successfully trained and communicated with 1000+ candidates by in-classroom training, in which 85% candidates are from Non-IT (some are working in a part-time job or in a banking-domain or teaching domain etc.) Our Instructors are highly professional and experienced in transferring knowledge and skills to candidates who are from Non-IT background.  After successfully finishing our last batch, we are very enthusiastic and excited that we are starting our new fresh batch for Software Testing Quality Analyst (QA), Business Analyst (BA) /ISTQB Certification Training Program.  Our every batch titles are JOB ORIENTED SOFTWARE TESTING QA/BA/ISTQB Training Program which means our important goal is to reach 100% employment for our every batch. We not only invest time in training, but we also promise and provide our every candidate resume compilation, separate interview practices and 100% Job assistance as well. We work with every candidate until he/she gets a job. For building skills, we provide our candidates 4+ real live projects during the training and install tools as well in their machines so that they can build their skills anywhere anytime by using tools.  By the end of our program, you will be a Quality Analyst ( as Manual Tester or as Selenium Automation Tester), Business Analyst as well. You will also receive the Certificate of Completion once you completed the training program. Software testing(QA)/BA/ISTQB Classroom Training Program What I am going to learn throughout this course? You will learn:Software testing process in detail through different projectsTesting techniques, approaches, implementations through different projectsDifferent testing management, integration and automation toolsTo automate test cases using Java Selenium WebDriverPerformance testing techniques and apply using tools like JmeterDatabase design, Management tools, SQL, and backend testing in detailWeb Service testing using SOAPUIAnd prepare yourself for ISTQB test certification.For more information please check the curriculum…(https://www.qaonlinetraining.com/programs/master-of-software-testing-ba-istqb-training/) We offer a combo QA/ BA/ ISTQB course where the students can learn the concepts of QA and BA in the same program without any additional effort. This also gives the flexibility to the students to choose the best career option -- QA or BA at the end of the course.Check for Classroom Course Layout:Master of Software Testing: http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/qa-ba-istqb Business Analyst: http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/programs/business-analyst/ ISTQB: http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/istqb/New Classroom Job-Oriented QA/BA/ISTQB Demo Timing this week:Job-Oriented Master of Software Testing QA/BA/ISTQB Demo Evening Friday: April 23rd@ 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM Eastern Time.New Classroom Job-Oriented QA/BA/ISTQB Program Timing:Job-Oriented Master of Software Testing QA/BA/ISTQB New Weekend Morning Batch: Sunday, April 25th @ 09:30 AM to 2:30 PM ET in Classroom Mode.Check for our online job-oriented training programs:Master of Manual testing: http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/programs/master-of-manual-testing/Selenium automation online training:  http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/programs/selenium-training/Selenium automation online training programYou will get the knowledge of Selenium web driver concepts and hands-on experience on web driver script.You will get the knowledge and working flow of various frameworks like TestNG, JUnit etc.You will get the knowledge of CICD / BDD approach with Cucumber.You will be able to share your code with your team members by working on Repository Github.You will be able to test various sites by creating your keyword-driven / data-driven framework.You will get the hands-on experience to read/write different files (excel, XML file) through Java and use in data-driven code.You will be able to automate the testing process through Jenkins tool.Job-Oriented Software testing(QA) online Demo Timing:Job-Oriented Software testing(QA) Free Demo Session Friday: April 23rd @ 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM Eastern Time.Check for course layoutSelenium automation online training: http://www.qaonlinetraining.com/programs/selenium-training/How to register for New Batch? To reserve your seat for demo session using this link: www.qaonlinetraining.com/contact-us/#tabclaim-your-seat-for-demo Call us: (800)543-5571 Text us: (800)543-5571 Click Here To Register For Our New Certification Program Training delivery mode:Classroom training with Instructor.Online training option is also available with Instructor.Training highlights: Work on Live Projects.Get hands-on experience on various demanding tools and technologies of industry.Comprehensive interview preparations with close to 1200 frequently asked interview questions & answers.Expert guidance on effective resume building.Training provided by highly experienced IT professionals.Get complete career guidance and job placement assistance with our unique Mentorship Program.Personalized mentoring, career guidance, and assessment to each individual for optimum career growth.ISTQB certification for global recognition.24*7 remote accesses to courses, projects, quizzes, test papers, QA forums and various web-related skills. Very flexible payment plans for trainees: One shot payment plan.Two instalment payment plan.Weekly instalment payment plan. Title: IT Job-Oriented QA Automation/BA/ISTQB Training with COVID-19 Norm
Compensation: Competitive cash compensation paid biweekly plus good chunk of equity
Description: COMPANY JamKazam (https://jamkazam.com/) has spent the last 6 years building the best platform in the world to help musicians play together live and in-sync over the Internet from different locations with high quality audio and video. See one of our online music festivals for an example: https://youtu.be/JGShI6izZBA. And see this overview for an intro: https://youtu.be/ylYcvTY9CVo. We are a private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech.  OPPORTUNITY We are looking for a talented, experienced principal engineer with 7+ years of experience developing complex applications with full stack scope to join our core engineering team on a full-time contract basis for a long-term run – initially as a heavy individual contributor, and then ideally once you have sufficient exposure to the product portfolio, also as team lead. We want someone who is excited by our music mission, who can operate with relative autonomy across a broad scope of our application portfolio, and who enjoys development across front-end, back-end, database, and devops – pretty much everything. This gig is fully remote - the whole team is remote/virtual and always has been.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages • Experience and passion for all aspects of development – front-end, back-end, database, devops • Expertise and proficiency in Ruby on Rails • Experience in front-end application development with React/jQuery or similar • Proficient in use of current Web UI development technologies, in particular Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3 • Proficient in use of SQL  • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  COMPENSATION This is a 1099 contractor position. Very competitive cash compensation paid biweekly, plus a healthy chunk of equity in a rapidly growing music tech company in a highly compelling market segment.  LOCATION This is a fully remote position. No need to come into any office location.

Title: Principal Full Stack Engineer (RoR/etc), Full-Time, Remote, Music Tech
Description: Looking for a collaborative, fun company with room for growth?  IMS, Inc. is a recognized leader in the biomedical IT field, with clients including the NCI, CDC, and major pharmaceutical firms. We are a diverse group of people with a focus on product quality, customer satisfaction, and enjoying what we do. We have a relaxed, friendly work environment, where employees are recognized for the work that they do. Add to that work/life balance, social events, casual dress, and no cubicles- that’s why many employees have stayed with us.  Join us as a Java Developer and see what makes IMS such a unique place to work!  As a developer, you will:  • Design and develop n-tier applications for new products or enhancements to existing products using multiple languages and design methodologies • Translate requirements into viable code • Test and debug code • Prepare documentation following company standards and applicable regulations • Perform other software development related duties as assigned  To be eligible for this position, you must meet the following requirements: • BA/BS in CompSci, Math, or related field from an institution considered accredited by U.S. DOE, with a 2.9+ GPA • 0-5 years of related programming experience • Demonstrated proficiency in Java • Demonstrated knowledge of at least one additional programming language such as Python, C#, etc. • Demonstrated knowledge of current web user interfaces • Demonstrated knowledge of current development technologies and environments • Demonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills • Demonstrated ability to relay technical information to clients and users in layman terms • Demonstrated strong problem-solving and analytical skills • Demonstrated customer service skills • Excellent attention to detail and organization skills • Must be able to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work within a team • Strong presentation skills preferred  If this sounds like the right position for your career, apply today at: https://www.imsweb.com/employment/job.description.php?position=24973   IMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Java Developer (Entry-Level)

Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

Title: $40 user interviews for software engineers
Description: What is Pathrise Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new professionals that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. Title: Product Management Fellowship
Compensation: 45,000 on average in your first placement
Description: Looking to start a new career in tech? Want a new job making over $40,000/year in just a few months for $0 upfront? We're here to help. Merit America is a nonprofit organization offering working adults without Bachelor’s degrees an opportunity to transform their careers with no upfront cost. Learn more and apply here. Application deadline is May 1st.  Past Merit America graduates in new roles have had a 70% wage increase. As Robert, a recent Merit America graduate, said in the NYTimes: “It’s the American dream stuff that didn’t seem feasible for me until now.”   👉Here are some of the benefits of our programs: ✅$0 upfront cost. You’re only responsible for payment if you land a job with a $40,000 annual salary or higher. No questions asked. ✅Flexible & part-time. Courses are designed for working, busy adults. Classes take 15-20 hours per week for 14 weeks. ✅Get skills employers want. We've identified the specific skills you need to get a new career in tech. ✅On-going career services. Merit America offers coaching, career services, and connections to local employers, all focused on helping you get a new job in tech. ✅Quick & easy application.  It takes just 5 minutes to submit your online application. No Bachelor's degree is required.  You can read about us in The New York Times or CNBC, or watch one of our graduate’s success stories featured by Grow with Google.   This is your chance, and you’re ready.   🚨Apply today🚨 FAQs  How long does the application take? The initial application takes no more than 5 minutes.  When does the program start? The next cohort begins in May, 2021. Applications will be accepted until May 1st, 2021.  What are the applicant requirements to be accepted for this training? - Applicants must have a high school diploma or GED, but no Bachelor’s degree. While those with Associate’s degrees are welcome to apply, those with a Bachelor’s degree or who are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program are not eligible unless your graduation date was over 5 years ago and you're currently unemployed or underemployed. - You are a fluent English speaker, reader, and writer. - You are authorized to work in the U.S. and able to pass a background and reference check. - You are savvy using modern technology with consistent internet access through your personal devices or nearby public spaces (e.g., libraries, coffee shops).  Is there an age limit? We do not have an age limit and welcome all adults with a GED or High School diploma to apply.  What type of IT jobs are graduates qualified for? Graduates will have the business and technology skills to pursue rewarding careers as IT support professionals. Specific job titles include: Help Desk Technician, Computer User Support Specialist, Computer Network Support Specialist, Technology Coordinator, and more.  Am I guaranteed a job? Merit America cannot guarantee employment. Graduates who are not offered a position will receive support from Merit America to identify other career opportunities leveraging their new skills. Merit America coaches and employer placement teams work with each graduate to support their job placement goals.

Title: 📈Become an IT Specialist & Transform Your Career with Merit America
Description: This is a PT contract on a project that involves completing legacy ASP.NET application tasks in order to take advantage of modern technologies and improve the user experience. There is ample opportunity to turn this into a full time-year contract. The position is Part time and in person under a full understanding of the project.  You must be located in the greater DC metro area to be considered.  Rate is negotiable and will be based on experience. 1099 or Corp to Corp only.  General Qualifications: - 3+ years experience as a software developer - Extensive experience with a demonstrable track record in using the following technologies: MSSQL, .NET, WebAPI, Entity - Some experience with older .NET technologies such as ASP.NET Web Forms is a plus  Responsibilities: - Design and write clean, self-documenting code - Coordinate development tasks with other team members - Write system/technical documentation  Related keywords: software engineer, full stack developer, software developer, angular developer, .net developer  Job Types: Full-time, Contract  Pay: $60.00 - $75.00 per hour

Title: .NET programmer needed
Description: NEXTStep Commerce Inc., an innovative e-commerce solutions provider located in Leesburg, VA is looking for a mid to senior-level Microsoft .NET full-stack software developer with expertise in SQL database design, C# software applications programming, data analytics, and reporting.  Applicant must have a minimum 5-years’ experience utilizing Microsoft’s Visual Studio Development Environment to develop and deploy cloud-based business-to-business (b2b) solutions.  Applicants with experience configuring and maintaining hosting hardware (e.g., servers, routers, switches, etc.) in a data center environment is a plus.  Applicant must be comfortable working in a fast paced, multi-tasking project environment; independently and/or as a member of 2-5 persons software project teams.  Applicant must be ready to contribute on “day-one” to our software projects, as minimal training will be provided.   This position is not suited for junior/novice level applicants or non-US (overseas) programming service providers (no exceptions).  Though the work may be performed remotely, we do plan on having occasional “in-house” software development meetings, which you will be required to attend once the Covid-19 situation has improved.  We have offices located in Leesburg, VA and Charlotte, NC.   Local applicants are preferred when applying, but this is not a mandatory requirement for hire.  The position is available for a 1099 software contractor without benefits, who can provide 40-hours of dedicated programming services per week for a minimal continuous 90-day period.  Software contractor work must be performed by the named contractor (a single individual) and MAY NOT be farmed out to others. After a 6-month period, we may consider this position for full-time employment, to include healthcare plan benefits, onsite exercise gym, yoga studio, ping pong, pod cast recording studio, fun building activities (Leesburg, VA location), and more…   We look forward to the right individual joining our team and to providing that individual with a meaningful career and enjoyable employment opportunities.

Title: .NET FULL STACK SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
Description: Montgomery County Dept of Technology Services (ERP Division) has a need for a Oracle EBS Developer with strong HCM experience. Details: Title: Oracle EBS Developer, Expert in Human Capital Management # Openings: 1 Location: 51 Monroe Place Rockville, MD 20850 Duration: 1+ years **Will accept out of town candidates b/c they will interview via TEAMs. Must be ready to work in Rockville onsite when the county goes back to the offices. May have ability to work remotely 1 day a week once back in the office but that wont be until they have proven themselves, usually after 6 months. ** **Can accept H1B & GC Holders. Must have above average COMM skills** ***NOTES- Candidates should have the following: * Oracle EBS R12 application knowledge of 5+ years in one or more areas of HCM is a must. Areas include: iRecruitment,  Oracle Learning Management (OLM) , Workforce Performance Management (WPM) , Work Structures,  Position Management , Compensation Workbench (CWB) , Employee/Manager Self Service;  * Must be strong in development of Oracle Forms & Reports * Oracle EBS R12 technical experience: * Expert knowledge of PL/SQL or SQL * Expert knowledge of workflow, forms and reports * Significant experience with OA Framework and developing solutions using JDeveloper * Experience with R12.2 code development standards * Job Description below states minimum of 5 years but County is ideally looking for someone more mid to senior level who wont need much ramp up time. Ideally in the 8+ years experience level. * Need at least 5+ years of US based work experience  Background: Montgomery County Government began a phased implementation with Financials in July 2010 and includes the following Oracle platforms: * OBIEE - Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting * Hyperion – Budgeting * PeopleSoft – Benefits/Pension * Oracle EBS R12 – Financials/HCM The following Oracle EBS areas have been implemented: FINANCIALS * General Ledger (GL) * Accounts Payable (AP) * Accounts Receivable (AR) * Purchasing (PO) * Cash Management (CA) * Fixed Assets (FA) * Projects and Grants (PNG) * Inventory * Work Orders * iAssets * iExpense * iSupplier * iReceivables * Property Manager * Warehouse /Inventory Mgmt. * Order Management * iStore (online ordering) HUMAN CAPITAL MANAGEMENT * Multiple Payrolls * Employee and Manager Self Service * Work Structures * Position Management * Advanced Benefits (OAB) * Pension Administration * Labor Distribution (LD) * iRecruitment (iRec) * Performance Management (WPM) * Learning Management (OLM) * Compensation Workbench (CWB) * Time and Labor * Absence Management * User Productivity Kits (UPK) The Department of Technology Services, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Division seeks a highly-skilled Oracle e-Business Suite R12 technical expert to provide production support and develop modifications, enhancements, extensions, interfaces and reports. Scope of Work: This individual may be responsible for, but not limited to, the following: • Troubleshoot production issues and identify and develop solutions; • Analyze and modify code to meet R12.2 coding standards; • Perform application development using Oracle Application Framework technology, Oracle Application Development Framework and JDeveloper (Java,J2EE); • Diagnose and resolve complex system problems and debug code; • Develop ODI code to perform ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), load data in star schema and develop OBIEE models and dashboards; • Perform technical analysis to resolve issues and streamline operations. Skills/experience preferred includes: • A minimum of five years application development experience in the following Oracle EBS R12 HCM areas: o iRecruitment o Oracle Learning Management (OLM) o Workforce Performance Management (WPM) o Work Structures o Position Management o Compensation Workbench (CWB) o Employee/Manager Self Service; • Significant experience with development of Oracle Forms and Reports. • Significant experience developing with OA Framework, Oracle ADF, and JDeveloper (Java/J2EE); • Expert knowledge in multiple Oracle EBS HCM modules; • Expert knowledge and experience with R12.2 code development standards; • Expert knowledge of PL/SQL or SQL; • Expert knowledge in diagnosing and resolving complex system problems, troubleshooting production issues and debugging code; • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines; • Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Additionally, to be successful the candidate(s) will: • Work well in a changing environment and maintain a strong positive perspective; • Display a strong organizational commitment and interpersonal skills; • Display teamwork within a process driven environment.

Title: AWS Cloud Engineer, Architect, Big Data, etc.
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a principal full stack engineer to our core team of 8, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in developing in multiple languages, including Node.js • Proficient in developing on the AWS platform/stack • Proficient in the use of SQL  • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.  APPLICATIONS No recruiters please. If you are an applicant, please reply to this ad with your resume and a note explaining your interest. We will not reply to all applications, but we do appreciate your interest. We will contact you if you look like a potential match.

Title: Principal full stack engineer, side gig, major equity, music tech
Description: Responsibilities: 1. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements. 2. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operation time, and form of desired results. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirements specifications. 3. Provides consultation on complex projects and is the top-level contributor/specialist of most phases of systems analysis, while considering the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements : Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Data Science or related field or equivalent experience  POSTION OVERVIEW: Data Analysts collect data, such as sales numbers or market research, to help companies make the right decisions.  • SME in complex Data Analyst enterprise level projects – 4 years exp. • Excellent written communication skills, including writing technical documents – 4 years exp. • Experience in working with complex data assets – 4 years exp. • Experience in using scripting languages or statistical software to perform data analysis – 4 years exp. • Experience in using SQL to query databases – 4 years exp. • Outstanding oral communication skills, including public speaking – 4 years exp. • Knowledge of and previous experience with a membership database and/or Salesforce – 3 years exp. • Experience building reports and visualizations in Tableau - 3 years exp. • Experience in data analysis, validation, cleansing, collection, and reporting – 4 years exp. • Bachelor’s degree in IT or related field or equivalent experience – 8 years exp.

Title: ✭✭✭Become a Web Developer. No Experience Needed (Remote)
Description: OrcaVue manufactures 360 video booth platforms for photobooth companies across the country. If you are interested in checking out our product/vibe, feel free to browse through our website www.orcavue.com. We are a fast-growing company and looking to speed up production by hiring several hardworking individuals to help with production and assembly of our products. This is a very hands-on position dealing with small low-voltage electrical components. Those interested in applying should fill out an employment application form - https://form.jotform.com/210897792534165.  Main responsibilities include: - Soldering small low-voltage electronic components - Cutting, stripping, and crimping wiring harnesses - Assembling circuit boards into their housing - Testing and QC of final assemblies - May work with a CNC laser cutter  Qualifications/experience: - Basic knowledge of soldering - Great attention to detail - A steady hand/fine motor skills - Ability to work collaboratively with people of all backgrounds and cultures - Ability to work ~40 hours/week - Punctual, responsible, trustworthy, and hardworking  Don't hesitate if you don't have all the above qualifications/experience; if you are hardworking and eager to learn, we can provide training.  To apply, please fill out an employment application form - https://form.jotform.com/210897792534165. If your application catches our eye, we will reach out via email. If you have any questions in the interim, please email us at HR@orcavue.com.

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: Position Description:  • Function as a communications and information specialist, preparing material for publications and other media internally and externally. • Coordinate publications and other collateral material using both print and electronic media including the web and desktop publishing software to draft, edit, and lay out material for distribution. • Responsible for final reviews of proposed publications for style, design, layout, and editorial aspects before government approval. • Research, analyze, and perform technical review on triage of questions, issues, or events involving the nation's critical communications infrastructure. • Gather necessary information from Program personnel, other DHS employees, and applicable policy, regulations, and best practices to support the Government in developing, writing, formatting, and editing technical and non-technical information for reports, manuals, procedures, processes, briefs, and other forms of documentation.  • Provide technical and editorial document review and written feedback and expert opinion on draft cyber/infrastructure security information documents. • Develops and maintains operational procedures documents, testing and certification of government and contractor operations personnel, and maintains training records. • Draft, coordinate, and implement updates to maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to carry out detailed customer functions. • Maintain contact information and distribution lists; manage alerting capabilities; scheduling visits, tours, and facilities; ensure awareness and compliance with DHS.  Basic Qualifications - Principal Cyber Production Specialist: To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below.  • Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 5 years’ experience required for Principal level role.  An additional 4 years of related technical experience may be substituted in lieu of degree. • Active Top Secret Security Clearance with SCI eligibility is required.  In addition, selected candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS background investigation for continued employment. • Cyber security/IT security professional writing experience. • Experience executing operational procedures and maintaining documents.  Basic Qualifications - Senior Principal Cyber Production Specialist:  To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below.  • Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 9 years’ experience required for Senior Principal level role.  An additional 4 years of related technical experience may be substituted in lieu of degree. • Active Top Secret Security Clearance with SCI eligibility is required.  In addition, selected candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS background investigation for continued employment. • Cyber security/IT security professional writing experience. • Experience executing operational procedures and maintaining documents.  Preferred Qualifications for both levels - Candidates with these preferred skills will be given preferential consideration:  • Department of Homeland Security experience desired. • DHS EOD.

Title: Principal/Senior Principal Cyber Production Specialist
Description: Position Description:  Research and analyze classified reporting to identify current and emerging threat trends  and work with intelligence community partners to produce and offer classified threat  intelligence products and briefings to internal and external partners and stakeholders.  Provide 24/7 research and reporting support to customer Senior Leadership, Duty  Officers, partners and stakeholders.  Communicate, coordinate, share information, and work closely with customer  components.  Develop informational and analytic products daily designed to increase situational  awareness and advanced warning of current and emerging cybersecurity threats and risks.  Report on underlying patterns of behavior by conducting detailed analysis of incidents,  threats and risks and associated impacts and consequences, vulnerabilities, tactics,  techniques and procedures (TTP), and other malicious and non-malicious indicators.  Provide daily threat briefings to the Watch Floor during the customer Director’s Morning  Brief.  Develop operational-level trends analysis products that leverage customer internal data  repositories, classified and unclassified open source reporting to provide situational  awareness of emerging cyber threat and risk trends to customer partners, stakeholders,  and customers.  Provide operational analysis coordination, research, and reporting support to the customer during internal cyber incident management exercises as well as national-level cyber  exercises.  Communicate, coordinate, share information, and work closely with customer  components and stakeholders.  Track and manage internal and external requests for information (RFIs) and requests for  analysis (RFAs) for the entire Branch and produce weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual performance metrics reports. Basic Qualifications -  To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the  knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below.  Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 2 years related technical experience required.  An  additional 4 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.  Active Top Secret Security Clearance with SCI eligibility is required.  In addition,  selected candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS  background investigation (EOD) for continued employment.  Previous work experience in cyber threat analytics.  Experience working in cyber intelligence requiring, at minimum, a moderate technical  acumen.

Title: Cyber Threat Analyst
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/c2b2d398/apply   HireArt is looking to hire Operations Specialists to work with autonomous vehicles supporting B2B short-haul logistics in New Orleans on a contract basis. We're seeking motivated individuals with a passion for technology to join our client's operations team. You'll be responsible for our client’s autonomous vehicle platforms on various public and private roads transporting dry and refrigerated cargo, obtaining data, and fixing technical issues. As an Operations Specialist, you're a valuable contributor, providing necessary feedback to our engineering team aimed at improving groundbreaking automated driving technology, while meeting customer needs.Responsibilities:Deliver goods for our client’s customers in a timely and professional manner.Consistently demonstrate situational awareness, an understanding of the technology in your care, and a willingness to constantly adjust to changes in the environment. Conduct a variety of critical data collection for engineering teams using software and hardware, and communicate through multiple channels. Be an ambassador for the technology by communicating expertly and courteously at all times with management, engineers, and members of the public.   If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/c2b2d398/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceCustomer relationship management experienceValid US driver's license and a clean driving recordAble to demonstrate safe driving in all weather conditionsGood mechanical aptitude and basic mechanical skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficient computer skills, including basic troubleshootingType 40+ words per minuteAbility to learn quickly and implement new conceptsWorking Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 50 lbs.Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week with possible overtime), contract position staffed via HireArt and based in New Orleans, LA. 12-hour shifts are available 7 days per week (weekdays and weekends). Compensation is hourly and paid training is provided. An offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of the initial training. HireArt provides Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to the applicant's race, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/c2b2d398/apply

We're seeking motivated individuals with a passion for technology to join our client's operations team. You'll be responsible for our client’s autonomous vehicle platforms on various public and private roads transporting dry and refrigerated cargo, obtaining data, and fixing technical issues. As an Operations Specialist, you're a valuable contributor, providing necessary feedback to our engineering team aimed at improving groundbreaking automated driving technology, while meeting customer needs.Responsibilities:Deliver goods for our client’s customers in a timely and professional manner.Consistently demonstrate situational awareness, an understanding of the technology in your care, and a willingness to constantly adjust to changes in the environment. Conduct a variety of critical data collection for engineering teams using software and hardware, and communicate through multiple channels. Be an ambassador for the technology by communicating expertly and courteously at all times with management, engineers, and members of the public.   If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/c2b2d398/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceCustomer relationship management experienceValid US driver's license and a clean driving recordAble to demonstrate safe driving in all weather conditionsGood mechanical aptitude and basic mechanical skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficient computer skills, including basic troubleshootingType 40+ words per minuteAbility to learn quickly and implement new conceptsWorking Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 50 lbs.Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week with possible overtime), contract position staffed via HireArt and based in New Orleans, LA. 12-hour shifts are available 7 days per week (weekdays and weekends). Compensation is hourly and paid training is provided. An offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of the initial training. HireArt provides Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to the applicant's race, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/c2b2d398/apply

Title: Autonomous Vehicle Operations Specialist | $20 - $23 per hour
Description: Computer Place is now hiring experienced full-time computer bench repair technicians.  Must be an experienced computer bench technician with at least 1 full year of experience diagnosing and repairing desktop and laptop computers.  Starting salary is based on your experience and expertise. If you are experienced in replacing laptop screens you will have a higher starting salary as well.  Please do not apply if you do not have at least 1 full year of on-the-job experience as a bench technician.  You will work full time in a shop with 2 other experienced bench technicians (one of which is the service department manager). The service department does work as a team, so you will have assistance from the other 2 workers in your department.  The schedule is 9 am until 6 pm Monday - Friday with a 1-hour lunch break.  We repair more than 250 computers every month. You will always be busy.  After 1 year you get 1 week of paid sick time and 1 week of paid vacation. After 2 years you get 1 week of paid sick time and 2 weeks of paid vacation. After 3 years you get 1 week of paid sick time and 3 weeks of paid vacation. After 60 days you are eligible for our health insurance benefits. After 90 days of employment, you are eligible to participate in our matching funds retirement plan.  Only candidates who provide a resume and a copy of an identity card will be considered.

You'll support transporting dry and refrigerated cargo, obtain data, and fix technical issues. You're a valuable contributor, providing necessary feedback to engineering teams aimed at improving groundbreaking automated driving technology while meeting customer needs.Responsibilities:Deliver goods for our client’s customers in a timely and professional manner.Consistently demonstrate situational awareness, an understanding of the technology in your care, and a willingness to constantly adjust to changes in the environment. Conduct a variety of critical data collection for engineering teams using software and hardware, and communicate through multiple channels. Be an ambassador for the technology by communicating expertly and courteously at all times with management, engineers, and members of the public.   If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/beb26669/apply   Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceCustomer relationship management experienceValid US driver's license and a clean driving recordAble to demonstrate safe driving in all weather conditionsGood mechanical aptitude and basic mechanical skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficient computer skills, including basic troubleshootingType 40+ words per minuteAbility to learn quickly and implement new conceptsWorking Conditions: Due to the nature of the position and daily inspections of the vehicle, this job often requires physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks that may require lifting up to 50 lbs.Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week with possible overtime), contract position staffed via HireArt and based in New Orleans, LA. 12-hour shifts are available 7 days per week (weekdays and weekends). Compensation is hourly and paid training is provided. An offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of the initial training. HireArt provides Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to the applicant's race, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/beb26669/apply

Title: Entry Level IT/IS
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our extremely successful educational products and build new, innovative products. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Work with a team of talented engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  2+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in server-side programming (e.g., PHP, Java or Python) Strong communication, analytics reasoning, and problem-solving skills Modern best practices in Javascript, HTML, and CSS Knowledge of Next.js, React, MongoDB, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day. At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission. We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Click here to apply

Title: Software Engineer, Education.com
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Senior Software Engineers with a passion for education to join our Content Engineering team and work on novel and challenging programming problems that will require creative thinking.  The IXL Content Engineering team is responsible for creating the code that powers the real-time generation of our adaptive content. By developing sophisticated content-creation algorithms and elegant interactions, we help craft an immersive learning experience that deepens students’ understanding and inspires a desire to explore. We produce highly modular code that is seamlessly integrated into IXL's skills. We implement interactive components that are intuitive enough for kindergarten learners, powerful enough to teach calculus, and performant and usable enough to make practice easy and fun.  The foundation of IXL.com is our ability to algorithmically generate exceptional questions and explanations. Your code will generate the questions that millions of students in over 190 countries will answer every day. You will own your projects from start to finish as they travel through our fast-paced development cycle. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Develop content-creation algorithms to generate adaptive questions for all our subjects Engage in every aspect of the development process, including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning Work with our front-end team to implement interactive components and integrate them into IXL's skills Collaborate closely with our design teams to create the best questions for our users   TECHNOLOGY  We write the majority of our server-side code in Java. Our front-end code is written in JavaScript using the React and D3 libraries. For our mobile clients, we occasionally dabble in Swift and React Native but generally leave the heavy lifting to the Mobile team.  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  4+ years of experience in software engineering Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Ability to collaborate in a small team Knowledge of Unix, Java, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, or source control is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking an Engineering Manager to lead its mobile development.
