Title: Software Engineer, IXL Content (NC)
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract)
Description: IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking new graduates who have a passion for technology and education. You will dive into our code base and immediately contribute to our three extremely impactful educational products and build new, innovative products. You can fine-tune your existing skills and learn new ones as you work on one of our many teams. You’ll be able to work with our Core Technology team in back-end engineering, Front-end group using cutting-edge technologies like React, Mobile team in implementing iOS and Android apps, or our Full-stack teams who seek engineers interested in doing it all.  We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.  International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.  TECHNOLOGY  Our server-side stack currently includes Linux, Apache, Java, Scala, Python, and Oracle. For our iOS app development, we use Swift. Our front-end code is written in JavaScript (including the React and D3 libraries, and ES6). Of course, the specific technologies and languages you use will vary by project and according to your own interests or specialization areas.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  As a Software Engineer, you will build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI that engage our users. You will find and use the best technologies to add features and create new products. You’ll be involved in all aspects of the development process – including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning. You will own your projects from start to end as they travel through our fast-paced development cycle. In addition to working with your fellow engineers, you’ll collaborate with other teams to design amazing products that meet the needs of our users, who are students and teachers all over the world.  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline Excellent programming skills Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams Knowledge of Unix, Python, Java, SQL, JavaScript, or Mobile app development is a plus Passion for improving education through technology  ABOUT IXL  IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.  At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. Title: Software Engineer - New Grad (NC)
Description: Job Description:  Woz Enterprise has an excellent apprenticeship opportunity for (Recent High School Graduates Only) looking to start or advance their career in technology with one of our prominent clients. Our client is an industry leader in technology services and consulting, providing you a great opportunity to get immediate training and work experience.  Selected applicants will go through a training program that teaches them to design, create, and deliver stable and scalable software systems using modern technologies and concepts. Selected applicants will learn the foundational skills of computer science along with modern web and app development tools.  What careers are we hiring for?  Java Software Developer How the program works:  Woz Enterprise apprenticeship program will select individuals who meet the entry qualifications, as noted above You will receive in-depth training for 12 weeks depending on your technical track You will work on projects while in training gaining real world experience Once your training is completed, you will interview with client company for direct hire and, if selected, you will be provided with an offer of employment along with your assigned work location Join us and be part of the next generation of Tech!  Interviews are starting now!  Requirements What We Are Looking For:  Maximum: High School Diploma or GED (Must have graduated within the last 5 years) Associates, Bachelors, Masters and Doctorate candidates do NOT qualify, we have a separate opportunity directly on our website for those with a post-secondary education Work Experience: Minimum: 6+ month of work experience Must be authorized to work in the U.S. (U.S. Citizen or Green Card holder) Strong desire to learn tech skills like coding, data analysis, networking Great communication skills, experience working directly with customers and clients. Ability to thrive in a remote learning environment. A natural problem solver Willing to relocate to client location within continental U.S.

Title: Apprenticeship Software Developer - Recent High School Graduates Only
Description: Immediate opening for an experienced Angular developer.    Want to work on the cutting edge of development?  Want to help our team develop exciting applications for the rapidly changing and high demand Healthcare market?  Want to continue to build your skill set and work in a small team environment where you can have a huge impact?  If so, then this position may be right for you!  Experience Angular developer working with some of the latest and greatest software tools and architectures: Angular-CLI using Node for developing SPA applications with .Net Core MVC backend.  An emphasis is in styling including Bootstrap, CSS for beautiful GUIs.  We’re developing a dynamic application that can generate web workflows dynamically., PatientWorks is a leading provider of Software, Hardware and Technology solutions for the Healthcare providing eForms automation, kiosk and web check-in solutions to customers and delivers outstanding value.  Requirements: Angular v6+ technology knowledge/experience – Specifically the Angular-CLI stack, complex pages, SPA, routing, decisions, GUI presentation/ basic and custom widgets.  Typescript Experience is a must.  JavaScript & JQUERY, Bootstrap for responsive web page development highly desired.  Desirable to have experience with .net Core, Entity Framework, multi-tenant hosted solutions, web services development, React, Web Server knowledge – Microsoft IIS & NodeJS Configuration, Web Server Installation, Settings, etc., ASP.NET and/or ASP.NET CORE - MVC Web Development for Internal Web-based Tools and Security Management is desirable.  FTE Position is for remote, work from home worker within the United States.  PatientWorks offers medical, dental, paid time off (PTO), vacation and matching 401k.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work for any employer in the United States.  Visa sponsorships will not be considered.

Title: Angular Developer
Description: Description  219 Design helps great companies invent products that change the world. 219ers have improved patient outcomes, changed the way we enjoy sports, and revolutionized data transfer - just to name a few. We achieve better results because we create new solutions by crossing engineering disciplines and challenging assumptions.  As an embedded engineer at 219 Design, you will work on a diverse set of projects with a variety of clients. You will be a public face of 219 as you tackle big challenges for products that improve people's lives. We need engineers who are adaptable and passionate about their work. If 219 sounds like a good fit, please apply!  To apply, please fill out our application at https://www.219design.com/careers/.  Requirements  Contribute to development of embedded systems for a variety of projects in one or more of the following areas -Circuit design, schematic capture, and PCB layout for analog and digital circuits -Firmware development for embedded microcontrollers and microprocessors -Integration and debugging of complex embedded systems  Work with a multidisciplinary team of engineers -Help define and execute tasks required to complete projects with well-defined or open-ended requirements -Manage client communication -Manage project schedule and logistics for self or small team -Maintain awareness of bigger picture context for 219 Design and our clients while executing lower level tasks  Minimum qualifications -Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar -5+ years of experience as an embedded systems designer -Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to clearly convey complex technical ideas in a customer-facing setting. -In-depth experience designing complex electrical circuitry and familiarity with embedded firmware development OR In-depth experience as a firmware developer with some exposure to electronic circuit design -Motivated by helping customers build great products -In a nutshell, you not only love embedded systems development, but are great at it. -You are authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.  Benefits  219 Design offers health/dental/vision insurance insurance as well as 401(k) + company match, and paid vacation & holidays.  At 219, you will develop compelling prototypes and products while maintaining an average 40-hour work week. You will share in the profit and help shape our company. You will continue to develop by learning to be a stronger technical and strategic thinker through weekly engineering discussion groups and transparent company operation. At 219, we see our job as more than just a way to make money – it is how we fulfill an inner drive to solve problems and to express our creativity.

Title: Senior Embedded Firmware Engineer
Description: We currently have an old intranet that was programmed in active server pages with a MS Access database. We are needing someone to convert the access db to SQL server and get the intranet functioning... Perhaps switching over to .NET instead of ASP.   Initial project could very well lead to additional development work.  We prefer someone relatively local. Samples of work and references are required.

Title: Intranet Development / Updates Needed
Description: HiringThing is looking for a Software Engineer to focus on growing our Rails and React-based applicant tracking software platform. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions, and development priorities.  We practice continuous integration and deploy on-demand throughout the day.  Your primary focus will be developing our hiring platform but you'll also spend some time with test automation, API development, front-end React development, and infrastructure automation.Requirements Minimum 2 years of Ruby on RailsFamiliarity with modern Rails best practicesExperience with database-driven web applications (SQL)Some experience working with ES6 and modern front-end web frameworksIndependent work ethicFully remote workspace experience preferred Strong communication skillsParticipation in a triage engineering rotation and an on call engineering rotationTechnologies in Play Ruby on Rails MySQLReact (Webpack, ES6)Amazon Web ServicesTerraformDockerCompensation/Benefits401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursementAbility to work remotelyComprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesOpportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the CompanyUnlimited PTO policyOpportunity for professional development 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employeesParticipation in employee stock option planAbout HiringThingHiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.We’ve been a fully remote company since day 1 so we know how how to work in a virtual office across multiple time zones. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. You can work from home, your porch, or the beach as long as the work gets done.We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take a vacation, take time off for illness, and shift schedules as necessary.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/249152/rails-engineer-remote?s=cl

Title: Rails Engineer (Remote)
Description: HiringThing is looking for a Software Engineer to focus on growing our Rails and React based applicant tracking software platform. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions and development priorities.  We practice continuous integration and deploy on demand throughout the day.  You'll be responsible for building new frontend features with React/Redux, both independently and within a cross-functional team. You'll also be responsible for the maintenance of existing features, including bug fixes,some features are written in other frontend technologies such as jQuery.Requirements Minimum 2 years of javascript experienceAt least one year of React and ReduxStrong knowledge of HTML/CSS/SCSSFamiliarity with javascript testingExperience configuring webpackSome experience working with backend technologies (Rails specifically)Independent work ethicFully remote workspace experience preferredStrong communication skillsParticipation in a triage engineering rotation and an on call engineering rotationTechnologies in PlayReact with and without ReduxMocha/ChaiRuby on Rails MySQL Amazon Web ServicesDockerTerraformCompensation/Benefits:401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options$100/month telecom reimbursementUp to $50/month fitness reimbursementAbility to work remotelyComprehensive benefits offered to eligible employeesOpportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the CompanyUnlimited PTO policyOpportunity for professional development 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employeesParticipation in employee stock option planAbout HiringThingHiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.We’re a fully remote company with a virtual office. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. We meet as a team daily and are required to connect with other teams during standard business hours. You can work from home, a coffee shop or the beach as long as the work gets done. We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take a vacation, take time off for illness and shift schedules as necessary.Please apply online with HiringThing at: https://careers.hiringthing.com/job/249153/front-end-engineer-remote?s=cl

Title: Software Engineer, IXL Content (NC)
Description: HMLT formatted Job Post: (copy and paste)  Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Interview Engineer (Remote)
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area. All future programs are continuing as scheduled. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/787f0ba4/apply   Requirements Ph.D. or Masters degree in computer science, robotics, or related field, or with equivalent industrial experience2+ years of similar working experienceSolid C/C++ and object-oriented programming skillsExperience in SLAM-related fields (e.g. pose estimation, probabilistic filtering, and 3D point cloud data processing, registration, etc.)Experience with GPS-INS systemsExperience with ROSMust-have knowledge and experiences:Solid understanding of optimization, linear algebra, probability theory, and 3D geometrySLAM related algorithms and data-structure like KF, Kd-tree, graph-SLAM, particle filterSLAM algorithms using point cloud data like LOAM, etc.Preferred experiences:Hands-on experiences on autonomous vehicles or ground wheel robotsOutdoor applicationsPublication from conferences (e.g. RSS, ICRA, IROS, and robotics conference)Different types of sensors (e.g. camera)DNN-based SLAM or odoemtryExperience with autonomous vehicles or robotsAbility to understand and implement the latest technologiesCommitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), contract-to-hire position staffed via HireArt and based in Cincinnati, OH.HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.  If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here: https://www.hireart.com/jobs/787f0ba4/apply

Title: Software Engineer: SLAM | $90,000 - $130,000 per year
Description: You belong at Dayton Freight! Join our team and be a part of The Dayton Difference.  Dayton Freight is a recognized leader in regional LTL transportation services and we are truly different from other carriers. It’s apparent in how we treat our customers and each other. Our culture is one of teamwork, respect and professional honesty. Dayton Freight appreciates its employees: you are not just a number, you are family. We attribute our growth to the dedication of our employees, and the loyalty of our customers and business partners.  As a C# Software Developer you will be responsible for participating in all phases of the SDLC—producing clean, self-documenting, and efficient code.  Responsibilities • ASP.NET Core, ASP.NET MVC • WPF, UWP • Entity Framework, Entity Framework Core • Microsoft Azure, Distributed Systems, CQRS, DDD, Event Sourcing • Experience with Agile methodologies, Azure DevOps / Visual Studio Team Services  Qualifications • 2+ years of experience using C#, ASP.NET • Positive team oriented attitude • Ability to work in a team environment and independently • Strong written and verbal communication skills • Passion for learning and continuous improvement • Ability to apply commonly accepted design patterns  Benefits • Stable and growing organization • Competitive weekly pay • Professional, positive and people-centered work environment • Fast-paced work environment • Comprehensive benefits package: Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D, 401(k), etc. • Paid holidays (8); paid vacation and personal days  Please Apply Online at: https://careers-daytonfreight.icims.com/jobs/2400/job

Java Software Developer How the program works:  Woz Enterprise apprenticeship program will select individuals who meet the entry qualifications, as noted above You will receive in-depth training for 12 weeks depending on your technical track You will work on projects while in training gaining real world experience Once your training is completed, you will interview with client company for direct hire and, if selected, you will be provided with an offer of employment along with your assigned work location Join us and be part of the next generation of Tech!  Interviews are starting now!  Requirements What We Are Looking For:  Maximum: High School Diploma or GED (Must have graduated within the last 5 years) Associates, Bachelors, Masters and Doctorate candidates do NOT qualify, we have a separate opportunity directly on our website for those with a post-secondary education Work Experience: Minimum: 6+ month of work experience Must be authorized to work in the U.S. (U.S. Citizen or Green Card holder) Strong desire to learn tech skills like coding, data analysis, networking Great communication skills, experience working directly with customers and clients. Ability to thrive in a remote learning environment. A natural problem solver Willing to relocate to client location within continental U.S.

Title: Apprenticeship Software Developer - Recent High School Graduates Only
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=phildata&utm_medium=job_board

Title: Software Engineering Fellowship
Description: If you’re looking for an extra edge in landing a new job or promotion, cloud certification can be a great option.  A lot of opportunities will open up: you can pursue career paths like AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Developer, AWS Engineer, Cloud Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect and AWS SysOps Admin among others. AWS training will help you grab this opportunity and accelerate your career.  Why AWS?  With the increasing focus on cloud computing and infrastructure over the last several years, cloud architects are in great demand worldwide. Many organizations have moved to cloud platforms for better scalability, mobility, and security, and cloud solutions architects are among the highest paid professionals in the IT industry. According to Forbes, enterprise IT architects with cloud computing expertise are earning a median salary of $137,957.  Why ZiyoTek Institute of Technology?  ZiyoTek is Accredited by Higher Learning Commission.  No matter the stage of your cloud initiative, ZiyoTek can help every step of the way. AWS Certification Training from ZiyoTek is designed to provide in-depth knowledge about AWS architectural principles and its services. We offer structured AWS training with an updated curriculum as per current industry requirements and best hands-on practices. We have passionate AWS Instructors who not only have real-world experience, but also go through a rigorous process to validate their teaching expertise. The school also offers personalized financial planning options.  Are you ready to Jump-Start Your Career and Increase Your Salary ?  Sign up for free Event hosted by experienced instructors, where you can learn a lot about the program.  Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cloud-architect-online-info-session-e-015ca-sp21-tickets-149698858315

Title: Apprenticeship Software Developer - Recent High School Graduates Only
Description: Location: Fairfax, VA Employment Type: Full Time   Apply here: https://hire.lever.co/jobs/internal/22e1d98e-478d-492b-8e14-31a7dc682dec  Smoothstack— a cutting-edge IT apprenticeship program that is helping candidates find quality and inclusive opportunities with some of the largest IT companies in the DC Metro area.  We are looking for developers who want to engage in challenging projects in futuristic technology, software development, and much more within a variety of sectors such as financial, health care, energy and federal.  Everyone from the self-taught engineer to the recent college graduate are welcome to apply. No prior work experience is required and we have multiple openings in and around Washington D.C.  We will provide on the job training after you are hired.  **We have a continued investment in motivated, passionate individuals like you who strive to move forward in their careers through apprenticeship programs like Smoothstack. Please be aware we have modified our training so that we can continue to offer our apprenticeship program remotely until the CDC deems it appropriate to work in shared office spaces. All future programs are continuing as scheduled.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  • Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology • Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages • Four-year degree in any field • Two years of hands-on coding experience – personal projects, freelance work can be counted towards years of experience. • Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design • Must be willing to relocate  ADVANTAGES OF SMOOTHSTACK  • Pay Package - $55,000 plus • Relocation assistance provided • Health/Medical Benefits • 401 K • Industry Certifications • Mentoring Program • Opportunity to work with one of our many large-scale government entities   Smoothstack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Principles only. Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.  Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.

Title: Earn $$$ from home - Pixel phone tester
Compensation: Competitive compensation and benefits package offered.
Description: Company Overview: Rumsey is a dynamic, employee-owned company serving Eastern PA, NJ, DE and MD.  In existence for over 100 years, Rumsey provides a competitive salary and benefits package, along with diverse opportunities for long term career development. The Rumsey team consists of over 250 owner associates that thrive in a fast-paced customer service environment.  Rumsey just may be the long-term company you’ve been looking for!  Position Overview: The Automation Specialist is core to the success of our organization and our customers organizations.  The Automation team works with customers to help select, design, and coach them through automation and software solutions that will improve their machine or manufacturing productivity.  We currently have an opening for an additional team member focused on these PLC, HMI & Software Solutions   based out of our Conshohocken or Newark location.  This individual will be responsible for marketing, selling, and technically supporting customers and the sales team with respect to the Rockwell Automation Software Products, PLCs, HMIs, and complementary partner lines.  Essential Functions:   • Identify customer needs, propose solutions, and assist in providing the information that enables closing orders for automation & software products.  May include direct customer technical support at local customer sites. • Identify and implement training and education opportunities that will improve customers’ comfort and competency in utilizing our product lines and technology. • Train internal staff on the sales and commercial aspects of PLC, HMI, and Software type products, including features, benefits, applications, and markets. • Understand and implement marketing, promotion programs, and product launches from Rockwell Automation and other core partner product businesses. • Analyze market conditions, develop an annual business plan, and coordinate its implementation including strategies to position against competition and grow market penetration.  • Lead and coordinate the sales teaming efforts (including Distributor Peers and Vendor Partners) required to identify and to close account conversion and project sales opportunities for assigned projects. • Track and document customer projects and opportunities in Rumsey’s CRM system. • Participate in ongoing training to maintain technical competency in PLC, HMI, and Software and complimentary product areas. (Travel Required)  Knowledge, Skills & Experience:  • Core competency for the current technology as it relates to Software and PLC/HMI products including programming and configuration software. • Strong presentation skills in a group and individual situations. • Ability to effectively listen, communicate, and gain consensus. • Able to identify and demonstrate technology solutions for customer applications. • Proficient with Microsoft Office products (e.g., Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.). • Valid driver’s license and acceptable driving record. • Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field, and/or commensurate experience.    If you meet the criteria outlined above, we encourage you to apply.  To apply online, https://www.rumsey.com/jobs to complete our employment application.  Rumsey Electric Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under the applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Title: ✭✭✭Become a Web Developer. No Experience Needed (Remote)
Description: What is Pathrise  Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.  Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.  About the Fellowship  The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.  During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.  Our Mission  We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.  Qualifications  You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice. You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup. You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.  Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=phildata&utm_medium=job_board

Description: Job Description:  Woz Enterprise has an excellent apprenticeship opportunity for (Recent High School Graduates Only) looking to start or advance their career in technology with one of our prominent clients. Our client is an industry leader in technology services and consulting, providing you a great opportunity to get immediate training and work experience.  Selected applicants will go through a training program that teaches them to design, create, and deliver stable and scalable software systems using modern technologies and concepts. Selected applicants will learn the foundational skills of computer science along with modern web and app development tools.  What careers are we hiring for?  Java Software Developer How the program works:  Woz Enterprise apprenticeship program will select individuals who meet the entry qualifications, as noted above You will receive in-depth training for 12 weeks depending on your technical track You will work on projects while in training gaining real world experience Once your training is completed, you will interview with client company for direct hire and, if selected, you will be provided with an offer of employment along with your assigned work location Join us and be part of the next generation of Tech!  Interviews are starting now!  Requirements What We Are Looking For:  Maximum: High School Diploma or GED (Must have graduated within the last 5 years) Associates, Bachelors, Masters and Doctorate candidates do NOT qualify, we have a separate opportunity directly on our website for those with a post-secondary education Work Experience: Minimum: 6+ month of work experience Must be authorized to work in the U.S. (U.S. Citizen or Green Card holder) Strong desire to learn tech skills like coding, data analysis, networking Great communication skills, experience working directly with customers and clients. Ability to thrive in a remote learning environment. A natural problem solver Willing to relocate to client location within continental U.S.

Title: Apprenticeship Software Developer - Recent High School Graduates Only
Description: Are you looking for a company you can believe in and are ready to put 100% effort into making things happen? Are you looking for a company that BELIEVES IN YOU and wants to help you take care of your career goals? Are you able to do what is necessary to achieve YOUR personal goals? Do you want to learn, grow, produce, and be respected by your peers for the talents you bring to the organization? We are looking for customer service superstars!  Work at Home… for now!  LiveMessage America is accepting applications for Remote Inbound Call Center Agents. We are looking for motivated and performance-driven people. More importantly, we are looking for the RIGHT people to fill these unique and important positions.  A one-week paid training process is conducted remotely. Once you have successfully completed training, we will allow you to then begin working your normal schedule during the week. In accordance with COVID-19 health and safety at work guidelines, and at management’s discretion, once we complete our transition back to our offices, you will also begin working on site in our call center.   Technical Requirements When Working from Home: • Must have your own personal computer or laptop (Windows or Mac, no Chrome books please). • High-Speed Broadband Internet (Fiber or Cable) that meets our requirements of at least 6 Mbps download and 2 Mbps upload. (Speed test instructions are provided in this ad for your convenience.) • We will provide you with a headset to use. • Computer will need to be connected to your router/modem with a wired, Ethernet connection. You will NOT be able to work using Wi-Fi with our system.   General Job Requirements • Welcoming tone/voice with an upbeat hospitality is a must • Strong and professional Fluent bilingual communications in both (English/Spanish) • Strong professional command of written and spelling grammar • Computer skills in a Windows-based environment • Punctual with great attendance • Fast learner and be able to type well (at least 35 words per minute) • Punctual / Dependable • Be a ‘team player’!   Our Benefits for Full Time Employees Include: • Employee Stock Ownership • Full Medical, Dental, Vision benefits • Paid Vacations (up to 4 weeks per year over time) • Traditional 401K and Roth 401K options with company matching • Free Life Insurance policy • Legal Assistance, and more!   Shifts & Compensation Offered: • Part Time/ (5) Days a week: Mon-Fri 730am-930am $20/per hour • Part Time/ (5) Days a week: Evening hours days vary $13.50/per hour • Full Time/ (5) Days a week: Midday/Evening hours $13.50/per hour • Full Time/ (5) Days a week: Split shift (morning/early evening) $13.50/per hour        You must be available to work weekends (a Saturday each week OR a Sunday each week). You must be very punctual with great attendance.   Speed Test Before applying, please conduct a free speed test online. As stated, you will NOT be able to work off Wi-Fi, HOWEVER, for this speed test, you can use Wi-Fi on your smart phone, tablet or personal computer.  Instructions: 1. Make sure you are connected to Wi-Fi and not cellular. 2. Go to fast.com on any browser. The test will begin to load automatically. Let it run until it gives you a final download speed. 3. When download speed is final, click “Show More Info” to begin testing upload speed. 4. Keep your Download and Upload speeds handy in the event that the manager contacts you regarding the position.   We answer incoming phone calls from our clients. We professionally greet callers, provide and request required information, document information and transfer incoming calls or take messages as necessary. We also relay and route critical messages to on-call personnel by prioritizing emergency calls, paging individuals to inform of emergencies and utilizing call center tools to ensure the right person receives the right message at the right time.  Again, we provide INBOUND customer support only - we are not a telemarketing center.  Our jobs require people that are very detail oriented. We handle calls for a large number of accounts and so there is always a lot of activity and new challenges to face and resolve daily!  To learn more about us, please visit our website at LiveMessageAmerica.com  Don't miss out on this opportunity - apply today!  We look forward to hearing from you!  To apply: 1. Call our employment line at (609)568-9796 2. Give us your best ‘telephone audition’! If we like what we hear, we will be calling you back to schedule an interview.   During your ‘voicemail audition’, please include the following: • Your first and last name (Please spell both names) • Phone number, with area code first • Town of Residence • What is a good time for you to receive a return call? • How did you hear about this position? • Why do you believe you would be a great fit for this position?

Title: Answering Service Call Center Agent
Compensation: Salary/Hourly Rate: up to $32 per hour DOE
Description: Salary/Hourly Rate: up to $32 per hour DOE  Position Overview:  The Quality Assurance Analyst ensures that the documentation review performed for the release of tissue and medical devices is according to current Company procedures and in compliance with applicable regulatory requirements  Responsibilities: •Quality Assurance Analyst reviews release criteria in accordance with current finished good (FG) specifications, in-process finished goods (IFG) specifications, Company procedures for tissue and medical devices, and applicable regulatory requirements •Identifies deviations, discrepancies, or non-conformances associated with the work order. Notifies the appropriate individuals, completes the necessary documentation, and ensures the deviations, discrepancies, or non-conformances have been resolved before the tissue or medical device units are released •Completes appropriate documentation for the rejection of tissue and medical devices when required •Quality Assurance Analyst prints testing result reports from outside laboratories and internal Company laboratories for review and incorporation into the processing record, if applicable •Reviews recorded measurements for tissue and medical devices in accordance with current FG specifications and Company procedures •Reviews packaging and labeling documentation for tissue and medical devices in accordance with current FG specifications, Company procedures, and applicable regulatory requirements •Quality Assurance Analyst reviews tissue and medical device processing and storage documentation in accordance with current Company procedures and applicable regulatory requirements •Interacts with all departments to organize, review, and analyze all data pertaining to the release of tissue or medical devices for compliance with current Company procedures, IFG and FG specifications, and applicable regulatory requirements •Releases tissue and medical devices to Inventory Control for international and domestic distribution •Reviews rework work orders and ensures the accurate destruction of tissue, if required •Enters all required data into the Quality Donor Data System (QDDS) and transfers Work-In-Process (WIP) tissue to the appropriate location in QAD •Performs additional duties, as assigned  Qualifications: •Quality Assurance Analyst needs to have at least 1 – 3 years (3 – 5 years preferred) of Quality Assurance experience in a GMP or FDA regulated industry where Quality functions were performed such as auditing, approval of batch records, and microbiology testing •3+ years in document review or laboratory testing is a must •Strong written and verbal communication skills •Must be proficient in data entry, Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel •Quality Assurance Analyst must exhibit attention to detail, critical thinking, problem-solving and effective communication skills  Education Requirements: •Minimum of a high school diploma or GED •Bachelor's Degree in medical or life sciences discipline such as Biomedical Engineering, Biology, Physiology is preferred  •Medical Technologist background or ASQ Auditor Certification is a plus  Benefits: •Atrium Benefits Available Upon Eligibility

The Automation team works with customers to help select, design, and coach them through automation and software solutions that will improve their machine or manufacturing productivity. May include direct customer technical support at local customer sites. • Identify and implement training and education opportunities that will improve customers’ comfort and competency in utilizing our product lines and technology. • Train internal staff on the sales and commercial aspects of PLC, HMI, and Software type products, including features, benefits, applications, and markets. • Understand and implement marketing, promotion programs, and product launches from Rockwell Automation and other core partner product businesses. • Analyze market conditions, develop an annual business plan, and coordinate its implementation including strategies to position against competition and grow market penetration.  • Lead and coordinate the sales teaming efforts (including Distributor Peers and Vendor Partners) required to identify and to close account conversion and project sales opportunities for assigned projects. • Track and document customer projects and opportunities in Rumsey’s CRM system. • Participate in ongoing training to maintain technical competency in PLC, HMI, and Software and complimentary product areas. (Travel Required)  Knowledge, Skills & Experience:  • Core competency for the current technology as it relates to Software and PLC/HMI products including programming and configuration software. • Strong presentation skills in a group and individual situations. • Ability to effectively listen, communicate, and gain consensus. • Able to identify and demonstrate technology solutions for customer applications. • Proficient with Microsoft Office products (e.g., Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.). • Valid driver’s license and acceptable driving record. • Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field, and/or commensurate experience. Title: PLC, HMI & Software Specialist
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Software Engineer - Engineer Interviewer (Contract-Fully Remote!)
Description: A confidential company is hiring a Sr. Java Developer.  A career in Information Technology, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to support our core business functions by deploying applications that enable our people to work more efficiently and deliver the highest levels of service to our clients. You’ll focus on managing the design and implementation of technology infrastructure, developing and enhancing both client and internal facing applications, and providing technology tools that help create a competitive advantage for the firm to drive strategic business growth. Our Information Technology Development team helps develop and supports internal information technology systems and applications for use by all staff levels. You’ll help our team develop programs and applications that cater to our strategic technology needs using your knowledge of technical domains of application.  Job Requirements and Preferences:  4 year(s) of progressive roles focused on information technology applications and its overall impact on business strategies and productivity. Bachelor Degree in Computer Applications, Computer Programming preferred.  Required Knowledge and Skills:Extensive level of technical knowledge and skills in areas that may include:  Full stack, Java, J2EE, Spring and Apache experience including:   Hibernate and JPA; J2EE containers, with experience in one of Tomcat, Websphere,Weblogic, JBoss, AppEngine, Spring boot NodeJS Designing and developing for modern Javascript-based web application front end Inversion of Control and Dependency Injection frameworks.    Preferred Knowledge/Skills: Demonstrated thorough knowledge, technical understanding and success in roles for improving and managing the productivity of technology processes including the following areas:  Lean IT principles and data driven approaches;  Script languages and automation (e.g. Python, Ruby, JScript, VBscript, Bash, Powershell, Google Apps Script, Groovy); Cloud infrastructure and container-based deployment (Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift); Modern web application development (e.g. AngularJS, NodeJS, Python, CSS3, Boostrap); NoSQL databases (e.g. DocumentDB, Cloud Datastore, MongoDB, Casandra, etc.); REST API design and creation (e.g. Spring-WebMVC, Jersey); API management (e.g. Azure API Management, Google Cloud Endpoints); Cloud-based platforms and services (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, MS Azure, AWS, OpenAPI, Swagger, Apigee); Continuous integration/continuous deployment (e.g. Git, Jenkins, TFS, Puppet, Chef, Maven, Gradie, Ant); Containers - Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift; Serverless: AWS Lambda, Cloud Functions; Unit testing using JUnit, NUnit and related tools; Data Integration Tools (SSIS, Informatica, API Management, Enterprise Service Bus, and Rules Engine); Source control using one of Git, Subversion, TFS; and Enterprise Application Integration and Identity Management (IdAM), (oAuth2).    Demonstrates extensive abilities and/or a proven record of success in the following areas:  Working within established Software Development Lifecycles and methodologies including agile, scrum, iterative & waterfall to support the success of the organization;  Learning rapidly and continuously taking advantage of new technologies, concepts and business models; demonstrated history of staying current in emerging technology trends; Displaying initiative and ability to develop applications in a self-directed and self-disciplined manner; Researching and evaluating emerging technologies and novel approaches to enhance business processes and/or create competitive advantage to our company; Working collaboratively with other developers, including participating in code reviews; Communicating effectively both verbally and written with project team members; Robust analytic thinking skills with the ability to identify, debug, and resolve technical issues; Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams in resolving complex technical issues: providing design guidance that follows the enterprise architecture vision and adheres to application technology guidelines; and understanding and mitigating the impact of technical design to security, performance and data privacy; and Demonstrating significant contributions to deliver solutions within an Agile methodology, while establishing quality, timeliness and adherence to good architectural practice and guidelines.

Title: IT Training and Career opportunities. No IT background required.
Description: Renova Health (www.renovahealth.care) is one of the leading wellness companies in the US.  We provide both in-clinic and off-site (on the phone) support to healthcare clinics throughout the country to implement an array of Medicare-related programs including chronic care management, transitional care management, remote patient monitoring, and annual wellness visit services.  We have an immediate opening for an Internal Software Product Manager to be located in our office in Franklin, TN to help us manage our explosive growth.  As a key member of our Management team, the Internal Software Product Manager will take ownership of our internal software platform (called Rcare), study and understand the needs of our internal users (who are LPNs and CMAs), analyze key metrics relative to the performance of our software, and ultimately design and manage the delivery of software solutions that produce better results. We are looking for someone who loves challenging projects and is passionate about designing and executing software solutions that our internal team will love. Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities:  1. Understand the business and operational goals of Renova Health and how Rcare can be better aligned to meet these goals. 2. Fully understand how Rcare works, both the front-end user interface and the back-end database and operational tools. 3. Work closely with the internal users to understand their needs and design software solutions within Rcare to help them perform their job better. 4. Analyze Rcare data to improve features and functionality of Rcare and to inspire new workflow and functionality solutions. 5. Help Renova management to establish appropriate metrics tracked by Rcare and develop tools to monitor these metrics on an on-going basis. 6. Stay up-to-date on all industry related trends and utilize knowledge of these trends to recommend new Rcare features and functionality and to ensure Rcare remains compliant with all CMS and HIPAA rules and guidelines. 7. Manages all aspects of Rcare projects, including understanding user needs, designing solutions to address those needs, managing external resources to execute solutions, obtain user feedback and modifying solutions as necessary, training users on the use of new solutions, and monitoring the adoption and utilization of these new solutions. 8. Work closely with CTO and the external development team to ensure Rcare development projects stay on track, within budget, and deliver expected results. 9. Educate and train internal users on new Rcare functionality, obtain feedback, and update new functionality as required. 10. Present to potential new customers and other external audiences the capabilities and functionality of our Rcare system. 11. Proactively and effectively communicates to Renova management on the scope and progress of all Rcare initiatives. 12. Establishes and maintains a positive and cooperative relationship with all Renova Health team members. 13. Become the go to person when internal users have any issues or questions related to Rcare. 14. Adheres to all approved company policies, guidelines, and processes. 15. Knowledge of Laravel software development language is an added plus but not required.

Title: Data Entry Position
Description: Interviewing is a universal experience, but it is no one’s job.  Interviews are the gateway between people and jobs — they are a critical connection point. And yet, while the interview is a universal experience, it has never been recognized as its own discipline. In fact, the  vast majority of people conducting interviews receive no formal training in how to do so.  Karat is the market leader in Interview Engineering.  At Karat, our mission is to make every interview predictive, fair, and enjoyable. To do so, we created and established the category of Interview Engineering.  Founded in 2014, Karat is a privately held and venture-funded company based in Seattle. Key clients include Pinterest, PayPal, Citrix, Intuit, and InVision.  Interview Engineering at Karat  Karat Interview Engineers are a community of experienced software developers who are equipped with best practices and technology needed to provide the most predictive, fair, and enjoyable interviews to software engineering job candidates. Interview Engineers include software development managers, software engineers, and freelancers covering the full technology stack. As an Interview Engineer, you will interview job candidates using the Karat approach and interviewing infrastructure in a wide variety of roles on behalf of leading companies worldwide.  Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.  As an Interview Engineer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible — many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some Interview Engineers do 5-10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.  About You  Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of hands-on coding experience Extensive interviewing experience focused on:   evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.) software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing source control, APIs etc.) specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)  You believe that interviewing is a first-class job Strong oral and written communication skills Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback   If interested in becoming an Interview Engineer, please submit your resume and complete our application on our careers site. We look forward to connecting with you!

Java, C#, Python, PHP, JavaScript, Ruby, Swift) Able to work from 9am-6pm Highly Desirable Qualifications: Basic understanding of QA methodologies  Web-based services and technologies (ex. Title: Junior QA Analyst Trainee - 9am-6pm
Description: COMPANY We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech. We are well down the path to our first major product release, coming out soon!  OPPORTUNITY This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits.   • If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity. • If you love music, you should look at this opportunity.  • If you love developing truly innovative and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.  We are looking to add a senior and experienced devops engineer to our core team of 10, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.  REQUIREMENTS • Proficient in modern/current devops technologies and practices on the AWS platform, including CDK, Lambda, SQS, VPCs, EC2, etc. • Proficient and experienced in CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, infrastructure management, deployment automation, and automated software release • Experienced in developing automated monitoring services and reports to track service, network, and application availability and performance, and to trigger notifications when intervention is needed • Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time • Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team • Good human being, no time for a$$holes • Truly enjoy building cool stuff • Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit  On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and RxKotlin for Android. And we are integrating the cloud and mobile tech/data using GraphQL.   COMPENSATION This is a part-time, fully remote/virtual, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.  LOCATION Candidate must be located in the United States.

Title: Apprenticeship Software Developer - Recent High School Graduates Only
Description: OutMatch Lead UX Designer Job Label: MAG_178D61B8916 As a Lead UX designer, your mission will be to champion a user-centered design process throughout the organization.  You will be responsible for providing thought leadership, and structured mentorship for our team of UX/UI and Product designers. This role is critical to the future of OutMatch, as we continue to grow and scale toward market leadership through organic growth and acquisition. To accomplish this, you will work alongside product management, engineering, and science teams to create innovative ideas and turn them into seamless product experiences. The ideal candidate will have experience using research, data, and design skills to take initially disparate products and evolve them toward a consistent, unified user experience.  You’ll have experience working as a team lead collaborating with product managers to define product functionality and translate it into wireframes, prototypes, and products that users love.   OutMatch makes people decisions more scalable, predictable, and personal with an end-to-end talent decision platform. The world's most recognized brands rely on OutMatch to scale recruitment, understand their talent, and personalize candidate and employee experiences. Over 1,000 global companies trust OutMatch technology to process millions of candidates annually, and to achieve 25X return on investment through better people outcomes.  OutMatch is a portfolio company of Rubicon Technology Partners (headquartered in Boulder, Colorado) and Camden Partners (headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland).    What You'll Do:   Develop and design user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and refined experiences iteratively with a strong foundation in UX, research, and a user-centric mindset Partner closely with product managers, engineers, and business users to define, design, and develop products that solve real customer needs, delight our users, and drive business outcomes Define KPI’s and a measurement strategy to leverage product analytics, and usability testing to continually reduce friction points in user-journeys and improve the user experience Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex design problems within our products Be the thought leader, and champion for UX design and user testing, advocating for best practices and establishing guidelines from experience   What You'll Need:   5+ years working as a UX or Product Designer with at least 2 years collaborating with other designers Experience designing a SaaS platform with complex systems Experience conducting user testing and research Experience establishing and analyzing UX metrics Proficient in designing layouts, typography, pattern libraries, design systems, web and brand elements, etc Strong communication skills with other product managers and engineers for day to day tasks Strong organization skills, and a bias toward detail-oriented communication for a smooth designer-developer handoff Experience owning and executing on initiatives with minimal direction (independent, proactive, and "can-do" attitude) Experience working in an agile development environment Strong project planning, tracking & organizing skills Expert proficiency in commonly used visual design and prototyping tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, InVisionApp, Figma, etc. Comfortable working in a fast-paced, fluid environment, handling a variety of assignments and technologies Experience with responsive web and/or mobile app design BONUS: Understanding of best practices for WCAG compliance for Accessibility  What You'll Get:   To be part of a high-performing, highly collaborative environment full of people who love what they do and who are dedicated to success A culture focused on achieving results and transparent communication A solid, experienced management team invested in your development The opportunity to build skills and experiences that enable you to be successful quickly while paving the way for career growth An executive team dedicated to the safety and well-being of all team members Discretionary paid time off...whey you need it, you take it Dedicated development and planning time each week A world-class platform with an elegant user interface that empowers our clients to positively impact their business results A competitive base salary and great incentive program Monthly mobile connectivity allowance 100% company paid individual medical, dental, and vision insurance 401(k) with company match              To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.       Apply for this job https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/ce/487180750/OutMatch/Texas/Dallas/Senior-UX-Designer?sourceType=9          Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.       Related Keywords: UX UX Designer Product Designer

Description: Looking to start a new career in tech? Want a new job making over $40,000/year in just a few months for $0 upfront? We're here to help. Merit America is a nonprofit organization offering working adults without Bachelor’s degrees an opportunity to transform their careers with no upfront cost. Learn more and apply here. Application deadline is May 1st.  Past Merit America graduates in new roles have had a 70% wage increase. As Robert, a recent Merit America graduate, said in the NYTimes: “It’s the American dream stuff that didn’t seem feasible for me until now.”   👉Here are some of the benefits of our programs: ✅$0 upfront cost. You’re only responsible for payment if you land a job with a $40,000 annual salary or higher. No questions asked. ✅Flexible & part-time. Courses are designed for working, busy adults. Classes take 15-20 hours per week for 14 weeks. ✅Get skills employers want. We've identified the specific skills you need to get a new career in tech. ✅On-going career services. Merit America offers coaching, career services, and connections to local employers, all focused on helping you get a new job in tech. ✅Quick & easy application.  It takes just 5 minutes to submit your online application. No Bachelor's degree is required.  You can read about us in The New York Times or CNBC, or watch one of our graduate’s success stories featured by Grow with Google.   This is your chance, and you’re ready.   🚨Apply today🚨 FAQs  How long does the application take? The initial application takes no more than 5 minutes.  When does the program start? The next cohort begins in May, 2021. Applications will be accepted until May 1st, 2021.  What are the applicant requirements to be accepted for this training? - Applicants must have a high school diploma or GED, but no Bachelor’s degree. While those with Associate’s degrees are welcome to apply, those with a Bachelor’s degree or who are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program are not eligible unless your graduation date was over 5 years ago and you're currently unemployed or underemployed. - You are a fluent English speaker, reader, and writer. - You are authorized to work in the U.S. and able to pass a background and reference check. - You are savvy using modern technology with consistent internet access through your personal devices or nearby public spaces (e.g., libraries, coffee shops).  Is there an age limit? We do not have an age limit and welcome all adults with a GED or High School diploma to apply.  What type of IT jobs are graduates qualified for? Graduates will have the business and technology skills to pursue rewarding careers as IT support professionals. Specific job titles include: Help Desk Technician, Computer User Support Specialist, Computer Network Support Specialist, Technology Coordinator, and more.  Am I guaranteed a job? Merit America cannot guarantee employment. Graduates who are not offered a position will receive support from Merit America to identify other career opportunities leveraging their new skills. Merit America coaches and employer placement teams work with each graduate to support their job placement goals.

Description: Developer (Consultant)   Location: Remote  Compensation: TBD, This is a contract position.  You will sign a consulting agreement and be paid a per diem rate.  COMPANY OVERVIEW:  Focal Front, LLC is an early-stage SaaS provider and technology consulting firm that assists asset management firms with realizing greater return-on-investment (ROI) from their existing mission-critical business systems.  Our Focal Front software is a specialty Business Intelligence (BI) solution which facilitates data discovery and analysis of one of a company's most precious assets - it's data.  Using our Focal Front application software clients experience measurable gains in operational efficiency, improved decision-making abilities, and achieve more favorable business outcomes.    WE NEED YOU:  We are searching for the right candidate to join us at our primary client: a large, technologically progressive hedge fund based in midtown Manhattan.  We are looking to bring the right candidate on board to help deliver the highest quality software systems. This candidate will be a rock solid, mid- to senior-level developer who has the ability to work independently and adapt to the environment as it evolves.  The right candidate takes pride in his or her work and possesses excellent problem solving and communication skills.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  • Deliver the highest quality technical solutions with efficient time-to-market   • Participate in full life-cycle software development • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively • Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering • Write clean, tested, and well-documented code  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  • Expert C# .NET Framework • Building .NET Web Applications and APIs • ServiceStack • JQuery, Node.js • NServiceBus, Messaging Patterns • SQL Server • Unit Testing (NUnit or MSpec)  • Systems Integration Experience  • TeamCity • Continuous Integration/Deployment  DESIRABLE SKILLS:  • F# experience • Wall Street Office knowledge • Investran API knowledge • Bloomberg Integration experience

platforms Works with Enterprise Architecture team and assists in development of policies for standardizing systems, development tools and security practices Provides expertise and guidance for the
